description:
El Farolito without the long wait? A place to actually sit and enjoy your burrito without people hovering? A place to park? Um, yes!!! 

We each got Carde asada super burritos just like we do at the more popular El Farolito in Mission and it was just as good! The super burrito comes with guac, sour cream, cheese, and salsa for an extra dollar and is so worth it. 

This El Farolito is a bit further away for us but if we are nearby we will def be back!
author: Michele L.

description:
Came here for lunch and got the $14.65 (includes tax) carne asada plate.

It's a huge plate that comes with:

-well-seasoned, thin beef slabs
-grilled green onions
-ok refried beans with a sprinkle of cheese on top
-ok rice
-fresh salad (lettuce, tomato, avocado, and way too much sour cream)
-hot! corn tortillas

The beef was pretty tender, so it was easy to cut with the plastic knife they give you. But the green onions were a pain to cut. The refried beans and rice were just ok - I highly suggest slapping some salsa on it. (In order of my favorite: red salsa, salsa verde, and pico)

The salad had fresh, crisp veggies, but it was unfortunately covered in sour cream. I scooped off most of the sour cream and it was fine.

I couldn't finish the whole thing, so I took about 1/2 of it to-go. 

Service was quick & guy at counter was super nice!
author: Jessica C.

description:
Go to late night after drinking spot. I always get the carnitas Super quesadilla and it never lets me down. The chips are crunchy and the salsa is on point. This place seems to always be busy, but service is quick and efficient. 

My friend got the shrimp super burrito and gave me a bite and it was delicious too. 

One day I will go here before midnight and try it out. Is it just the pre-food drinks that make this place awesome or is it really just that good? Will find out soon.
author: Joanne T.

description:
Oh, El Farolito! Such a Bay Area staple! Who can resist coming here in the wee hours of the morning for some of them street tacos?! Well, I sure in the hell can't! Buuut I'm sorry to say... this location just ain't all that it's cracked up to be. Well, at least not anymore?! Maybe I came on a bad night but the last time that I was here, the tacos were just alright.
 
Last time I was here, I was craving for some steak tacos. I got four of those bad boys because I was being greedy, but I literally could only finish two. One thing that isn't lacking here is portion size! They stuff their tacos to the max with meat and one taco is really more like two. The salsa here is BOMBSY! Their green salsa and pico de gallo are heaven! Chips and salsa are complimentary with your order and they have salsa bar where you can load up on that bomb ass salsa! Despite all of this, my experience was just meh.
 
The workers looked exhausted and didn't seem like they wanted to really be there. The inside was pretty dirty with several tables that were cluttered with all kinds of trash and half eaten food. The chips were stale and the steak on my tacos this time around had minimal flavor. Even after dousing them in that good ol' salsa, something was still lacking for me. And don't let me even get started on that bathroom... yikes. With the kind of business that they get here, you would at least think that they would try to upkeep the cleanliness.
 
Overall, it's a dependable source for late night eats, but I would probably just go to their main location next time if it's not a hassle to get there.
author: Shayla B.

description: Authentic Mexican, so you should enjoy eating the entire pollo: grissle, ligaments.  You can get another kind of meat, otherwise you can swallow each bite of pollo like a pill, or choose to spit out in front of your friends, but if the later bring a napkin and maybe employ some kind of loose rhythm.
author: Jon B.

description: BEST EVER! they gave me lots of meat on my carne asada tacos and the staff is friendly and fast! although tacos were a lot spicier than I would like! cash only of course there is an ATM just outside to the left! overall dope swag experience at El Farolito:))
author: Alyssa J.

description: The super burrito is good but it could use more sauce. The red sauce is veerryyy spicy so I recommend the green sauce. Overall, it is open late so it's the perfect place to feed the hunger.
author: Instafamishe D.

description: One of my favorite taquerias. So gooooood!! Their super burritos are HUGE, enough for two meals. Tacos are bomb and the super tacos are a little small in my opinion.
author: Emily H.

description:
--CASH ONLY -- 
Top three Mexican food places in San Francisco!! I had two chicken tacos and a carne asada burrito (LOL I was actually supposed to be prepping for a juice cleanse OOPS). The crunchy taco was missing half the shell but it was still super good! So much lettuce and sour cream, I was in love. The soft chicken tacos was soooo well marinated. Finally-zee burrito. Also so good!! I got the supreme. Relatively cheap for all of the things in it (avocado, sour cream, etc). The salsa was good too, as was the horchata. I hate when my horchata gets all gritty -_- this one was perfect! I will be back :)
author: Tilly D.

description: The legendary El Faralito! Nice to finally meet you. Your super suiza is incredible, stuffed with meat, avo and cheese. I felt a heart attack coming and if it really did, it would be worth it.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Surprised with the many good reviews this place has because it is really known for being one of the worst El Farolito in SF. 
Their burritos are relative small for the price they'd charge, definitely small than the other locations. 

I went in today and let me tell you there was no one in line, so ofc the service was fast. However, when receiving my burrito I notice that the cheese wasn't melted, I but into it and felt the cheese in it's normal form and cold ofc. 
My bf went to complain about it but they were stalling on us like they didn't want to fix it, when my bf kept insisting they literally grabbed the burrito and just heated it in the microwave. Then they were literally giving the burrito unwrapped to my bf, when he told them to wrap it again since that is how we handed it to them. 

He comes back and tells me that they put it in the microwave and I tried to just eat it but could not come to it because there was sour cream and avocado in it, and I could not believe they just threw the burrito inside the microwave when it has that in it. 

My bf went back to tell them about it and they literally told us that they would rather give us our money back then make us another burrito. 

Give them 2 stars instead of one, although they really deserve just one, because they at least gave me my money back. 

Won't be coming here again
author: Nicole M.

description: One of my favorite Mexican restaurants. Their food is amazing and the prices are very reasonable. It's always packed at night, but lines move pretty quickly.
author: Natalie M.

description: When it comes to burritos there's not too many places that can beat this one! This is like in my top two for sure! Carnitas burrito or quesadilla every single time! Check it out and prepare to be amazed! There's no parking lot, so look for parking. Also prepare for a line. Definitely check this place out!
author: Brennen D.

description: This location definitely beats the one on 24th st. Good food, open late, friendly staff, spacious with lots of seating, AND an open condiments bar.
author: Anita H.

description: I absolutely love Mexican food. And after eating here I cannot go to any other place. My favorites are their green avocado salsa, carnitas burrito, and steak quesadilla. I highly recommend trying this place out. You will not regret it.
author: Linz C.

description:
I got the super quesadilla and it was sooo deliciously greasy! It won't be good without the grease. The meat (steak) was so tender and flavorful. The avocado was fresh and the cheese just melted everything together! The tortilla was also perfectly crispy and the whole thing was extremely flavorful! Definitely something I wouldn't eat all the time but it satisfied my cravings! 

The service is good and the line goes by quickly. It isn't exactly the most clean place but not bad if you just came to eat.
author: Joyce S.

description:
One of my go to Mexican places. I always get their burritos or quesadillas. Love the carne asada and their carnitas ! The portions are very generous for around $10. And they give you free chips which tastes so delicious with their avocado based salsa. Half a burrito usually keeps me full. Plus they're open late so you can fulfill those late night cravings. 
Love this location over the 24th&mission because it's closer to my house plus lines are always shorter ! Parking is difficult, I usually park in the residential areas and walk over.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Bruh, free chips and salsa.

Parking: Street

Price: prepare to spend about $8 per person depending on what you order.

Food:
Them burritos are what they're known for but man, that's way too much for me.
I love the quesadillas because they're so oily, cheesy, and delicious.
I'd go for the tacos again. I prefer non-super tacos.

Service:  Fast food style joint. Don't expect cleanliness.

Overall, I would come here again for the tacos. Don't let the joint across the street trick you!
author: Krystle T.

description: This one is the closest El Farolito to me and it will do, but the 24th and Mission one has my heart and my stomach. The super burrito is good here and decently priced. However, I feel like this location skimps on the goods compared to the other locations. If I really need it, I will come here, but 24th all the way. Guadalajara across the street is alright, these two specific locations go hand in hand for me.
author: Eva C.

description:
Not sure why I never wrote a review for this place. I prefer this location over the other one. 

My go-to place for the best tacos ever (soft corn tortillas)! 

I can't resist the super taco (comes with cheese, guacamole and sour cream) $4.40. And gotta have 2 of their regular tacos, $3.10. Best with carne asada but the chicken is pretty good too. 

He loves their burrito--rice, beans, salsa and chicken. $7.95. Get the super if you want cheese, guacamole and sour cream ($1.00 more.) 

Prices = reasonable to moderate. Depends in what you're wanting and how much of it. 

Seating = plenty of 4-tops/booths and a few 2-tops. Know when the rush is.

Service = order at the counter. Get your salsa (I love the green one--tomatillos FTW), plasticware and wait for your number to be called. 

Parking = street. Good luck. Public transit might be best.
author: Fannie S.

description: You have no idea how guilty I felt crossing the street and making my way over to El Farolito for some quesadillas. I've been faithful to guads across the street for years, but wanted to try this place out again. Went with their super quesadilla and decided to compare their carne asada. It was good, but I still prefer guads when it comes to carne asada, it's more tender and flavorful. However, their super quesadilla hit all the right spots when you're hankering for some greasy mexican food. It was a large portion, extra cheesy, and had large slices of avocado. Service was quick, I was in and out within 5 minutes! My preference for my local taqueria still holds true, tacos and quesadillas at el farolito, burritos (specifically carne asada) at guads.
author: Christene M.

description: My favorite Mexican restaurant!!! I highly recommend 10/10 !  I always get a super burrito de carne asada
author: Maria V.

description:
I decided to give them another chance after they messed up my order twice.

They have left out my guacamole/avocado 3 times now in my super burrito!  I specifically said, "no sour cream".  The cashier wrote down "No S/C" on my order. HOWEVER, upon receiving my order, the burrito was missing guacamole.

This is really unacceptable. I will not be returning to this location.  I've given you multiple chances now, and you've disappointed each time.
author: Ken H.

description: WTF $12.64 for two tiny fish tostadas? I usually pay $3.50 or $4 as the most at La Corneta, Vallarta or other taquerias in the Mission district. These ones were just average and to make things worse I could not watch the soccer match on TV because the only screen available is tiny and far from the tables. I always enjoy El Farolito a lot, but the last time wasn't as good as the previous visits.
author: Sylvester C.

description:
Late night eats after a night of drinking? That's how I messed up here. I ordered a super burrito with carne asada and lengua. It wasn't that great, and the meat tasted old. 

Maybe I'm just spoiled from the Mexican food in OC and SD, but this spot did not hit the spot. Their chips and salsa were pretty good though.
author: Vy T.

description: This is your good, basic, autentico Mexican food, everything I want in a taqueria. It is unassuming, well-priced, and the super tacos are inhalably good. Horchata spot on. Great chips and salsa. Best of all is the guy at the register was genuinely friendly and hospitable, and the other employees are super cool, too. Respect breeds respect, and they get it. We sorely need places like this to survive in SF. Viva El Farolito! 5 stars for being exactly what it should be for what it is for what you pay for.
author: James C.

description:
Dang Gina....where have u been hiding, u saucy little minx?! I have hated on Farolito for so long cuz they have what I call "fake chips" but I came here hammered the other night and got a wet burrito and then also a tostada de ceviche (cuz when you're drunk, prices and calories mean nothing, if anything: the higher the better) so I got home and I dumped the cup of ceviche out onto the dank-azz tostada and holy-Christmas if there wasn't MORE THAN 2 tostadas worth of ceviche. Bomb. So bomb. This was at like 10:30 at night and was so fresh and delicious.  

I cut into the wet burrito and it was aggressively delicious. I ate less than half and went to bed a happy happy girl. Came home from work the next day...wait did I just admit to going out drinking on a work night?...it was an isolated incident. Anyway, the next day after work I had the second half for dinner and couldn't even finish it. So huge and so delicious. Salsa was pretty good, chips are my my fave but they did the job. Service is 10/10.
author: Emma H.

description:
2 Taqueria to choose from across the street from each other, yay for competition.  I live near this neighborhood, and appreciate having places to go for a late night eats in this city.

Chose El Farolito tonight, and ordered a lengua super burrito. They give you a free side dish of chips.  There's green, red and spicy sauces for dips. Lemon slices also available.  Ate with gusto - it was fine and balanced.  Didn't get diarrhea- great.

The two places have similar pricing and seating is plentiful.  Unisex restroom was clean.
author: Drew B.

description: Bomb food. SF prices but like whatever, i guess. i shouldn't be eating out anyway.  Cute ass cashier who is also an amazing kisser. Sometimes there is a long line, always worth it. Screenshot their info cause you will probably get baked, want a taco, and they're open late AF. Enjoy.
author: Christopher A.

description: Honestly this place is my go to spot for a burrito! I always get the super burrito with carne asada and it always hits the spot! They pack so much meat in their burritos and their green salsa really tops everything off.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in sf! Their prices are decent for the portion size. Usually the line is really long but this time I came in at 3am on a Friday and there was no wait. Yelp says they close at 3:30am but they were definitely still taking orders after 3:30 (maybe they're a little flexible with their hours?). 
I usually get the super burrito and it's big enough for two meals! They also have complimentary chips and salsa! The salsa was super spicy one time, but the salsa verde is always good. 
My most recent visit I got the carne asada regular burrito ($7.15), which is filled with meat, rice, beans and salsa. It was great but way too spicy for some reason. I've never had an issue with the spiciness level before. My boyfriend got the al pastor tacos and thought they were excessively spicy too. Maybe just the batch for salsa for that day was too spicy. I still enjoyed my meal and will definitely be back!
author: Emily L.

description:
Delicious, decently priced, and stays open late? You got me! 

I recommend the super taco and super quesadilla. Portion is plentiful and that avocado is so fresh! 

Sucks that parking is so terrible on Mission. Staff is pretty friendly even late at night. It gets cold in there so make sure you dress warm if you're looking to dine in!
author: Kristi T.

description:
PROS
- Good Portions
- Not Overpriced
- Delicious

CONS
- Parking
- Constant Long Lines


After enjoying three hours at the Academy of Science Nightlife, my cousin and I were starving and looking for a good burrito spot.. then she remembered El Farlitos, a place she used to frequent growing up.

Parking was a pain for me, especially not being from the city.. but after circling twice, we found a spot across the street.

There is plenty of seating, but for a Thursday night, the line was almost always to the door during our time there.  Line moves at a decent pace, wait is a bit longer.. but worth it in my opinion!

A super burrito for less than $10, with cheese, cilantro and onions without having to have salsa was awesome!  I normally have to skip on the guac and salsa due to allergies, and the salsa is usually premixed and I miss out on the good stuff.

There are canned and glass bottled sodas.  Chips are given at the register and salsa bar to the side of it.  They have Horchata and other drinks

I will definitely be on the look out for a closer El Farlito because their taste has officially hit my palette and made its mark!!


What I've Ordered
- Super Burrito, Carnitas
(choice of meat, rice, choice of beans, cilantro, cheese, sour cream, onion, sans: salsa, guac)
author: Sandy S.

description:
Decent place to get a quick bite to eat.  They serve beer which is cool and they never rush you to leave so it's a nice place to chill and have a bit to eat while your waiting for someone or have some time to kill.  

I like sitting  at the window and people watching.  Quite entertaining
author: Riley M.

description: I've been going to the El Farolito on Mission and 24th for late night snacks for 3 decades. It's always crowded after the bars close and never disappoints. Don't be intimidated by the crowd, these guys are professionals and you'll be indulging in spicy goodness in no time. If you're craving fast, delicious Mexican food late night, join that line, find a table and eat what the locals know will satisfy.
author: James B.

description: Their chips aren't good as it is, then they have nerve to serve stale chips with nachos and there's so much fat in the meat. Nothing taste fresh. I threw my whole order away today and will never go back.
author: Monica V.

description: The tacos al pastor on this place are incredible good. I always have to come back to eat some of those at this place
author: Ashley P.

description:
I've been coming here for the past 9 years now and it's my favorite taqueria place! 

Two super burritos + horchata + strawberry agua fresca + free chips & salsa = $25 including tax and the bag 

The drinks are refreshing after pigging down on the burritos. I do think that the carne asada meat may not be fresh so I've been getting chicken nowadays. But either way, it's still a fantastic burrito. 

Parking can be a hassle around this neighborhood because of many food joints and schools nearby. The cleanliness can be an issue...  but that doesn't stop me from getting a burrito.
author: Sarah F.

description: Been going here since I was a kid everything on the menu is beyond good. Something about that carne asada though it has such a unique flavor that will get you pheaning for more. Horchata is always good and they do accept credit cards!!
author: Carlos Z.

description:
Let me just start this review by saying I'm personally not the biggest fan of Mexican food but this place blew my socks off! Definitely a hole in the wall Mexican restaurant. 

I got a super burrito and I swear it was the best burrito I have ever had. The rice was soft and the meat was juicy. Everything worked really well together and nothing was so overpowering. And I also liked how they wrapped the burrito in foil so nothing would fall apart and it made it easy to cut in half.

In addition to the amazing food they also give you complimentary chips and salsa bar. The red salsa is actually really spicy gives everything a nice kick.

Only complaint is that the tables were a little small but over all 10/10 would come back!
author: Kathy N.

description: The beef tongue regular burrito was good.  I had to take away one star because it was too spicy for me.  If you don't mind spicy then I'm sure you would love their burritos, but if you're like me and can't take any spicy at all then I would not recommend it because I only ate half because it was too spicy for me.
author: P G.

description: The best authentic Mexican foid ! Everything is good here !! Order every taco and nachos
author: Kristin V.

description: Used to be my go to spot until I got food poisoning TWICE. Now I go across the street for my burritos.
author: Reigil P.

description: So sad, to give this taquria 1 start but after geting the worst Customer service ever was not ever worth coming back! My firend and I was CHARGED 23.00$ for TWO SMALL TACOS and THEY REFUSE TO GIVE US A REFUND! Sad part the cashier just ignore my firend and I. Worst part she acted like she did not understand us and talk mad shit in spanish, never got our FOOD OR REFUND
author: Stacy B.

description: The meat is pretty good here, but I'm not a fan of the rice or the fact that they put too much in my burrito. It's still a go to for a quick burrito fix!
author: Jenn N.

description: I ordered the super quesadilla and it was so good! It came in two pieces and I was only able to eat half. Very filling. I also love their pico de gallo that they offer with the chips. It was very spicy, just the way I like it. Their frescas are also good. I ordered the strawberry flavored one. I believe each day they have different flavors.
author: Annie H.

description: Late night munchies spot. Love the super quesadillas, tacos, and strawberry aguas fresca. Love the salsa/sauce station. Love that it's opened late! Been coming here for almost a decade.
author: Tina S.

description: BURRITOES ARE TO DIE FOR HERE! I really love the flavor and the sauce was so good. The line was a bit long but that's because I came on a Friday. They're open late which is super convenient. It's bomb drunk food
author: Kimmy M.

description: The workers here are rude. I accidentally bumped into a man(50 year old) in line and started insulting me like I didn't say sorry, which I did. The workers there proceeded to justify him agreeing to everything he was saying about a 17 year old girl and proceeded to be racist. Very misogynistic and rude. The food also isnt great like the taqueria across the street.
author: Bob B.

description: Got the nachos and they were good, not the best but good. I was hesitant because I am picky when it comes to chips.  What I can rave about is the green salsa, wow it's nice and spicy!
author: Celina A.

description:
It's not the nicest decor inside but my god who cares because the food is so good. Tonight was my first time going here sober and the food satisfies just as much as a night after drinking. I got one super taco one normal
taco and I kept mentioning to my boyfriend how I was in heaven. He got a suiza and gave me a bite also A+ I love how they do their quesadillas. Definitely my favorite Mexican food in the area. We'll be back!
author: Geena G.

description: This is my fast Quick Fix nail when I don't want to cook and I don't want my wife to cook. So here I am standing in line right now talking out a review into my phone. Yes, I'm in line because the lines are so long here. And there's a reason for it. The food is awesome. And, of course the food And, of course the food is not only reasonably priced but delicious. It's a mixed crowd over here. Wealthy and the Not So wealthy. Everybody gets treated the same. That's why I like this place.
author: Miguel C.

description: I don't understand how you're gonna have on you're menu lengua and cabeza as separate meat choices, but then when you're employee brought our "lengua burrito" it's mixed with lengua and Canada. That doesn't make no sense to me. It's either you make it with just lengua or you make it with just cabeza, but if you're gonna mix them then y'all gotta put the right advertisement. I wish I could put no stars to be honedt. Doesn't make one smidgen of sense to me what so ever. Talk about false advertisement and wrong menu items.
author: Erick R.

description: Gross. Go to Guadalajara across the street which is way better. Steak was flavorless. Chips are wood chip flavor. The shrimp looked good but wouldn't gamble it, with so many other options.
author: Jenny C.

description: SO good. One of the best Mexican restaurants in town. Watch out though they're only cash only and I recommend the shrimp quesadilla!!
author: Lucia B.

description:
El Farolito is one of those must tries while in San Francisco, but I was really not blown away.
Coming from SoCal maybe I am just used to a different style Mexican food, but it did not blow me away.
Cash only and really busy, plan to wait a bit, though the lines moves quickly.
Service was nice and while the quesadilla was pretty good and the only thing worth getting again, the burritos fell flat.
We all went with the al pastor which was ok, but again I have had better.
Prices and portions are fair, this makes for great drunk or hangover food, but for a normal lunch or dinner I would not bother to return.
author: Nijole T.

description: Ordered two burritos from postmates-regular carne asada and super al pastor. Although it was a bit spicy it was pretty darn good. This place is always consistent and thank goodness for delivery because parking (for me) is always a b@&$tch at all locations. I've only gotten burritos there but heard their quesadillas are good too. Can't wait to try their other stuff.
author: W W.

description: This has been my go to spot for burritos since 2012 when my friend first brought me here. There is the more well known location located on 24th street and mission but I personally prefer this one because it's bigger and not as crowded. The only downside is that it's tad far for more as it is in the inner mission but whenever I need that burrito fix, I come here. Nothing is more worth it than getting a super burrito with chips and unlimited salsa for under $10. Seriously doesn't get better than that anywhere else as the prices in San Francisco is rising so for them to remain their low prices is truly amazing. I recommend their super burritos because it gets you super full for two people even if you think you eat a lot, trust me, you will get satisfied with only half of this deliciousness.
author: Lisa W.

description:
This is the spot. Food is so on point! 

My favorite meats to choose are carne asade and al pastor. I always get tacos with extra cilantro. There tacos are served on two corn tortillas, your meat of choice, cilantro, onion and hot sauce. They have other selections of tacos but the original is the best. It's definitely a must try because it's simple but flavorful. 

I always come here and it never disappoints. Strawberry agua fresca is great to wash everything down.
author: Tina Y.

description:
I can clear beef plates, plural, when eating shabu.
I can stuff myself with tots; preferably crispy ones.
I can eat a whole cantaloupe; because I don't want to share.
But I cannot will not attempt to eat a burrito. I just can't.

3 tacos (carne asada, carnitas, lenguas) - Good in size and quality.  Honestly, I couldn't tell which meat was what but they were all very good.  

Hooray for the free chips and dip!
author: Linda N.

description: This is the place to go for wet burrito omg, the first time I came to this place on order the wet burrito my taste bud are just so happy, thank you to my hubby for bringing me in this delicious place. Burrito is huge, I git mix meat lengua and carnitas is much flavor, they marinaded the meat so well. Love it so much that every time we are at mission area it's the place that we go to eat if we are craving for authentic taqueria hhhmmmm yummy. Highly recommended yelpers if want Mexican food. 2 thumbs up.
author: Lyn D.

description: Food here is great. Even better because it stays open SUPER late. Yelp says 1:30 am but we lived right next store and they stay open as long as people are there. I've gotten tacos at 3 am before after the bars. It's amazing!! Super taco  !!
author: Katlyn H.

description:
I'm born and raised in San Francisco. So if you want good Mexican food I would check out La Corneta, La Mission or Papalotes. My wife wanted to know why this place was rated so high and had over a thousand reviews...so I decided to take her here for lunch. This place sucks! The chips are always salty, $3.10 for a carne asada taco with no taste?! You've got to be kidding me. Ok, great they give you free chips and salsa and it's open until 2-3am...if you plan to come here after the club expect long lines. Other then that poor taste in Mexican food. 

Quality over Quantity!!
author: Brian B.

description: After La Taqueria this is my 2nd favorite burrito spot in SF & have been coming here for years. Open super late and even later on the weekends. For freshness; quality, consistency and free chips this is the place. Come hungry, leave happy and full.
author: Everette R.

description:
Nicely cut in half super burrito. Bf says we were supposed to get guacamole/avocado inside but there wasn't. Maybe it was almost midnight so they ran out. 
Burrito flavor was just okaaaay. Free chips and salsa. 
Pros: wasn't greasy and soggy  


Parking was terrible here. People temporarily park on the MTA spots
author: Amy V.

description: One of my favorite burrito places in SF! What's better is how close it is to  where I live. Great burritos, great seating, great salsa. I highly recommend El Farolito.
author: AK _.

description: This place kinda looks like a hole, well looks can be deceiving cause it was hands down the best Mexican food I've ever had! I got the Quesadilla and it was so flavorful and cheesy, mmm I think this place ruined me for Mexican food anywhere else. Give it a whirl if you're in SF but Cash Only!
author: Jake M.

description: I ordered a quesadilla but they gave me a burrito instead, but I waited less than 5 minutes. 4 stars.
author: Anthony M.

description: I never had any issues with any employee of El Farolito over 25 years of patronizing all three locations. The food quality is consistent.
author: John W.

description:
El farolito employees are the worst! It seems like they dont like their job or if they work as volunteers and don't get paid, their client-care is really poor. The food is expensive. 
I try not to eat there
author: Daniel E.

description: BEST DARN BURRITOS, QUESADILLAS, AND TACOS EVER!! Everything is bomb dot com!! I always order a cup of horchata with whatever it is that I order to eat. Inside the looks of the setting isn't attractive much, but don't let that turn you down from ordering something to munch on, because if you do you're just missing out. Another plus is this joint opens up into the late wee hours. So with that said head out of your house, into your car, drive on down, and order something off their menu.
author: Tina L.

description: Came here as a last stop before leaving San Fran. This place is a truly authentic Mexican place-having such classics such as the Lengua (beef tongue) and Cabeza (beef cheek) taco. Both cuts of meat were tender as could be and paired wonderfully with the authentic salsa verde and cilantro. None of that Americanized corn and other fillings to be found, just pure meat and sauce. If you don't care much for ambiance but enjoy good food, come here!
author: Chris H.

description:
There's something unforgettable, impossible to duplicate, and unbearably amazing about the taste of El Farolito food. I'm not sure what it is, but you just can't stop yourself from moaning "mmmmhmmm" and saying "DAMN! This is sooo good!" every time  you take that first big delicious bite of an El Farolito burrito. That's just the way it is.

If you don't know what I'm talking about, then get your butt here and order a carne asada super burrito, tear into that first bite - oh and don't forget the salsas... mmm salsa..... ugh, my mouth is watering just writing this review... Some day I'll actually try something that's not a burrito or a quesadilla suiza... some day...
author: Acid B.

description: Burritos burritos burritos!!! Steak, shrimp, chicken...whatever you prefer, you will be pleased.  Their free sAlsa bar is great.  Just wish their chips were legit mexican style chips.
author: Nazanin R.

description:
There's really nothing much to write.....because it's EL FAROLITO. 

The BEST steak and cheese quesadillas and burritos. They're open super late night which is awesome!!!!!!! 

The workers are also friendly which is nice.
author: Amanda R.

description:
This is the best burrito flavor We had tried, so far, we keep going there often, they have that tomatillo salsa flavor. A little pricey now days after the minimum salary increase, in less than 8 years, (found a receipt in my drawer) from $6.50 back then to $9.50 now, but flavor is better than other Farolito taquerias.
Alambres are also one of our favorites, we used to have some left overs in the past but now the new containers, there is nothing left and like I said before, pricey, $13.50 ? But again very flavorful, chips and salsa and water are free with purchase.
Usually only one tv works but we usually go there for a short time or order to go on the phone and they always greet you with "Primo" (cousin) that is use regularly in many places in Mexico. They always ask if you are ordering to the cross street "Onondaga" because if the other Farolito taquerias in the city.
When we have visits, that's the place to go for a variety of dishes and tacos. I recommended this place.
author: Frank V.

description: I've been coming to El Farolito ever since middle school....this has always been my favorite go to place in the city. Not anymore.....recently the customer service has gotten horrible! The 2 male cooks  (The big tall guy and the short guy with the shaved head) and the female cashier (Who pops her gum at everyone) are the worst employees ever and seriously need to check their attitudes. They are constantly messing up peoples orders, which honestly comes off as if they do it on purpose. So when I went last night I ordered a super burrito with avocado but when I get home and start eating my food once again there was no avocado in my super burrito. That's not what made me write this yelp, I'm leaving this yelp because I also ordered a super quesadilla and come to my surprise I don't have a super quesadilla but a regular burrito instead! When calling to tell them what happened, of course there was no answer.  I'm seriously done with this place.....over 20 years of coming here but never again after last night.
author: S. R.

description:
Compared to the experienced I had at the 24th Street location, this was a whole new level.

Overall the burrito was great though felt the beans and rice ratio to meat was high.

Regular burrito was 7.15 plus tax
author: Nathan A.

description:
"I'm hungry," said my friend. I peered over to the top corner of my phone screen, and it said 12:10 AM. So we did what any sensible San Franciscan would do: we Ubered to El Farolito.

When they say the city truly comes alive at night, they're not joking. As soon as we walked in we exchanged nods with a security guard. The long line (which went all the way to the door) was filled with some peculiar characters: college students, the aspiring rapper, and a couple with a little bit too much PDA. 

Despite that, the line went by really fast. Every 30 seconds, a bell would ring, signifying the creation of a new burrito, or quesadilla, or tacos...or whatever the previous person ordered. Now let's talk about the nitty gritty. 

Ambience Rating (2.5/5):
This place is super hole-in-the-wall. The booths, tables, and chairs feel quite old. I made a fatal mistake of wearing my pajamas. Let's just say I wouldn't recommend wearing the same clothes to bed after sitting in one of their booths. The busboy did however meticulously wipe the tables after each consequential meal. If you decide to eat at the restaurant, they bring the food to your table. A large TV in the corner of the dining room played live soccer (or football).

Food Rating (5/5):
Listen folks: there's a reason why this place is filled at midnight. The food is delicious. Make sure to get the "super" variant of whatever food you're getting. I think that it basically just adds meat and a few other things. While I was waiting for my food, I was given tortilla chips. In a corner was a salsa bar where you could grab from to your heart's content.  

I'll focus on what I got, which was the "Super Quesadilla." When I took my first bite, I knew at that moment that the wait had been worth it. There was a crunchy and soft texture, and the cheese was literally melting in my mouth. The finely cut pieces of steak and occasional chunk of guacamole was glorious. At the end of my meal, I was filled and greatly satisfied. 

Did I mention that this was all for under $10? 

Summary: 
Just stop reading my review and go to El Farolito. Right now. They care about you, they care about their food, they're open late, they're super cheap, and the food is deliciously filling.
author: Lan P.

description: I didn't know that I was spoiled with bomb ass burritos all my life until I left for college. The carne asada super burrito never disappoints! I've been coming here for over 10 years, and for some reason-- it seems like the burritos get even tastier every time I come back... Is that even possible?
author: Karen M.

description: I got the super burrito w/ carne asada here. It was very good and filling.  I couldn't even finish it!  The pico de gallo was also really good.  A little too spicy for my gringo butt although manageable =P .  I liked the strawberry fresca, too.  It reminded me of those popsicles.   My only wish would be that the actual establishment itself gets a little cleaner for 5 stars.
author: Eric L.

description: Favorite taqueria ever. Super quesadilla suiza will change your life. The salsa verde? Amazing.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
My usual spot for laaaaaate night taco & burrito missions. The Carnitas and Pollo Asada are my go to options and the Carne Asada is on point as well. The lines can be long at times, especially after the bars in the area shout out for last call and the crowds spill onto Mission street. Regardless, the food will assist you in your ever lasting quest to sober up and then continue to party. 

Make sure to get your Salsa Verde on as it's one of the best options at the salsa bar. There are at least 6 options to satisfy your desires. This location is far less busy than the 24th and Mission restaurant so let's keep that on the down low... (just between us). Quesadilla's are stuffed and also well worth the money.

Just do yourself, and the rest of the people in line behind you a huge favor...  Please make sure you speak clearly and concisely, and tip the staff once your order has been placed, as they have probably already served enough people in their shift to be ready at the drop of a dime to let you know how they really feel about you stuttering and swaying side to side while trying to collect your thoughts and make a conscious decision on what you and your comrades asked you to order for them before you stepped in the door. Good luck!
author: Josh H.

description:
This was always my go-to for late night Mexican. They're open until 3am. 

The line can get pretty long at night, but they make your food pretty quickly. I usually order a carne asada quesadilla suisa. The tortilla is toasted to perfection with a generous amount of meat! Huge portions with plenty to take home for next-day leftovers. My friends always opt for burritos and enchiladas- I'm not really a big fan of either.

The employees are kinda creepy but who cares? They make a mean quesadilla (or burrito or enchiladas or tacos, for that matter). They'll give you free chips too with a variety of different salsas.

Actually, any time of the day is perfect for El Farolito's!

Street parking is only available, but it's not too bad. The interior is a bit rundown, but it's San Francisco. The best restaurants are the rundown or the hole-in-the-walls.
author: Steffi G.

description:
Love this place! Was craving a burrito, read some reviews and decided to give it a shot. Tried the el pastor super burrito and oh man, was it delicious and fairly large! 

Came in off-peak and it was still fairly crowded. There is ample seating inside for small to larger groups. The inside at this location is pretty beat down, but the food more than makes up for it. They have a salsa bar right next to the register. I will sample more items next time I eat here. I'm a fan! :)
author: Paul C.

description: This restaurant is one of the better spots to pick up a wet burrito. I usually order it with the Carne Asada, the portion is HUUGGGEEEE!!!! I can never finish one by myself. Close to my house and open late. One of my favorite places to go to satisfy my burrito cravings.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: love this place .... you really get your money's worth . Big burrito, lots of food and fast service . They guys that work there have worked for 20 + years so I know they really know how to run a business .
author: Ed P.

description: Best tacos al pastor, burritos, & carne asada!! Plus, no matter how busy they are, it's always super fast & friendly service! Thanks guys!
author: Madison V.

description: Used to go to the one on 24th occasionally, always thought it was one of the better taquerias in SF and I grew up here so I have 30 years of experience.  I recently moved to the excelsior and started going to this one, out of 5 visits they have gotten my order wrong 3 times, always at least leaving out the guac.  Today they left out the guac again, I returned after eating the burrito and was very complimentary that I love their food but I can't keep going here if they get my order wrong more than half the time, the one on 24th is way more busy and never messes up orders.  The cashier/manager explained I was wrong every time and just didn't notice the guac because they use soupy guac that is made out of more tomatoes than avocados...well even if that was the case that's not really an excuse.  But every time I've believed there's no guac, my burrito has been pure white with cheese and sour cream, not even a green tint.  The dude wasn't even willing to concede they've ever messed up, and on top of it I've gotten the same feeling some other people have, that all the employees are assholes, if you don't respond to them calling out your order like a starving dog they yell at you and mug you. They also swing the burrito over in the bag and slap it on the counter like cavemen or prison cafeteria workers.  I work in the food business and the customer is not alway right but humility and overall professionalism whether at a 5 star restaurant or a taqueria is necessary for you to get my business and tips, I don't need nice conversation or even a big smile but I don't want to feel like a criminal that owes the cafeteria a debt of gratitude just for feeding me.
author: Bill H.

description: Terrible service & crappy food! Dont even waste your time coming here. This is the second time they have gotten my order wrong. You're better off going across the street for better tasting food and better service.
author: Jasmine D.

description: Hands down best taqueria in outer mission to sunset ..... open late night 3am-ish, staff is great. Nachos, super quesadilla, super burrito are whats up - get carne asada. Rush hour seems to be 7PM-9PM. Fast and professional.
author: John O.

description: This spot's carne asada burrito isn't as tasty as the original farolito BUT there was no line when I went!! It was lunch time on a Friday so I'd choose not having to wait a long time for my food any day! The place itself is a little outdated- there are super old sticker vending machines and two basic pinball machines (you can win up to three bouncy balls all for the whopping price of 50 cents!). Anyway.. Must try the carne asada super burrito aaaand the carne asada nachos (pretty big serving size for nachos!) if you do get the nachos, eat it fast bc the chips get soggy.
author: Cherrilyn B.

description: Only place I will eat burritos! I've been eating at El Farolito since i was 5 years old. No other taquerias compare to El Farolito! Plus the burritos are huge and tasty! Only bad thing about this place it's always cold in there.
author: karen g.

description: Got the super burrito with chicken. It was baby-sized, which is great as I was super hungry. I still couldn't finish it and I'm a big eater. Their nachos and sauces was super yummy, one of them was a lot spicier than anticipated. The one negative is that I opened my burrito in the wrong end so it was kinda dry u til I got to the bottom where the sauces were hiding. Could have been marked with a marker maybe? Anyways that was my mistake. The taste was good but not great as it could probably have been if I started eating in the right end. And plus one start for calling me gringo :-) Yum!
author: Thomas S.

description:
I think I found my go-to burrito place in the city.

This is probably the top 3 burritos I had in my life.

Everything about the meal hit all the right notes.

The complimentary chips were crispy and not too oily.
The salsa (especially the green one!) had the depth of flavor that is only found in the rarest of Mexican restaurants.
The burrito was made well.
All the components of the said burrito were seasoned and prepared to near perfection.

Super happy to have discovered this place.
author: Samuel P.

description: Didn't give me my extra chips that I paid for .80 cent but there food is so good just disappointed didn't get it
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Was back home in SF for the Niner game last weekend and one of the things I promised my friends that were flying in from LA is that I'd take them to get their first mission burrito... and for me, that means El Farolito. They are the standard... I picked them up from the airport and asked them what they wanted to do and it was to get some burritos. HA! Yess..

Headed to the Mission. Found parking fairly quickly on Mission St. not too far from El Farolito. I went with a regular carnitas burrito opting for no cilantro. It was delicious... Just as I remember. Full of flavor and perfectly rolled, double wrapped in foil to consume in the restaurant or on the run. The rice was tasty and the carnitas was smoky pork perfection. I loved it... It was good to be back in the Mission enjoying some El Farolito. My other friend got a chorizo burrito and the other got a carne asada suiza quesadilla. They both were very satisfied with what they ordered.

 As customary, you get some tortilla chips for your table. Self serve on the salsa. Green or red, depending on what your preference is. Service was friendly and fast. We got there around 1230pm. It wasn't too packed at the time but as soon as we sat down to eat, the line started growing... Looking forward to going back to El Farolito next time I'm in the city. It's a must stop every trip now. Next time: carne asada super burrito... no cilantro, of course.
author: Chuck D.

description:
BEST BURRITO & SHRIMP QUESADILLA 
been going to this place way back 2000 till now i can say this is still the best burrito place in San francisco and Mission
author: Prinxez L.

description:
My usual go-to taqueria is Reina's, which is a few blocks south of El Farolito. However, I've heard about how good El Farolito is, so I thought I'd give them a try and see what all the hype is about.

I tried their super tacos, one with grilled chicken and one with grilled beef. Super tacos come with cheese, sour cream, fresh avocado, onion, cilantro, and hot salsa on two warm flour tortillas. There was plenty of flavor in each bite, the hot sauce has some heat, and the fresh avocado slices are rich and buttery. The grilled chicken was really good, but I thought the beef was very dry and chewy, like jerky. Two super tacos is roughly the same price as one super burrito, and although I haven't tried their burritos yet, I'm pretty sure the satisfaction and the portion for price is more worth it for the burrito.

I also tried their super quesadilla with grilled chicken, which unfortunately, wasn't as enjoyable. The chicken was good, but the quesadilla itself was thin and small, though very cheesy. It came with avocado, but there wasn't a lot. I much prefer the super quesadilla from Taqueria Reinas.
author: Priscilla W.

description: Super nachos + super burrito = enough yummy food for three :)
author: Karen L.

description: Had this for dinner last night...Woke up today with the bathroom blues and an ache in the tummy!  Not cool.  It was definitely the pico and avocado salsa.  It looked like it was sitting there all day brewing some of that salmonella.  Last time I go here.  Guadalajara will get my business from now on.
author: Chris S.

description: I haven't been to this place in yeeeeears! I was in the area so I had to stop by. I ordered the big shrimp burrito! Mmmmm. The burrito contained a generous amount of shrimp which was a plus. The burrito overall was super flavorful and delicious! I also ordered a chile verde taco which was on point as well. The pork fell apart as soon as it hit my mouth. My food from here was so good I forgot to take a picture of my meal which is kind of odd behavior for a foodie like myself.
author: Marcus M.

description: This place sucks. They always screw up the order and food is below average. They put lettuce in the vege burritos and use gauc instead of whole avocados. Just not up to par with the other locations. Its worth the extra drive to 24th St. Also, dudes behind the counter here are all right out of prison.
author: H K.

description: Tried one of their Super burritos and was very satisfied. Those things are huge and they put a lot of meat. Definitely would come back to try other menu items.
author: Javier B.

description: I always pass by this place but never gave it a try. I finally decided to give it a try and I was definitely not disappointed. Came here on a saturday afternoon and there was a short line. I Ordered the super tacos (beef steaks and beef tongue). It was so goood and filling! They give you free chips too! Their salsa wasn't that spicy which I like. I would definitely come back and try their super burrito next time.
author: Louise C.

description: You don't come here if you want them to say hi or thank you. Because they don't. There just a bunch of mad Mexican people making food. Period.  It's average as well, so you can go across the street and get customer service and the same food, if not better.
author: Elaine v.

description:
It's 2am. Just left the lounge and I feel like sh!t for mixing Hennessy and a Moscow Mule. Where else to go to fix the feeling? 

Drunk and ready to sleep but all your friends wanna eat... Lol, the struggle is sooo real. 

Anyways what else is to describe el farolito other than they're open late and their food is ALWAYS BOMB. 

Right now I'm at the gym as I'm writing about this... Cries*
author: Crystal C.

description: the best! everyone knows this! i am rolling my eyes at the reviews that have suggested they have discovered a "hidden gem" in this "hole in the wall" because el farolito is so much of an sf institution that there's a literal meme about it. my favorite is the lengua super burrito, but the carne asada and carnitas are also pretty good . chips are no longer free but *who cares*. they also still have an open salsa bar.
author: Cailin H.

description: My #1 Mexican spot in the city. Cancun is a close second. If you're feeling like you want to through calorie caution to the wind do yourself a favor and get the quesedilla suiza. YOU'RE WELCOME
author: Negeen E.

description: great food shitty service. I always come back because I really like this place for mexican food, but service is nonexistence kinda like chinese food restaurants.
author: aaron t.

description: Came here for burritos with my friend and they were one of the best burritos I've ever had! Basically, if you love burritos you have to try this place. There was a line of people ordering when we got there but it was totally worth it.
author: Raluca R.

description: My go to for street tacos. Parking is hard because it's right on mission, but there's a good amount of seating in the restaurant. Al pastor and carne asada tacos are my go to and my bf gets the super burrito. Mexican food done well!!! Can't go wrong. And they're open late!
author: Daisy S.

description:
Perhaps nostalgia makes these burritos taste so great, but let's review what makes El farolito one of the best spots in sf for taqueria food. 

I've had probably 3 cows worth of carne asada in my life so far. El farolito does not give you burnt to a crisp, dry, sitting out for a while carne asada. It's actually moist and chewy, cooked to order. 

Parking is feasible for this location. Hint. Just north is a burger king parking lot if you go through this tiny driveway between buildings. The minimum wage employees couldn't give two fucks if you park there. Street parking is usually plentiful around. 

Super burritos are always a safe bet. Get half shrimp half carne asada. Why? It's harder to meter out half portions so you usually get more. If you're ordering a regular burrito, you're un-American, but it's still good. 

The tacos are just a bit pricy compared to locations in the mission, but the meats are good quality. Personally  I love tacos de lengua. 

Oh and don't forget the salsa bar. And get a monster cup of horchata.
author: Douglas Y.

description:
It has been many years since i've been to this place. I usually go to the one across the street but since my brother decided to go back to this place, i decided to give this place a try again

Had the regular burrito. Only difference that the regular have from the super burrito are the sour cream and guacamole which the regular don't come with. Usually i don't put the beans in my burrito but i decided to this time. Has a a little spicy taste from the salsa. The beans kinda made the burrito a little dry. Put the guacamole that i got from sauce bar for each bite give it the extra flavor and moist. Usually, i can only eat half of a burrito but for some reason, i was able to eat all of the burrito. Its either i was really hungry or they make their burrito really small.

The price is alright. $7+ for the regular burrito. I would say that its a little more expensive here when comparing to the one across the street(its a little cheaper from the mexican restaurant across the street)

They make their food quick.
author: Julie N.

description:
So I personally think the Mexican place across the street has the best burrito in SF, but for some strange reason they needed to close for 30 minutes @ 7pm Sunday night. My husband and I were bummed (actually I was devastated), and I was not looking forward to going anywhere else, but we were craving a burrito so we decided to come here. We got really lucky and there wasn't a long line (yet), but the guy taking orders was kinda rude and just stared at me waiting for me to speak. No greeting, no nothing. Anyway, I reluctantly ordered two super burritos, one with grilled chicken and the other with carne asada, and filled about five or six containers with their watery salsa. At this point I was soooooo sad that I wasn't getting my favorite burrito and did not think this one was going to even come close.

When we got home I quickly opened my burrito and started eating, and to my surprise it was good. I've had burritos from here before, but it's been a really long time, so I guess I had forgotten they weren't bad. I still think the place across the street does a better job and has a better salsa verde, but my carne asada was well cooked and there wasn't too much guacamole (I prefer avocado as opposed to guac, which may sound silly so some, but I just think it tastes better and isn't all mushy). I felt it would annoy the already irritated-looking cashier if I asked for avocado, so I said nothing and prayed I wouldn't regret it later.

Anyway, this is a solid burrito joint and I won't dread coming here if I have to. They just need work in their salsas and customer service.
author: Steph L.

description:
There is nothing much more to explain, this place gets 5 stars for me. Best Super Carne Asada burrito I've ever had the pleasure to devour. 

My favorite go to right now is the Alambres plate (extra meat). Pair that with multiple scoops of their house made green salsa and you're in for a treat. Doesn't help that this place is open super late, I've come here many a times past midnight to get my drunk grub on.
author: Eric A.

description:
This is exactly why I don't come here because the service sucks. I've gone here without my cousin told her that they don't speak English well and they don't understand your order I've got an argument with them a few times. that's why I go to the restaurant across the street or I go to the other 29th and mission where it's a little bit cheaper and the food is way better. the guy was rude argumentative try to get a new burrito then when he dug in the garbage for the receipt to see what kind of  burrito and told me to give it to my nephew oh hell no.
Did not wash his hands after digging the receipt of the garbage I don't care if you're not making burritos your touching peoples money you're touching at the register and you are touching the food if you're giving it to people that's just fucking gross. I know this is the mission but need to learn manners do not argue with your customers if you made a mistake fix it. and don't be so damn cheap with your chips one basket of chips for 4 people we ordered 4 tacos and a burrito that's just wrong. you're gone downhill won't be coming back ur customer service sux your food is good your little bit too expensive.
But ain't worth the headache or aggravation arguing with incompetent people.. There's a lot of taqueria in San Francisco what would love to have our Business.... Oh and one more thing they serve in big corn tortillas but give you a little bit of meat wow really!!! :(
author: Lizzie G.

description: The burritos are good. I got the super burrito which is basically just sour cream added in it. The workers were nice. And they made the food quick.
author: Sareen K.

description:
Saw a website that said this place was the #1 burrito place in the U.S. & in my area ? So I definitely had to try it and see it if really lived up to it's name. 

Definitely lots of customers but they're pretty quick with their orders. Plus, every order comes with free chips! Yaaasss! 

I ordered the quesadilla suiza and the super burrito I believe, both with carne asada. Both came very quickly after ordering; approximately 2-5 minutes later.. Both very jealous. I definitely recommend trying the carne asada meat with the burrito. So goooood. 

Each was about $6-$7 and they're pretty big! So definitely worth your money
author: Vernice T.

description: I have a major weakness for burritos, and this little taqueria makes a pretty damn good one! The carne asada super burrito with green and red salsas from the salsa bar always hits the spot.
author: Kristin J.

description: Like all of the el farlitos, this location has great food and prompt service. If you haven't been to an El Farlitos, you NEED to try it. If you're tried other locations, come to this one. It won't disappoint.
author: Joshua F.

description:
AHH. I almost cried tears of joy while eating El Farolito last night!!
SO good. My bf & I ordered a super shrimp quesadilla (diff between the regular and super is the avocado and sour cream-DO IT) and also the super carne asada burrito. Both were sooo great. I've only had El Farolito one time before this and it was still good. But last night hit the spot!! Can be a little pricey though... $11+ for just the quesadilla, but I would say it's worth it! Every time I took a bite, I was going through an emotional roller coaster. It's so good, but now my food is disappearing. But once I finished my meal I was definitely satisified and it was definitely a great portion size. The quesadilla comes with two btw. The first time I ordered it, I ended up cutting into both at the same time and wondering why it was so thick. Don't be a newb like me! 

They have lots of street parking and we went on a Saturday night around 12A..So happy it was open late--GREAT for drunchkies!! PLEASE GO. you won't regret it.


P.S. Why are there no pictures for this review??? I was so excited to eat, I didn't snap a photo in time... And once I hit that first bite there was no turning back...

WHOOPS!
author: Emily C.

description: Some of the best Mexican food in the city.  Tasty beans and rice, barbecued meats, with a nice salsa bar.  My only complaint is that I'm wheat-free, and want to get the burrito without the tortilla.  Instead of being able to get the insides of a burrito put on a plate I have to order one of their bigger and more expensive entrees.  That's the only issue that I have with it.  They don't really take certain kinds of substitutions.
author: Sarah R.

description:
It's either this place or In n out for me. Hands down. Let me know when you find another place that makes the meatiest cheesy quesadilla or fresh and filling combo plates. The meat....the salsa...(might have gotten a little spicier...) goodness..glad i found you. 

Favs. Super steak quesadilla & Alambres- pork and steak but sometimes i get just the steak and it hits the spot.
author: Jenny K.

description:
my spot!

Best Al pastor anything.
I love the super Quesadilla suizas de Al pastor... ( day dreaming)
That salsa chunky salsa roja they have is oh so good!
author: Ari A.

description:
was my go2 spot .. until this one day..  
I walked in and ordered my normal super  burrito , with chicken. Went home ate it ... later that night I had the worse pain .. cramping ... as I was throwing up blood.. I remeber what I saw... pot of rice on the floor..chicken thawing out in the sink... dirty chopping board... 
all the time I ate here I never felt sick.. I literally  ate here 1000 times growing up..
I had to go to the emergency room. . sure enough it was food poison. .. 

I tried to call the owner .. he wasn't around nor did he return my call.. I left messages like 5 times..

finally I called the san francisco health department. .. they confirmed. . what I saw and sent me a copy of the violations they found .. basic stuff.. not supposed to thaw meat in a sinkm, dirty chopping board pots of cooked rice on the floor. ect... I wont ever go back.. ill rather drive across sf to get food.. or just cook it at home .. 2 stars for the good memories.. but fuck this place..
author: ren M.

description: It's good, but they didn't put the guac in my veggie burrito or add the sour cream that I paid for.
author: Patty A.

description:
How have I not written a review for this place sooner?

This is the only place that can satisfy my burrito phases/cravings. I can't describe what it is about this place, even though they give me whole beans instead of refried beans whenever I ask, the burrito is still THAT DAMN GOOD. Orders are made fairly fast, if not there are plenty of spots to sit and wait. Parking can be a hassle, depending on what time you go there.

My usual is the super shrimp and lengua burrito with everythaaang. Surf & Turf is the way to go! I feel extremely lucky that this place serves lengua too because it's not always a common thing on menus and lengua is relatively more expensive than other meats. Although the hot sauce they put in the burrito is almost non-existent, you can always take a few steps to your left and fill up the to go canisters with their infamous green sauce that packs a good punch. Bag of chips do come with your burrito order and I believe they are made in house.

I have ordered their tacos before but have had better elsewhere. Quesadillas are pretty packed full of cheese and the works depending on what you order.

The frescas are pretty good as well. Their strawberry one seems to be most popular, although packed full of sugar.

I don't think I'll ever like burritos anywhere else... El Farolito, you have stolen my gut and soul. I am faithfully.. forever yours.

On a side note to the employees... please try to stop overcooking my shrimp though... just sayin.

P.S. - To the progressive house heads in the EDM scene, this spot is Kaskade approved. :)
author: Jenny Y.

description:
Can't believe there is a location within a mile of my house -game changer. Forget postmates, this changes how one satisfies after midnight cravings. The people are great, they are smaller so don't move the line as fast as the location on 24th and mission but it feels more local and homely here with enough tables for families to to sit down and have dinner. Anyways, my favorite burrito and $5 ceviche in town. 

Ask for a foil bag and bring home lots of the sauce - I could seriously drink that sauce it's so good.
author: Vy T.

description: Alpastor, open late. What's not to like? Wish the salsa bar was more sanitary, but that's par for the course. And way cleaner than Guadalajara, so for me, this is the local winner.
author: Julian S.

description: Immmmmm backkkkkkkkkkkkk as listed as one of my top 5 favorite burrito places that I like to go to... Although I have been here several times but this is my 1st time for me that... I have requested a spinach wrapped super burrito... The spinach tortilla wrap may look really funny because its green colored looking... I just wanted to try something different!!! I really like this burrito place a lot that's why... I consider El Farolito Taqueria as one of my top 5 go to burrito joint!!!
author: William B.

description: Tested the Matinated Pork Burrito with Avocado and it was really yummy! The long queue is worth it!
author: Célina T.

description: Only been here once cause I don't live in SF, but I will be coming back. It's a really solid place to get a burrito, and then when you bring the price into account, it can't be beat. It's was like $8 for a carne asada super burrito, and they put real slices of avocado instead of guacamole, I love that shit!! Oh yeah and the burrito's actually hella big. I've had other burritos in SF that were way smaller and cost like $12 (*cough cough* la taqueria). You have to at least try this place if you've never had it.
author: Neil G.

description: My favorite Mexican restaurant in San Francisco, I go there at least once week just to order their carne asada super burrito with refried beans.  I've tried those overly priced Mexican restaurants like Chipotle, it will never come close to El Farolito.
author: Kevin T.

description:
I heard that this place serve the best mexican food in Northern CA! So I wanted to see what the hype is all about! Came here for the first time with my friends for lunch the other day, it was pretty good! But not the best best, that I'd rank it as the best. 

As my base burrito, I got the carne asada super burrito. It was huge!! You can save some for dinner or even split a burrito with a friend. I can imagine if you do come in after clubbing or a night of drinking, this might be the besssttt place to go and the food is going to be amazing! 

I'd come here after a night of drinking or after clubbing if I'm in SF!
author: Alliver V.

description: Love this burrito spot! Their burritos are on point sober or drunk! I'd say that's rare. The cashier at night is also super friendly!
author: Marie Antoinette L.

description:
I grew up in this neighborhood.

This location is way less packed than the one around 24th and Mission and the quality is just as legit, too, which is GREAT because I fucking hate waiting in a 30-foot long line with a herd of transplanted douchebag hipster tech-bros.

"Anyways"

The crowd (at 2am, obviously) is definitely more local with demographics from the Excelsior neighborhood and Outer Mission/Daly City.

An Al Pastor Super Burrito is where it's at. Black beans, with chips, and all the salsa you can consume. Pepper thy angus, because the savory deliciousness will overwhelm even the most hearty of men.

If you decide to eat at the restaurant, leave a goddamn tip for the busboy because you're about to drop a surprisingly unreasonable mess considering the fact that you only ate a burrito and some chips.

5 Stars.
author: William C.

description: I honestly do not understand the hype. The burritos here are just below average to average. There are better places to go for a burrito. All I can say is that there is always a long line and that the burritos are suuuuper dry. Not a fan. If you're craving Mexican, go to Taqueria Guadalajara. WAAAYYY BETTER.
author: Jamie B.

description: New to SF and I usually eat quesadillas and this spot has the best tasting steak quesadilla, this one had good flavor. From LA, the quesadilla here sits at my number 1 place to go to if I'm wanting to eat another quesadilla in SF.
author: Brody R.

description:
I'm from Southern California, so that says alot about my taste in Mexican food.  El Farolito does not disappoint.  Authentic flavors, fresh ingredients, and best of all open late.  Do yourself a favor and come here if you havn't already.  Most likely, you'll become a regular after those late nights out in the city.  Every on the menu is spectacular.  Their salsa selection is great with their free chips as you wait for the food.  

PROTIP:  Strawberry horchata ftw
author: David C.

description: Stopped at El Farolito for very late dinner last Wedsneday after going to the Daly City movie theater. The super quesadilla is very good, as is the guacamole, but my super burrito with carne asada and lengua fell short. The carne asada was on the dry side and it was overcooked. It did have decent flavor but was too chewy for me, definitely not tender enough. We ordered an extra super quesadilla to bring home but since the cashier forgot to place the order we had to wait another 20 minutes to get our food. Prices are not bad at all and portion sizes are really good. I will likely come guy to gie El Farotilit another tr, although Vallarta and El Castillito still are at the top restaurants of my list.
author: Gaby R.

description:
This will be a quick review and to the point. Ordered the Super Shrimp Burrito which is now a whopping 11.25 plus tax. Keep in mind this is at least 2.00 more than any other taqueria in San Francisco so I would think they would be smart enough to get my order right... they're not.

The workers here are pretty stupid and not attentive to your order so I suggest next time you watch how they make your food so they don't screw it up. So back to my order which isn't too hard to understand if you pay attention, which they don't do very well, unless you're brain-dead. Ordered the above item and specifically asked for refried beans and avocado instead of their whole beans and guacamole. Gave me guacamole instead and it was a pitiful serving of around a teaspoon.

There are better places that pay more attention to your order like Los Coyotes and even Pancho Villa. El Farolito has gone downhill since they were the go to taqueria in San Francisco. High prices, lower quality, miniscule servings, inept workers is more than enough to try other places.
author: Nathaniel S.

description: Chips and salsa here are too good! I always get the grilled chicken or carne asada. Went on a limb and got Al Pastor Super Burrito. It was okay... Not El Gordo's.
author: Carina L.

description:
If you ain't about the Suiza then we ain't about you.  Also want to give a shout out to USPS for letting us use the mailbox as a table.  Sorry bout the mess and I hope the salsa didn't get on any wedding invites. 

Protip: Don't wear white and get a fat stack of napkins cause its gonna get messy!
author: Michael C.

description:
If I had to choose one place to eat for the rest of my life, it would be here! 

This is my go to place any time I need to feed the beast that is my belly. When I come in, I feel like I'm part of the family. Always greeted, the guy that usually stands at the register remembers me and my boyfriend. He let's me practice my Espanol and restrains himself from bursting out laughing. 

The food is always fresh, they cook it right in front of you. Since you can clearly see the food area, you never have to worry about spit in your food or having your food be picked off the floor. You may think I exaggerate, but let's face it, if we learned anything from the movie "Waiting" or "Still Waiting..." We never know what is happening behind the closed doors of a restaurant. Some guy could have touched his sweaty balls and then continued to cook your food without the washing of hands. Or perhaps, you did something truly awful or perhaps your are just a crappy human being, dandruff and lugies could get on your food. Though, let's face it, you probably deserve it. But still, you get the point (I hope), transparency is great!

Honestly though, the best food in town is right here! Fill that hunger hole with a side of Coca- Cola de Mexico and you'll be in greasy heaven for the rest of your day!
author: Miriam G.

description: Great food! But they never pick up the phone to place an order. That's why I go to the one in south city
author: Edgardo S.

description:
My old neighborhood I grew up in. I wanted to try this one since I've been to the Grand Ave one near the Airport/Candlestick Park and this place was not the same. 

No Chile Relleno. Hecka Salty. Strawberry Fresco Drink didn't taste as fresh and was sweeter. 

Ordered the Super Quesadilla Chicken and Tortilla was hard on the bottom. Super Shrimp added Carne Asada Burrito was super salty along with chips. Shrimp seemed smaller also. Salsa bar was near garbage. 

Just a let down since I rave about the one on Grand Ave that I bring my friends to. Now I'm trying to sleep with a dry mouth.
author: Raymond D.

description:
This place was a great spot for my friend and me to sit down and have dinner near the 24th St Mission BART. If we'd been so inclined, it would have been just as doable to take away the food. As a vegetarian, I had the typical options that a Mexican food restaurant offers. My regular veggie burrito was good, but not notably tasty without the salsa. HOWEVER, guacamole came with the regular vegetarian burrito, and you had to upgrade to the super vegetarian burrito for cheese and sour cream. As someone who's low-dairy and high-as-possible guacamole, this was a pleasant surprise.

My friend ordered a chicken quesadilla and it was massive. I never leave food on the table at a restaurant, and if I still ate meat, I might have left a couple bites of this quesadilla. When I lost my food ticket, the server very logically and very graciously convinced me that the food he had was my own, and he was entirely correct. I would eat here again if I were in the area, and--since it's near the BART station--I probably will be; however, I probably wouldn't seek it out.
author: Christina R.

description:
Went there with my friends (who are Mexicans) late last night. I was told that this place have the best burrito and tacos in the city. I haven't had Mexican food in a very long time so I couldn't wait to get my paws on some yumminess. So here's my experience of El Farolito last night:

Parking - a little tricky on Sunday night because it is the Mission. I have to circle around the restaurant but fortunately only once before we found our parking. 

Restaurant - was not crowded when we walked in. We have to walk up to the food counter. Order our food, paid the cashier, then find our own seats. The restaurant seems to be pretty clean. I didn't get that funky vibe eating my food there like I sometimes do in some other restaurants in the Mission. 
I did noticed they have a private security guard on the premises.

Food- I ordered super shrimp quesadilla (without the sour cream) and a carne asada burrito. All of my friends ordered carne asada tacos (with different levels of spiciness). My quesadilla did not disappoint! The outside was crunchy and the inside was hot and cheesy. It wasn't oily. It was a generous portion for about  $10. I would and should have order another one. I could have easily finish both because I do have big appetite and the quesadilla was that yummy!
I also got a chance to taste one of the steak taco. It was ok (I'm just not a fan of tacos). It went done my mouth quickly. It had a spicy sauce on it. It did hit a spot. My head is sweating right now by just thinking about it. Chips and salsas were ok. Chips were cold but still crunchy. It didn't taste stale to me.  
We left nothing on our plates. All in all I'd say we had a really good late night snack there. I can't wait to go back and try other foods on the munu. A must visit place if you're hungry and in the neighborhood. 
Cheers! 
Btw, I didn't get a chance to use their bathroom. That's why I withhold 1 star.
author: Tawan G.

description: El Farolito is the closest taqueria near my house, however, I would much rather drive further into the Mission to get my taco or burrito fix. Parking on Friday or Saturday nights can be pretty bad, so be prepared to either circle multiple times or walk from Safeway. Normally, I would get the carne asada, but I've had the carnitas as well and an occasional bite of their grilled shrimp. The employees at El Farolito are usually pretty nice and I haven't had any complaints regarding their service, which is great! The burritos and tacos can be on the bland side at times, but hey, drunchies. A-OK for me!
author: Joyce E.

description:
This place is not very good at all. Everyone always wants to come here so I've been to El Farolito on at least 3 separate occasions, and every time I honestly would have rather gone to taco bell.

Their carne asada is really bland, and their guac isnt very good either. Their salsas I can get the same quality anywhere.

I had the al pastor burrito one time. It tasted like there was ketchup in my burrito.

I honestly have no idea what people like about this place.
author: Vincent C.

description:
CARNE ASADA, SHRIMP, SUPER BURRITO!

THAT is the way to go. This burrito combination is really spot on, especially after a crazy night of partying, slurred words, and tripping over cordless phones due to over consumption of a certain type of liquid, this is the perfect food for you. Heaven in a tortilla.

This place is truly one of the best authentic mexican joints you will find in the city. It's got over 3000 reviews on Yelp for a reason. In my opinion this particular restaurant tastes better than the other El Farolito's, but there is of course a down-side.
