This joint is always extremely crowded and if you ever come here late on weekends, expect loud rowdy people that just came from the bars/clubs.

I mean, let the statistics speak for itself. Props to them!
author: Benjamin W.

description:
Yay for a delicious carne asada burrito.  $1 more for a super burrito?  Umm, yes.

Boo for chips that are clearly not made in-house.  That's a deal breaker for me.  Sorry.  And the interior seemed dingy.

I will say that I'm glad I got to experience a legit Mission taqueria though!
author: Alena W.

description: Okay, I have grown to like this place. Maybe I'm officially a local now, or, when I wrote this review in 2011 they had different management or something, but this spot pleasantly surprised me when I gave it another try. Their meat is not top quality, but it's super delicious. The burritos are huge, so come hungry.  If you want something lighter, their ceviche toastada is a nice, inexpensive deal. Salsas are okay too-- definitely a million times better than Guadalajara across the street.
author: Katie D.

description: I ordered a super carne asada burrito here. My burrito was nicely sized -  lots of meat and perfect amount of meat, beans, rice, cheese, sour cream and guacamole. Came to just over $9 with tax and all. The chips that come with were a little greasy but the burrito was great!
author: Bumble B.

description: The bar for Mexican food is very high for me seeing as I live in so cal BUT this place was great! Price wise it wasn't expensive at all compared to how much I was paying for food every where else in San Fran. Also the portions were very big. Both my boyfriend and I saved half our food for later. The torta was very good! The Carne asada wasn't super greasy like it is at a lot of other places. There was a line the whole time we were here which isn't a bad thing seeing as the food was great. The only bad thing I have to say about this place is that the horchata was powdery. Horchata is a must for me when eating Mexican food and I was expecting it to be as good as the food. They did however have other aguas frescas and soda, so if that isn't a big deal for you DEFINITELY try this place out!
author: Yessenia P.

description:
The best burritos and tacos. Just as good as the 24th and mission location, but slightly bigger and not as many crazy people around.

Definitely get the super burrito with carne asada.  And the green salsa is Fire, just like that hot new mixtape.
author: Baek C.

description: Let me start by saying that I'm not sure if I went on an off night or something was just not right tonight , this place was definitely not what I expected especially after reading the other reviews. I had a steak quesadilla and it was flavored less :( . The salsas also did not help definitely disappointed. Giving them two stars because we did enjoy the pineapple and strawberry water and that the restaurant was really clean and staff were friendly.
author: Argelia V.

description: I grew up on these burritos but they continue to put hot sauce in mine when I say NO HOT Salsa. Not they, it's always the short bald dude that's been there for years and never acknowledged me more than just what number I was. Obviously he's not concerned with losing this customer. They make em better on Alabama anyway.
author: Brett R.

description: Great burritos, especially late night ones; I've never had a problem besides today, where I ordered a super burrito and did not receive guacamole. Besides the minor issue, the food is fresh, and the flavors are excellent. One of the better joints in the mission.
author: Clarissa M.

description:
Today is National Taco Day. So I decided to review this taqueria popular for the late night crowd. The decor is outdated and unremarkable, but there's plenty of tables and the food is good. Really great tacos ($2.25) and tostadas ($3.25). They have menudo on weekends. The most popular items are the huge burritos ($5.50+, lots of sour cream) and the quesadillas. On this recent visit I bought lengua and carnitas tacos and a strawberry aguas fresca ($1.63). Not many SF places have both tasty food and are open late.

After placing your order and receiving a basket of complimentary tortilla chips, don't forget to stop at the salsa bar to the left of the register. There's only a few choices: picante (red sauce), tomatillo sauce (green sauce, not spicy), pico de gallo (less watery than competitors) and rabanos (radish). 

Hours: 
Sun-Wed until 1:45am
Thu until 2:45am
Fri-Sat until 3:45am
author: Luis C.

description:
Best taqueria in SF hands down. People talk about guads across the street but this is the real deal. 

Food is outstanding; my personal favorite is the al pastor. The steak is really good and flavorful and even the grilled chicken is pretty good. Tacos are on point, tortas are always really good, burritos are fat and packed with flavor, but of course the all time best is the quesadillas. Nobody can beat them in the quesadilla game. Don't be mistaken guys come here not guads.
author: Michael L.

description: Usually not a fan of Mexican food but I loved eating at El Farolito's.
author: Michael P.

description: Best burrito that I have ever had: super burrito with carnitas. No frills, just excellent food.
author: Eric W.

description:
3.5

The employees are pretty rude, but they make a pretty good super quesadilla. I got the super shrimp quesadilla & it couldn't get much better ... Unless they lowered the price. $11.25 is a bit over priced for a taqueria I feel. I really enjoyed their salsa. 

The place itself was a bit messy. A lot of tables had trash on them from the preview guests. The area it's in isn't the greatest. 


Probably won't be coming back here unless they lower their prices a bit.
author: Tonni R.

description:
As a Mexican who can make killer food of all kinds..I can make better rice, beans, salsa, enchiladas, and various of the food items that they serve better at home.

I came here one late night with my boyfriend and decided to eat here because it's next to my house. After receiving our orders, I asked myself,"what the fuck was I consuming?"

The flavors are very bland. The rice sucked and my enchiladas were microwaved and the sauce tasted like it was out of a can. What a waste of money. 

If I would have known--I could have easily just thrown a tortilla with cheese in the microwave at home and dipped it in a can of tomato paste and called it a night.

I've been to the one on 24th and mission and BOY IS THERE A DIFFERENCE.

I'd rather go to Taqueria Guadalajara across the street from this joint.

I AVOID it by all means.
author: T. C.

description:
I was so excited to get to try El Farolito for the first time, since I've heard so much about it!

A group of friends and I came in on a weekday at lunch, and there was barely anyone there. Our order came pretty fast and we were able to enjoy our food and get back to work pretty fast.

I tried their carne asada tacos, which were good, and pretty big. They're about 5 dollars for 2 tacos, which isn't bad; a little more than I'm used to paying, but  the tacos were also bigger than I usually have. 2 was enough to fill me up, and 3 was enough for my guy friend who eats a little more. A solid taqueria that I would definitely come back to. 

Parking was a little difficult,because it was street, but since we were going to Safeway anyway, the Safeway a block away also has a parking lot.  Just don't stay too long!

Don't forget to bring cash!!
author: Winnie T.

description: Got the carne Asada burrito after a buzzfeed article rated it as number 1 "magical burritos you need to try" the burrito was delicious! I didn't really like the salsas which was disappointing but I will probably come back again next time I'm in sf. I'm curious to try the other favorite, la taqueria
author: Dash K.

description:
I've only ever ordered the Super Burrito here, but they are awesome. My personal favorite is the carnitas - they're moist and flavorful. The cabeza is also super tasty and nicely seasoned. Carne asada has flavor, but can be a bit dry. The pastor is another highlight (& I haven't tried the pollo).

They bring you chips and salsa which is nice, and the salsa bar has everything you could need. From cilantro + onions to 3 or 4 different sauces.

Overall, the vibe is great and the fact that the tacos are made on the spot for you makes this one of my favorite places in the area.
author: Simon C.

description:
Cashier was rude and argumentative. Ordered a burrito without onions, but got one with onions. We sent it back but the cashier dug in the garbage to dig the check up without washing his hands after, then continued to insist we changed the order and he knew better. He also insisted we ordered whole beans which we never did, apparently he fished the wrong order out of the garbage. 

When u place an order you get a basket of tortilla chips with it. The basket came with about 10 chips in it for 4 people. When we asked for more we were told, "you only get one basket because you only ordered one taco and one burrito each" we tried to tell him there were hardly any chips in the basket but the cashier refused and really never understood what was being asked. This place has zero customer service, they obviously have a long way to go with dealing with people and customers if they want to keep this business going. Too bad as the tacos are pretty good however the workers apparently don't care about repeat customers. Go across the street, and you won't have to deal with the horrible customer service. Get a clue El Favalito.
author: Toni S.

description:
I have never been so disappointed in a El Farlito's burrito until a few days ago. Shocking right? 

It was one of the most unsatisfying burrito ever! The burrito I just had, did not live up to the "most life changing" burrito. They skimped on the meat, and the meat was too bland. 

The next El Farlito's I plan to go will be the on 24th.
author: Lianne D.

description: Solid Mission burrito without requiring a full Mission excursion. They get the job done right
author: Alex N.

description:
DISAPPOINTED. 

They forgot to put guacamole in my burrito. Okay, I understand they can get pretty busy, so I went back to wait in line and kindly asked them if they can give me a side of it. The cashier didn't say much and gave me a small side.

After I finished half of my burrito, the cheese was no where to be found. I really don't mean to be picky, but this is a VEGETARIAN burrito and I was really looking forward to the guac and cheese. It's like having a meat burrito without the meat. Plus, shouldn't we get what we actually paid for? 

So I asked them kindly again if they can put some cheese on top. The cashier was pretty unapologetic about it, claiming that there should have been cheese inside. I showed him my half eaten burrito that there weren't any..and he just shrugged. Really?

I honestly don't expect spectacular service from a taqueria, but when you make a mistake, own up to it and make your loyal customers happy!

Good bye El Farolito, it's been nice knowing you for the past 8 years.
author: Tina C.

description:
We are lucky to live in San Francisco where we can get real, authentic indigenous food. 

Here on Mission Street, from 16th all the way down to Geneva, there are plenty of good Taquerias to choose from. However, on the corner of Mission and Onondega, there are two good Taqueria joints to choose from, and they are directly across from each other. 

Hey, it's a win-win situation since if one place is busy, you can mosey on over to the other side. And they are both scrumptiously delicious. 

El Farolito is very excellent and consistent. They are open very, very, very late and they always come in handy when that late night craving for some burritos and tacos hits you. It doesn't have to be the munchies or smoke some herb to get that craving. Y'all know what I'm talking about. Man, when that craving hits, you gotta satisfy that craving....pronto. 

Since they open late at night, there are plenty of parking to choose from; but I can guarantee you that there will be a long line. In fact, always expect a long line for something this good. 

Fitting name since El Farolito is translated into mini or little lighthouse. Hey, it's a beacon for everyone who gets that craving late at night and guides us safely to their door.
author: John G.

description: Horrible service one of the guys always talks shit in Spanish like no one understands, their burritos size has shrunk into what looks like a baby burrito, I'll stick to my favorite place down on mission and Brazil, I've weighed out and compared elfarolito has nothing on taqueria menudo
author: Flex L.

description: One of my go to spots if you want some bomb ass Mexican food. Been coming here for years and has never disappointed me. There's also another location on Grand ave in South San Francisco. I usually get the super burrito which is pretty dam fat and pretty cheap. And there chips are cracking! Haha The only draw back is parking. Since its on mission street which is a busy street parking can be tough.
author: Randy G.

description:
You killing me with the sour cream!

I was craving for something cheap, but filling, and close by Ocean avenue.. Duh! The Mission fits that persona to the T. 

I've gotten two recommendations from my friends that El Farolito was the bomb diggity of Mexican grub, and I've been itching to finally take it off my bookmarks for over a year now; that time has finally come!

Pork Chilie Verde Super Burrito - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2EGucgCJbPhkHjPTnZCzrg?userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
First impression: DAMN, it's almost as long as a Subway foot-long!
First bite: Way too much sour cream.. (see picture)
I opted for the pork because I've been on a beef marathon all week and to my surprise, the pork in my burrito was loaded and pretty tender. However, I'm disappointed to say that it was the overwhelming sour cream that threw me off. Bite after bite, all I tasted was either the savory pork (yes!), an overload of sour cream (blah!), or a piece of the foil.. (yeah, I was starving.. don't judge me!) 

Where's all the guac, pico de gio, or verde hot sauce at!? 

Complimentary chips were a nice touch with a decent salsa bar and pickled jalapenos, but the burrito was just too much of a creamy gut buster.. I gave up after two-thirds and I'm ashamed to say because I NEVER leave a burrito behind.. 

On a brighter note, El Farolito does serve a very refreshing Horchata! You can't call yourself a Mexican taqueria if you don't even have horchata now, so I give em' that. In the end, I did find a cheap (under $10), filling (in a negative fashion), and close by eatery. Just easy on the sour cream next time, amigos!
author: Albert L.

description:
SUPER QUESADILLA!! 
I devoured this within 10 minutes because it was so bomb. Their quesadillas are flat shaped and the tortilla is so crisp! I loved how their quesadillas are flat and they still manage to have the freshest, tastiest, ingredients in their burrito without everything oozing out whenever you bite into it. Their quesadillas consist of the typical sour cream, carne asada, cheese, guacamole. Love how their cheese is all melted in the quesadilla allowing all the flavors to mix and stick together. Especially love their guacamole! Unlike most places they use pre-made packed guacamole. El Farolito uses REAL avocados! I saw them peeling and scooping from avocados! What a plus! 

Their burrito looked just as enticing as the quesadilla but I obviously could not eat THAT much (well maybe I can...but portion control). They give you chips too before you receive your meal. 

What's so awesome about this place is it is one of those late nighter places. The perfect place to get your drunk munchies on or even sober munchies on. They open till really late and still manages to serve the freshest, hot cooked food to their customers! YUM. Yay for Mexican foooood!
author: Katrina T.

description: This is a pretty nice restaurant. We stopped by looking at reviews and ordered five dishes. The service is great and the taste is pretty authentic. The restaurant fills up really fast so it's very popular. The plates are very good, Id say one plate is good for two people even
author: Suzanna Z.

description: Clutch.  Drunk as shit. Open late. Foods great. Don't stop doing what you do. I could get every single ingredient at a supermarket and make a burrito but it would never match up to the quality of food they serve here. #farolitos4life
author: Noel B.

description: The best burritos I have had in San Francisco were from El Farolito. The restaurant does not get 5 stars though because I believe it could be kept in better sanitary conditions. That being said El Farolito remains among the finest options to grab Mex food in the city.
author: Pepi R.

description:
This place opens late night, but I come here because I went to school around here.
Their burritos are delicious and for the price, even better. It comes with a small bag of chips and you can scoop the sauce for your chips yourself.
author: Julian Y.

description:
Took the visiting familia from NYC here for dinner tonight. They wanted "real-authentic-california" mexican food. I knew this had to be some where on the Mission. While I yelped this place previously, my brother highly recommended it! I told the familia that true-authentic means ordering at the counter and no waiter service. Like legit, hole in the wall. I was for real.

However, the food was good! Everything is cooked fresh and has really nice ingredients. I had the enchilladas, one carne asada and one chorizo. I enjoyed the chorizo lotsss. Yum! Also ordered Super Nachos, they were SUPER and huge! Enough to feed three hungry people. The quesadillas look great too.

Cheap food! Fast food! Good food! Yums!
author: Vanessa K.

description:
The first thing I'll say about El Farolito is that me and my friends call it "The Joint". Its always available, its always delicious, and its always exactly what you need.

My specific order, a..."Let me get a super steak burrito with no onions, cilantro or salsa, and a large strawberry" never ceases to satisfy. The cashier is always a cool dude who gets what you want as long as you can say it loudly enough to overcome whatever sound is like at the time (I've been going there since...forever, so he rarely even needs to hear me say it). 

I think overall, the food is delicious (I've had tacos, quesadillas, shrimp burritos, steak burritos, and super nachos), but the one downside is that people approach it hearing people like me talk about it and come with these ridiculous expectations. Maybe even some of us propagate the expectations, kind of like Californian and In N Out. But El Farolito won't falter at giving you a bomb ass burrito for about seven bucks, and thats the truth.
author: Justin L.

description:
ATTENTION TOURISTS and SF visitors : it seems most of the reviews of this disgusting  place are from people who searched for a high rated place .  


It's a shame that El Farolito is the place you see as representative of the Mission Street taquerias as it's one of the dirtiest most disgusting Mexican taquerias in the Mission.   Yes it may be better than your taco shops back home , but we have far better in SF then this place.

SF has so much better to offer , but you understandably wouldn't know that by reading these reviews or if you haven't sampled the alternatives . 

Try Los coyotes or Pancho Villa on 16th  street and Mission instead , they are open late.  And you can take Bart. 

if you have a car , and it's earlier, venture to south San Francisco to LA MORENA or LA TAPATIA.  Both are 1000x better then el Farolito . They are closer to sfo airport too
author: Gmo G.

description:
We Used to be in Love.... We Used to Hold Hands.... We Used to make each other laugh & smile... Now... you have done something to me that is not forgivable...  U have Denied me ALL that we Had and now our Love is Over...

What the HECK Happened to you Farolito!!!???   We used to Kick it ALL of the time in H.S. , eat out and chill at 2AM! 
Now your food SUCKS!!!  Your portions are SMALL and you are super STINGY! 

Ordered a Chorizo Super Quesediila Suiza... This was a JOKE! Not enough of ANYTHING! 
I knew it was BAD when I felt the weight of the bag as I was leaving... So you know WHAT! I'm Leaving too!

I do have to give you a bit of credit... The Suiza did taste good. Tasty chorizo... but give this Hungry Guy some more for his $! 

You have broken my Heart... It was suppose to be clogged up with Tasty Grease! But you have did me wrong...  

I wonder how the other locations are? Would it be worth my $$$ ? Well after dropping over $9 for BS... I think my next meal will come from a different Taqueria..

You have let your Popularity get to You... and Now you are Snobby and think that you are "IT"!  You are NOT!
author: Alfonso C.

description: I remember the first time i tried this place..1998, fresh fom germany..i never had a burrito and i never heard of resturaunts being open past 10..it was about 130am and my cousin came through with a beautifully wrapped huge burrito..18 yrs later i can still taste my first bite. since it was my first, my bar was set from el faralito and no spot in the bay down to sac has satisfied my burrito needs..so even living in vallejo for a moment, and now currently in vacaville...i still have to travel all the way to sf just to get my burrito fix...highly recommended!
author: Jessie V.

description: Their food is the bomb! No complaints ! Their food is just the best, very good, have big portions, and I think that the price is fair !
author: Kristofer P.

description: Hubby has been going to this spot since back in the day. It must have been years since we were recently here a couple weeks ago. Employees still remember him. Bomb super burrito with pollo asado. Never disappoints. Tried this place both drunk and sober. Yum!
author: Nancy P.

description: There are countless taquerias in the Mission, how would you know which one to try? Well, you would have to know someone that live in the area or judge it by the lines of hungry patrons. I did both, and I am not disappointed. After having 2 bad experiences at Taqueria Menudo, I finally gave this spot a try and I am hooked! I've only tried the regular shrimp burrito but I cannot wait to try the rest of the menu. My burrito was done super quick and always tasted right. I also love that they open until 2:30am on the weekends, for those drunk club goers that needed to sober up before getting their ass home!
author: Katie N.

description: I have been there a few times with a friend who lives in SF. I do live in LA, so our thing out here is Mexican food. I know when it is good food or not really. I have been here twice and it is awesome I have to tell you. I had a Torta de Carne Asada as recovery food for the SF Marathon the last time I had some. My friend always goes here for Mexican food and she always says how awesome it is. I always want to tell people if they want to get away from the city core up in the Mission and Downtown and explore another neighborhood, to just come to the Excelsior and to come and eat there. I have to say that it is great.
author: Ismael M.

description: We just missed brunch by a few minutes after 2pm on a Saturday afternoon at the Doctor's Lounge, and I was surprised to see an El Farolito this close by, so decided to eat here instead as I was a huge fan of the El Farolito  just off the 24th St Mission BART station. This place didn't disappoint as it satisfied my hunger and food cravings. My friend got their Carne Asada super burrito, and I got their chicken super quesadilla. Both orders were huge and extra filling with extra guac and sour cream. It tasted just as delicious as I remembered. Prices still remained cheap, under $10 for the super portions and under $8 for the regular portion.
author: A L.

description: This was honestly the best tacos I've ever had. They also have a salsa bar where you can get your own sauces which is great. My favorite is their 65 cent chips which were super delicious! I recommend taking the tacos and food down to Delores park by full house!
author: Linda C.

description:
This place is waaaaaaay over hyped in my opinion.. I rather go to the Mexican place across the street to grab my burrito fix. But I had to try it for myself 

Ordered a beef burrito and my friend ordered a super burrito. Difference between a normal and the super is super comes with guac and sour cream... My burrito was extremely dry and Beef was chunks of fat and little meat. My friends burrito was definitely better than mine IMO. No guac and sour cream in your burrito is no Bueno.. Would rather you pay extra for the super..

You order then you grab your receipt, find a table or wait for your food, then gotta go check back for your order. Gets packed easily. Gotta wait a bit but not too long for your food. There is free water which is awesome!!!
author: Natalia D.

description: This place is terrible.  I ordered a super shrimp burrito..  I got a super burrito but it was carne asada... WTF? How do you get that wrong? The staff is rude and the food is bland.. I don't know why I gave it a second chance... So I end up taking it to go because it took so long.. and when I ate it.. It had about  5 pieces of shrimp. I mean come on.. you'd think a $12 burrito would have more than that..  Also, one drunken night.. I ordered about 5 tacos to go and gave them my card.. The next morning when I checked my receipt, they charged be $50.. they completely ran up my bill on items I did not order.. Don't waste your money here..  there's a way better mexican spot down the block called La Taqueria Menudo.  Trust me, you won't be disappointed.. I will never eat at el farolito again.  I never write reviews, but this place is bad that I had to!!
author: Julian C.

description:
Knowing that it was cash only and having a fair grasp of the line before visiting, I was completely comfortable and at ease in line with my money.

I have had pretty much everything on the menu, but keep going back for the super burrito and the Al Pastor tacos. Employees are quick and efficient, serving dozens of people every hour. Seating is a little cramped, but eating outside has never really bothered me. I just keep finding myself going back time and again.
author: Troy P.

description:
Good taqueria food, but disappointed that they can't keep the place clean enough for patrons who actually dine in. The floor was disgusting and many table tops were covered in trash from previous customers. It was mid-afternoon on a Sunday, but didn't look super busy. Five guys behind the counter and not one could clean up the mess. 

Just pick up & take out. It looks like a health hazard in there.
author: Lindsay V.

description: Ordered a few tacos. The carne asada and carnitas are good here.
author: Will D.

description:
What can I say? At a time when the most significant social improvement to me was the invention of the "mickey's big mouth bottle" this place really became part of my life. Growing up in the city this was one of many established go-to's. 

First thing's first, these guys are open into the early morning. Everything comes hot and fresh and it's always sketchy because it's supposed to be. I mean it's still in the excelsior and you should know what you are getting into when you go on a 2am burrito run. You will see folks you want to see and you will run into folks you hate to see. But again that's just part of it.

Come here for the burritos or the suiza and you are solid. Don't forget your chips and salsa and don't sweat that all the cooks look like the guys from that one bathroom scene in Training Day. That's part of the draw. Point I'm making is you can't tell me you grew up in the sco' and not know of el Farolito.
author: Ryan C.

description: When I go back home to sf this is one of my first stops. Grew up in the excelsior (not all these new fancy neighborhood renames) and thankful this place is still here and although there is the inevitable gentrification, good to see familiar faces. Plus they are open late.
author: Eleanor B.

description: It's okay not as good as guadaljizzles across the street. But each to their own. I mean I don't always see a line at el farolitos but you know nothing can compete with guadaljizzles.
author: Dwight N.

description: Great place to Tacos filled with Pulled Pork, With Salmon, Shrimp. Love the Burritos and Quesadillas. I love most of their Offerings and the staple of Corn Chips with Mild Salsa. The Rice Drink is my Favorite "Juachata". Nice Flavor a great local eatery loved by most in my humble opinion.
author: Chanh N.

description:
The rough part about not living near San Francisco anymore is being far away from this place. The burritos at this particular El Farolito have been specifically engineered for my taste buds. I don't know what they do with their grilled chicken, but as long as that doesn't change I'll make an effort to be their customer when I'm in the area.

I generally get burritos, but my El Farolito saga started with the quesadilla suiza. Grilled chicken and cheese in a fat tortilla - this is a relatively simple combination of food items, no? Yet somehow it tasted like magic. When I transitioned to burritos, I started with the regular burrito. Grilled chicken was now paired with rice, pinto beans, cilantro, onions, and salsa. This combination is more complex and be a little more dynamic as I get mine without onions. The same result: magic. I've since been relatively incapable of moving past the regular burrito due to less than enthusiastic appreciation of sour cream and general lack of a large enough appetite to consume a super burrito, but it's there [and good] if you want it. The regular burrito is a little dry without the super fixins, yes, but their magical salsa verde makes up for it. This is the first place I tried horchata, and while it's not even as good as the place across the street, it's worth getting.

That more or less sums up the El Farolito experience for me. I've tried other meats (asada and lengua in particular) and other dishes (chile verde mainly), but it all comes back to that regular burrito with grilled chicken, or the quesadilla suiza with grilled chicken if I'm feeling nostalgic. I've taken almost every friend I've ever had here and most of them love the place like I do. We occasionally have to think up some thin excuses to make the trip up here, the thinnest of which was, "Want to get El Farolito?"

The burritos are capable of standing on their own without any input from their human consumer. I don't want to undersell that particular aspect of the El Farolito experience. If there isn't any sorcery going on behind the scenes, I'll eat my shoe - after eating this here burrito.

The price has gone up over the years, but I don't let that be a deterrent. If I'm going to go to a place whose chefs are wizards, I'm not going to be cheap. (Don't read that as an endorsement to charge more.)

I have a routine where if I go during the week or on a Saturday, I park in the neighborhood above the restaurant. If I go on a Sunday, I park on the street. That part about me not being cheap doesn't extend to parking costs. If I can avoid paying even a nickel for parking, it's generally worth the effort. Yet going to another taqueria when the heart yearns for that magical Farolito goodness... the disappointment sticks for days. Weeks even. I can't betray my one true love, and when push comes to shove, I'll throw the quarters at the meter maid because this little taqueria's worth it.

A note: the more popular location further up Mission is also good. The South San Francisco location is lesser tier, but good. I avoid the San Jose location despite living down the street from it.
author: Pedro P.

description:
True story:
One night years ago, a friend came over depressed about his current relationship. Being a good friend, I sat there listening and offering support. Now mind you, I consider myself a very good listener. So I sat there and let them vent while I listened... And listened... And listened... 

My stomach began to rumble, but I sat there and listened... And listened... And listened.

As they spoke, I began to have a conversation with myself in my head. "They're really going through rough times and you're being a great friend right now"... "Okay, say something really wise and make them feel better so that we can talk about something else"... "Oh man, was that my stomach? (Glancing at my watch) Fack, it's been 5 hours since I last ate. I hope we wrap up soon"... "Jesus, they won't stop talking. I'm getting light headed. I think I'm gonna pass out"... "Oh my God! Stop talking! Please! Just stop it already!"... "If I collapse from starvation right now, I wonder if they'd notice"...

And you know what I was dreaming about during this grueling time? El Farolito.

I've been coming here for about 20 years and this place has never let me down. And in my moment of near starvation, I wanted my last meal to be a super suiza from El Farolito.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Great place to grab a late night burrito or quesadilla. This El Farolito is less crowded than the other ones and much more open in terms of seating. Parking is available via street meter or, if you're lucky, neighborhood free parking.

If you've been to an El Farolitos before, it's more or less the same. Huge burritos at a great price. The carne asada is a favorite of mine and they do not skimp on the beef (or anything for that matter). Make sure to maneuver your bite so you can get every bit if goodness in your face hole.

Service is nice and prompt. With a menu this simple, they've probably heard all kinds of substitutes, but they catch every word of it. 

Highly recommend checking this place out.
author: George Z.

description:
There's a lot of hype surrounding this taqueria so I was destined to go try it out since I'm working my way up the burrito ladder. 

Carne asada super burrito is the go-to choice for my burrito adventures and this was slightly disappointing. 

- Size is good but definitely not HUGE like most people say
- Carne asada was flavorful and juicy but there wasnt much of it
- Meat:Everything else ratio was totally off. I felt like I was eating beans and rice half of the time

I think Guadalajara has Farolito beat in the super burrito category. Although one of my favorite burritos would still have to be the Farolito in San Jose, the forgotten Farolito located in the shady parking lot sandwiched between a 7-11 and Andrew Hill High School.
author: Harry T.

description: This place is in my top 3 best burritos of SF. Every bite, every burrito, every quesadilla. This is what a Mission ST burrito taste like. This is not your hipster burrito on 16th st. This is the last of a dying breed burrito in the Excelsior!!! The steak has so much flavor you can eat it alone. The shrimp burritos are the best, always cooked perfectly. They serve a generous portion of caldo de res, it's what you need when you had enough burrito. Plenty of tables, unlimited salsa, open late late on weekends. I always return, it's in my hood. I highly recommend!!
author: Mono L.

description: Been going here since 1997, this is the place that got me addicted to burritos.  I live in South Bay now, and this place still has IMO the best salsa.  I've eaten at least 150 burritos here, and have warm memories all the way back of late night burrito runs.  I could live out my days on earth eating only these burritos, with the chips and salsa of course.
author: Gregg L.

description:
This place rocks all times of the day from lunch to dinner, to 3am after he bar binges. 

Venue is on mission, and its whatever. Kind of whole in the wall but it doesnt smell or have rats running around. 

Service: all the workers are quick, nice, and awesome latinos. 

Food: BOMB, burritos, tacos, all good. I love the super quesadilla suiza, and add on atleast two tacos of either carnitas or carne asada. All the meats are awesome, and the portion sizes are great for the price. Im a huge fan of this place and always tip. Its no san diego, but makes me feel closer to home everytime i come here.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Late night food and not interested in Denny's/iHop? This is the spot. Especially if you're craving Mexican cuisine! Burritos, Nachos, Quesadillas, Tacos, etc. 

Of course coming here for lunch is good too, but there are so many other options, so this is where it shines during the late night. If I'm feeling hungry I'll go for a super carne asada burrito which comes out super hot... and when I'm eating the salsa and chips the compounding combination of spice and heat is just too overbearing! 

if I'm looking for a light hit in my stomach, I'll order a regular carne asada taco and get chips, and this does save $, less than $3! 

Not to mention their strawberry fresca is really good. This is definitely one of my favorite spots to be at for late night cravings.

*Cash and Credit/Debit is accepted

*Parking: street parking, no lot
author: Sam K.

description:
I have been coming here since I was a kid! It is my quintessential go to place in my neighborhood, hands down! I've gone to many a taqueria and tasted the many kinds of super carne asada burrito (my absolute go to and favorite taqueria food) and honestly, besides the one on 24th St. they make it just right every time!

My other go-to that they make really good here is the quesadilla suizas, man do they hook it up with the carne asada and cheese!

They make the food really quick, which is awesome even when they're really busy! The people there are always friendly to me too.

Anyways, if you're a local you love this place! Its always on point with the ingredients, the flavor and the aroma of the food there are like hardwired into your mind and you just can't wait to come back! That's how it is for me, maybe because I grew up always going here, I don't know. It is definitely worth a try if you haven't been though.

P.S in response to some of the finicky reviews about this place like in terms of the burrito's rice/bean/meat ratio... Seriously though? Tu abuela en bicicleta güeys haha! 

You must not know how to eat burritos or let alone not appreciate course of eating a burrito! Obviously when you stand the burrito up, the stuff inside is going to shift. But there is always one side that has the most meat, I love saving that for the end! So you feel, on the fly weigh with your hand which side is heavier and start on the lighter side if you want to. 

I start on the the lighter side which is all the rice, beans, pico de gallo, sour cream, etc. until I reach the end, the bottom! All the juiciness and meat there is such a savory victory of eating the burrito!

So if you're worried about ingredient ratio or something ridiculous like that, then some wise Mexican words for you are "los que son mas delicados, nunca van a encantar lo que es bueno, no mas quejar como puede ser irrealmente mejor"
author: Jesús P.

description:
One Word: OVERRATED

El Farolito has been on my bookmarks for months for their suiza, however, like many Yelp fanatics I have trouble tackling my ever growing bookmark list. There's just so little time...

On Saturday, (actually Sunday, 4.24.11 ) I stumbled out of 5A5; this time on my own two feet. Both inebriated, my friend and I asked our DD if we can go eat. Of course being sober, she was in the right frame of mind when she said, "No, we're going home..." Hmmm, so what's a girl to do? Easy...DRUNK TEXT!

One of my friends has an insatiable appetite. He can eat like a garbage disposal and not gain an ounce (*evil eye*). He was at the same birthday bash we were at so I decided to text him. He was game and picked me up from the side of the Embarcadero and ZOOM, ZOOM, ZOOM! (Unfortunately, my other friend was nearly KTFO, so I couldn't get her out of our DD's car.)

My friend and I got to El Farolito a little past 2:30 AM. There was a short line that moved fairly quickly. Unfortunately, with old age and Asian genes comes lactose intolerance, so I decided to get a burrito instead of the suiza (quesadilla). Lengua (beef tongue) is normally my go-to meat to test how well a taqueria can prepare and cook their meat so I ordered the Lengua Super Burrito without beans which came with rice, pico de gallo, cheese, sour cream and avocado. I can't remember the exact price, but I think it was around $7 and chips & salsa were an additional $.80.

THE LENGUA SUPER BURRITO
The burrito was HUGE, but sadly it was bland and poorly constructed. The ratio of lengua to rice was about 35/65. The lengua was unevenly distributed throughout; mainly in the middle, so some bites were purely rice. The rice was dry, bland and was drowned in the overwhelming amounts of sour cream. Cooked properly, lengua should be so soft that it melts in your mouth. However, the lengua at El Farolito was chewy and tough. The copious amounts of sour cream made it difficult to eat more than 1/3 of the burrito so I brought the rest home. 

The next morning, the sour cream had seeped into the rice and through the flour tortilla making it soggy and wet, so I just picked at the lengua. 

The Salsa Bar had 3 types of salsa (from what I remember): Pico De Gallo, Salsa Roja and Salsa Verde. The pico de gallo was fresh but bland, the salsa roja had a nice kick but was watery and the salsa verde was bland and watery. 

SERVICE:
Fast and efficient. Within minutes of ordering, your food is brought to your table.

AMBIANCE/DÉCOR:
LOUD and ROWDY which is to be expected, it's past 2 AM after all. Because of the high foot traffic and plethora of drunkies, tables were not cleaned and were sticky.

The one unisex bathroom was disgusting and reeked like disintegrating urine under a heat lamp.

PARKING:
With several dive bars nearby and Taqueria Guadalajara across the street and also open late, it makes finding rockstar parking (within the block) a little more challenging. 

Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing and/or I came on an off night, but with SO many 5 Star reviews I expected A LOT more...especially when I was DRUNK!
author: Cherylynn N.

description: This has been my entire extended family's mission/excelsior mainstay since high school.  And that was a dang long time ago.  Why go all the way down Mission when you can get something equally delicious, less crowded, more old school SF closer to home?  The super burrito, you just can't go wrong with it.  We always get it with carnitas, but the carne asada is solid too.  They wrap the burritos well too.  No gloopy, gloppy mess here.  You can peel the foil as you go down, and if you don't have the jaw flexibility to attack this bad boy head on, get chips and have at it!  Also - and this might be blasphemous to say, but...for me the real star of the show is the agua fresca!!!  They usually always have a strawberry one, but once in a while, they'll have something special like watermelon or cantaloupe.  I cannot leave this place without a giant cup of agua fresca!
author: Tracey L.

description:
This is an amazing place for a quick late night bite. They have your typical Mexican food items, but what sets them apart from the rest is the condiment bar. It has beans,   onions, grilled green chiles, carrots, cilantro, radishes, two or three different types of salsa and I am likely leaving something out.  

If you are a big eater I recommend the burrito mojado. It is huge, has a great consistency and the taste is spot on.

For late night Mex food, when most other places are closed for the day, this a great place to go too.
author: Pedro S.

description:
Called in an order for 7 super burritos & ordered another at counter last minute. Staff was friendly & made the extra carne asada burrito super fast! 

Been going to this location for years & this place never disappoints! Only the best & affordable super burritos! Quesadillas & Nachos Yum-Os also!! Now that we live in SD, we always have to get our burrito fix from here when visiting the bay! Its a MUST! 

Tasty. Super tender & juicy meat. Fluffy mexican rice. You get your $$ worth on the forearm size aka super burritos! Dont just buy 1, get 2. Leftover for next day is still yummy! Still salivating from the burrito we brought back with us.....YUUUM!!
author: Pam P.

description:
Best taqueria in the city. Hands down. Food is also well-seasoned and its always best to ask for your meat well-done (the char on it is second-to-none). Much like it's brother shop in SSF it's amazing. 

Oh and for those people reviewing the customer service saying its bad...I've never had any issues and they are definitely accommodating when it comes to any food requests you have. 

Also, the lady complaining on here about chips has to be making this up. I order takeout for my coworkers and have eaten there many times. Each person who orders something in your group gets a bag or basket of chips. Why would you get chips if you didn't order anything? That's a backwards way of thinking. Want free Chios and salsa without obligation? Head to your local, crappy Chevy's and enjoy your second rate food.
author: David M.

description:
Update: tacos are $3.25 as of 03JAN18. 

I get at least 3 tacos (everything on it, spicy); with al pastor, mixing with chorizo or carnitas. A basket of tortilla chips is included. Another basket costs $0.60 I believe. Wash the spiciness down with a beer and horchata.

Looks divey but it's expected - make that a requirement. Fast service (long lines move quickly) and there's always Latin soaps or futbol on the TVs.

Note they awesomely open until 3am.
author: Peter L.

description:
This place is my go to spot in S.F. to get a burrito.  Parking is decent since there are a bunch of meters on both sides of the street.  The location is not the most safe, but it is not the most dangerous either.  It is open very late and their burritos are good.  I get the grilled chicken regular burrito with no beans, and I add cheese.  Yum! The aquas frescas here is good too.  Try and ask for minimal ice, otherwise they will fill up your drink with 75% ice.  I get the strawberry because orchata taste like dirt to me.  I wish they had cantaloupe flavor.  That is my favorite.  

-1 star for their cheapness on chips.  For example, if I were to order 2 burritos, they would only give me one bag of chips.    And if you ask to get 2 bags, they will deny you.  They will just give you a dirty look and say no.  If I ordered one burrito and my friend were to order separately, we would get 2 bags of chips.  GG I hate cheapos. The chips aren't even good. lol  

Overall, good burrito.  I will come here again.
author: Victor L.

description:
Oh my goshh, it's 90 degrees in San Francisco.  I hate this weather.  It makes me extremely lethargic.  And instead of getting ice cream like everyone else is, I couldn't say no to my recent craving and ended up at El Farolito ordering super nachos.

Now I've been here before, but I'm not a fan of Mexican food.  It's not that I don't like it.  It tastes good - real good - but I'm going to have to be in the mood for it or I'll have to be dragged kicking and screaming, but once the food comes I'll be happy.  

Anyway, so it's 90 degrees and I'm at El Farolito with nachos and tortilla chips with the super spicy green salsa. Was it always this spicy?  

It's burning outside, and my insides were quickly burning up too.  It was the complete opposite of ice cream, but I was satisfied.  The nachos were delicious, and the green salsa was so good.  However there was too much sour cream and not enough guac!

Thank you, El Farolito, for ending my craving for nachos.
author: Vivian H.

description:
A lot more spacious and nicer than the one on 24th & mission.  Comparable food.  Nice and fast service.  Looks pretty clean when I went.  
I always get the super burrito, which is awesome!
author: Maysee V.

description:
Never a mistake all natural. One of my favorite spots.  Yelp wants me to add more to the review. Come on folks what does it take if u near by this is good spot to slide in a get some good food  

I hope this is enough for Yelp and any future customers
author: Kev B.

description: Yummy late night. Not the healthiest but reminds me of the Mission. Keep em coming!
author: Amanda G.

description:
Stopped here Monday night at around 10:45pm and the place was busy. Waited in a short line and ordered our grub. 

The staff were friendly and professional, and seemed pleased with my friend ordering in Spanish. 

Grabbed a table, had a chance to look around, the place is a little run down, tables and seats have noticeable wear and tear, but it gets the job done. They have two flat screen TV's playing a Spanish channel. 

We ordered a steak quesadilla and shared, it came with chips, which I wasn't impressed with. The main dish was pretty tasty. The meat was mostly tender and had a good flavor (not a spice, but actual flavor) and it was HUGE. Yum.

I really enjoyed their Horchata. It was grainy with a soft hint of cinnamon and I could clearly taste the vanilla as it's own flavor. My preference is the more grainy Horchata, it's a rice drink after all!

Chile was also good. We had all of them, the only one lacking spice was of course the Verde, but it still had a solid flavour. 

Bathrooms were actually really clean, but had no toilet seat covers.

When we left at around 11:30pm the line was almost out the door, but they had them moving fast.
author: Meghan L.

description:
OMG I LOVE THIS PLACE! why did it take me THIS long to find out about this!? 

My friends and I came here after a long day of wine tasting in Napa and it was scrumptious! They take card (so no need for cash, though it's preferable). They have a HUGE selection of dishes and meats, including tongue! 

Their meats are delicious- very juicy, tender, and perfectly seasoned. The aroma alone just makes your mouth water. I will definitely return here whenever I'm in the city!
author: Faye F.

description: Other than La Taqueria on Mission and 25th, this was my go to place for beef and shrimp burritos or a combination of the two. My wife has never liked the carnitas and the chile verde in this place so I have to take her to El Faros for that. But yesterday I put my foot down and said we're going to get the carnitas and the chile verde burritos here.  So we did, and I was totally disappointed. It was the worst carnitas and chile verde I've ever had in any taqueria. The flavor and the quality of the meat were substandard. It is something I'll never order here again. Somebody was not doing quality control. I might still come back here for the beef and shrimp burritos, but never again for the carnitas and chile verde. And by the way, they're as expensive as La Taqueria. So might as well go to La Taqueria if you can stand vying for a seat.
author: Sammy G.

description:
The great debate of which taqueria is a fiery subject that can never be settled.  Kind of like arguing with a Raider's fan why his team sucks, will always suck, and that Al Davis will never die. It's just pointless to argue.

This is the closest El Farolito to my parent's house, where I grew up.  Food is consistently good.  Prices are still reasonable. (believe it or not, some taquerias are trying to charge close to $10 for a burrito these days).  

As I stated in previous reviews regarding other El Farolito locations.  This is truly San Francisco.  As much a part of San Francisco as sourdough bread, Cioppino, and Dungeness Crab.
author: Michael L.

description: This has been my OG Mex fix for a long time! Been coming here for as long as I can remember. Right in the Mission Excelsior District, El Farolito is this is the best Mex in my opinion. Portions are big and burritos you probably can share. The nachos have always been my favorite. They take cash/credit card so no worries. I like coming here in the middle of the day when no one is here. Chips and salsa while you wait.
author: Marie P.

description:
Ugh. The only thing good about this spot is thats open late; food tastes pretty bland from what I remember unless drenched in some salsa.
I dont recommend orderingto go --theyll find a way to mess something up. 
This used to be the place to go anytime after 10 before the original taqueria burned down; its gone down hill over the last couple of years. Go to Guadalajara across the street !!!! Or better yet just cruise along mission for some other more appetizing dishes.

Smh.
author: Yamilette C.

description:
-super shrimp burrito
-super lengua burrito (beef tongue)
-super carne asada burrito
I usually get it with no cheese, no beans, extra cilantro, extra jalapeno and extra salsa! 

best salsa! if you want mild, they have the tomato salsa with absolutely no spice, if you want spicy, the salsa verde def gives your burrito/chip a kick at the end! They also have pickle jalapeno - my fav!

best late night drunk food as well! I believe they open till 3am! It's definitely not a 5 star restaurant ambiance but who cares, you get the best burrito/taco/quesadilla in town!
author: Mindy C.

description:
I STILL love this place.

Most of the time I usually get Super Nachos or Super Burrito. 
The SUPER SHRIMP Quesadilla killed it!!! Wow. First time trying it. Was LOADED with jumbo, large amounts of shrimp. No skimping here! AND b/c it was SO DELICIOUS. I just had to have it with a Corona to complete my quesa-diller heaven.
author: Christine F.

description: Tried this place for the first time today. Definitely had higher expectations for El Farolito. Ordered a regular burrito with chicken and it wasn't bad but the chicken was a little dry. The nachos were decent. A little too much sour cream though. Overall, it was okay but definitely didn't meet my expectations.
author: Leanna W.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE.
The super quesadilla is really good. Packed with layers of cheese, carne asada and avocado!
The other stuff is good too, I just always get the super quesadilla.
Glad they take cards too because I don't carry cash all of the time.
Also a major plus.. it's open LATE NIGHT.. til like 2 or 3.
Yummy in my tummy.
author: Tiff C.

description:
The best "alambre" in the world (it's like a mixed meat combo)! Tacos and other dishes are fantastic too!

The "horchata" can use some work though...
If you're in the area, stop by!
author: Donato J.

description:
quiero quesadilla para dos un dos cokes
it was amazing- they aren't skimpy on anything, the staff were nice and friendly, I felt as if the truly welcome by business. I frequent travel SFO back to the East Bay and it is one of my first stops when I get back to SF. Amazing!
author: Fashions M.

description:
Seriously, this place is the bomb.com

I've been going here legit since i was 6 with my dad and it's in my opinion the best farolito there is.

i always get a super carne asada burrito with extra sour cream and wow im actually sobbing thinking about it. and their horchata is freaking perfect. im in love with el farolito
author: Negative N.

description:
FLAVOR!!  Mission FLAVOR!!

This is my first time here and my mouth is bursting with FLAVOR!!!

Just had tacos and quesadillas, but my God.

I want my husband to take me here again and again. TAKE ME TAKE ME ..  take me...

Please take me. :)
author: Emilie F.

description:
been eating here for 12+ years.

just order me a super burrito to go, got home and start chopping it down. aye, where my sour cream?! the nerve! if that was case i rather order me a regular but other times i never had a problem. wasn't even busy at all. the nerve!!! again :P
author: JessePanda C.

description: I like this one better then other locations. They hook up the food. The sour cream and guac is through out the entire burrito giving you a good moist burrito with out dry spots. I prefer carne asada. I highly enjoy the quesadilla suiza too. Been going here 15 years plus. Chips and salsa included! Super nachos is good, torta, all good.
author: Yessirthanks ..

description:
Now this is what I call tacos! I've been coming here since high school in the late 90's, and they haven't changed a bit (this is a good thing)

I must admit, I used to be thrown off by the the fact that their decor consists of scantily clad pics of Thalia, and big-busomed Aztecan ladies with Mexican flags draped across their chests, but now it's all part of the whole experience.

Here's what to expect:

- Their definition of "hot" is consistent with what it is in Mexico, which means hot=burns your taste buds off, mild=hot, and mild=a little spicy. Please take note of this when they ask you want kind of salsa you want on your tacos.

- Ceviche tostadas are damn good. They put minced jalapenos in them and they are hot (refer to definition above)

- Burritos are big and they don't skimp on the meat. Good balance between dry (rice, meat) and wet (sour cream, salsa, cheese, guacamole)

- Free chips and they have a salsa bar - win!

- Good selection of aguas frecas - horchata, agua de Jamaica (hibiscus water for you non-spanish speakers, agua de melon (melon juice)

- Tacos come in a variety of sizes to suit your taste - from plain old meat, oninos and cilantro to supreme tacos with sour cream and all

- Plenty of seating inside

- They're open really late so it's the perfect place to hit up after the club to fill up your belly so you don't get a hangover ;)

- Nachos are ridiculously huge and chock full of toppings - they are really meant for two people, or one really greedy one

I haven't met anyone who doesn't love this place. The Excelsior wouldn't be the Excelsior without it.
author: Mariela D.

description:
This place is pretty damn bomb I have to admit. 

Got the super steak taco I swear it's enough to share. But the meat, sour cream, avocado, cheese really de-lish!
author: Zane T.

description:
This Mexican restaurant is a:

- Late night food run after the club
- I'm hungry but I don't want to drive far from the Excelsior area
- I don't have a lot of money but I'm craving Mexican food

type of place..

I always order the Super Shrimp burrito. It's less than $10 for each meal and the portions are HUUUUUUGE! One burrito can feed me 3x and be super full each time.
It says it comes with 12 pieces of shrimp but I think they put more! The shrimps are not small either so it's definitely a shrimpy surprise. They are open until 3-4am some nights which is why I listed those reasons up there and I give it a 2 star rating because they are dirty.

One night I saw the cooks mess around and throw a wet rag or paper towel at each other, kind of like in a basketball throw motion but he missed his friend and it made it into one of the pots that they were cooking in. The guy noticed me looking and they closed the restaurant for the night earlier than usual. GROSS.

I still come here. The food is pretty good and some places are just plain dirty. Not all restaurants are perfect.
author: April D.

description: Excellent.  I have been to two in San Francisco, one in South City, and another in San Rafael, and all were awesome!
author: Alistair R.

description: The grilled chicken super burrito is off the hook.  The food is consistently good.  For some reason this location is better than the other 2 I have been too.
author: David S.

description: Its nice to have a good taco join in my new hood. This place is fast and tasty and open late enough to make a run when other places are closed.
author: Tim H.

description: I love El Farolito it's so good and fresh!!! My favorite thing to eat are the regular tacos azada or chorizo with black beans on top salsa and the chips  there the bomb!!!
author: Morenita M.

description: Lots of tables but not very clean.  Ordered a super carne asada burrito which was okay.  The carne was a little rubbery and I think they overdid it on the sour cream and skimped a bit on the avocado which made the burrito taste like a creamy, but filling mess.  Not the best, but not the worst.  A little overhyped but not too overhyped.
author: Rob C.

description: Cheap, hearty Mexican food. Sadly, the cashier today was very rude and impatient...he purposely charged us for a more expensive item, I believe, because we had a long order, 6 items. His annoyance clearly showed on his face and with his tone. When we got back in line to request our refund, he gave us $1 short of what we were owed and explained that we didn't take the taxes into account. But we didn't want to deal with the attitude and potential vindictiveness. He also tried to place the blame of the rung up order on the men preparing the food, who showed him the order he had written down, our correct order--which they had followed to to a T. Yet, he charged us for completely different items and deleted some of our original items when ringing us up. I do believe he was having a bad day, but it's a shame he would resort to pettiness. And even throw his fellow co-workers under the bus. My fiancé has been going here for years and it's sad to see that this is the service received. Admittedly we only come here for the quick and easy food, not the expectation of great service.
author: Terri A.

description: I've been coming to this El Farolito since highschool! It's right in my neighborhood and it has never disappointed! 20+ years later, My kids are now frequent customers!
author: Kia B.

description: I always order the super shrimp quesadilla, super beef burrito. It's always really good. Everything always tastes fresh. I try to order the beef soup when they have it but most of the time they don't have it.
author: M P.

description:
Right across the street from Taqueria Guadalajara. They have got a slightly different style but taste nearly the same. The prices are the same which sort of surprised me. It would be fun if they were a bit competitive with each other but they are both incredibly similar. The colours and atmosphere in this place is far more casual and different. I always order takeaways and for the most part their Super Burritos are quite good, so are the Super Quesadillas. I love the Salsa bar, it is quite flavourful, and I think I prefer the salsa here to Guadalajaras salsa. The staff that work here are all men whilst Guadalajara has women. The cooks will shout your number when your order is ready and they want you in and out as quickly as possible. But when you are super hungry and puckish El Farolito certainly does the trick. Id give it more stars if it stood out a bit more from Guadalajara but I chose to go there first and Taq stood out a bit more to me.

I like that they offer Cilantro and Onion separately!!!
author: Julian I.

description: Coulda just been really drunk but this was the best burrito I've ever had!! Just wish it was closer to me!!!!
author: Derek N.

description: ordered a super el pastor burrito today- didn't come with avocado and was a little sad not going to lie. anyways, the el pastor meat was very good and made the burrito juicy ! all of the other ingredients were pretty unnoticeable though. Pretty good burrito but wouldn't go back. also the salsa/hot sauce is definitely more like a fresh salsa- not my style.
author: Britt T.

description:
HUNGRY? This is the spot to be!!!!

Burritos? Tacos? Quesadilla?  They even have their Mexican specialty drinks like Horchata, fruit drinks, etc.

After the movies around 12, we didn't want to eat no fast food we wanted some hot decent food for cheap.  It had to be Taqueria El Farolito.  I had the Super Quesadilla Suiza.  It comes loaded with your choice of meat and it is in a large flour torilla w/ cheese, fresh avocado, sour cream, and fresh salsa.  This thing is pretty big and this will fill you up!

I also ordered the taco; it is a standard taco with your choice of meat with onions and cilantro.  Not bad at all but for 2.25 is a bit steep, but it is loaded with meat though!

Overall this place is good for late night munchies if you didn't want any fast food!  You must get the green avocado sauce it is the best, it will definitely kick up a notch to your meal!  By the way it's hot so beware if you cannot handle spicy!

-Parking- 
Parking can be easy and hard depends on the time you go; the farthest I have to park was about a block and a half.  Night time parking is free and day time it's metered because it's on Mission Street.  They are all typically metered spots.

**quick tip**
This location does take credit card and make sure you bring your ID.
author: Kenneth Y.

description: We came here around 10pm after a whole Sunday of hitting the studies (so sad) and their burritos really hit the spot. We just got the regular carne asada burritos, but man, if we came later into the night, I'm sure we'd love it even more. The guys behind the counter were so awesome, and one of them actually brought our food to us (sorry guys!) because we didn't hear them call our number since we sat so far away from the register. So grateful that they did that though!!
author: Bonita K.

description:
Been enjoying this delicious place since before high school! The prices are very affordable and the food portions are generous. I can't even finish a whole super burrito to myself (which is something I recommend for you to try). 

I usually get the carne asada super burrito with black beans. When I'm feeling daring, I'll add shrimp. Another great dish for you to try is the super carne asada (and/or shrimp) quesadilla. Don't forget to add the fresh strawberry fresca too! YUM!!
author: Trisha Mae C.

description:
I can honestly say, sin hyperbole, your mouth will literally explode from joy from the burritos here at El Fatolito. Much flavor of quality, and enjoyment. 

Sí - my friends let us talk - you will achieve happenis here. Horchata togo. Godbless.
author: Esteban F.

description: Quite hyped...quite overrated. The place felt really dirty and staff was impatient. I ordered the highly acclaimed chicken suiza quesadilla and after a few bites realized that what I was eating was nothing spectacular but it at least hit the spot....with grease and chewy chicken. I shall not return!
author: Kristy F.

description: For as long as I shall live... Team El Farlito ftw. I grew up eating this. As I child I had this once a week - pretty unhealthy but my family loved it. As a child my parents would drop me off to pick up the order they placed usually a super burrito and a super nacho. Two orders filled our family. Now a days... We need two orders of quesadilla and a strawberry drink. They cashier risky recognizes me saying how I used to be shorter than the counter and now bam.. Taller then the glass display. The food here has always been great. It definitely tested better when I was younger and not caring about what I eat. It is definitely on the heavy side but heyyyyyyyy it's totally worth it.
author: Kristina L.

description: I can eat anywhere, but my heart and stomach always wants this place. I only go to the one on 24th Street/Alabama and Mission Street/Onondaga. I haven't tried the one in SSF, but not for any reason. Their staff is nice, fast, and never get my orders wrong. My favorite thing to get is always the al pastor super suiza. When I decide to go big, I love getting either the carne asada burrito or my fav, the "Bosses Burrito" (I think only on 24th). This one comes with all the works and al pastor with camarones. It's BIG and filling - YUM! Their salsa verde is so perfect and much better on my food or just with chips. Speaking of chips, they charge $.65 at Mission location but it's not a biggie. I have some other places, well, plenty that I could go to but while El Farolito is open, i'll be true to them when I need my Mexican fix!
author: Nati G.

description: Bomb ass Mexican food made to order! It's crackin right now and it's already 3am Sunday morning! Crack in a tortilla for real!!!
author: Sam M.

description: I feel as though I should have so much to say about this joint because its so delicious, but I dont, maybe the best things arent described in words, but are felt in the heart when youre chewing with a mouthful of heaven. el farolito is open super later, a good amount of seating, one of the best burittos in town. dont forget the green sauce.
author: Serena L.

description:
I grew up around here, and used to go to Guadalajara until someone forced me to eat at El Farolito's. Unless you live around the area or this is the nearest Mexican food joint around should you be in this neighborhood. Fa real.

So my decision to switch to El Farolito and abandon their arch nemesis across the street? Mehhh I'm still in between!! El Farolito's carnitas aren't dry, Guadalajara's? Kind of dry. Deduction of stars because I can't sit comfortably in there, like I hold on to my belongings real tight and I'm always looking at the door. Space could be cleaner, thiiings like that. And I don't feel like that in Guadalajara.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
i enjoyed my enchiladas, and the chips were very delicious.
their quesadilla was amazing!!! love love love!
so was their strawberry juice =)
parking wasn't too bad but we went on a sat noon, so im not sure abt other days.
i'd love to go back whenever i have a quesadilla craving ;)
author: Ru C.

description:
Eh. I have so many friends in SF and have heard so many "omg..you gotta try El Farlito's.." that I had to try it. And of course, i had to try it after drunken debauchery....and SADLY, all I have to say is EH. 
Yep. EH! 
Other than the extreme size of the burrito, I wasn't blown away by it's taste or thought it was anything special. 


Or maybe I wasn't drunk enough to enjoy it.....?
author: Laurie V.

description:
i havent eaten any REAL mexican food since i have moved to the Bay area, but when i am on a hunt for some good carne asada, or any spanish speakers at all, i look to the Mission. and i am almost never disappointed. hearing someone ask me what i want to eat and calling my order number en ESPAÑOL is music to my ears!

i ordered the Super Burrito, with carne asada and all the works. 
the prices here are not bad at all, and they give you free chips when you dine in. 
(if you're sharing, make sure you ask to have your burrito cut in half) 

anyways, we sat down, got our food, and i was very very pleased! 
there actually isn't anything to complain about. :3

EL FAROLITO FTW.
author: Chelsea B.

description: I usually do not like to give bad ratings, but this is long over due. I just got home from ordering a super burrito to go and they messed up on my order, AGAIN. I am soooo tired of this happening. It's been happening a lot lately. I've been going to this place for more than 10 years now and their burritos are usually very good and juicy when it's made the way it's ordered. They used to really care about customer service. I don't know what's going on with this place now. The last time they messed up on my order, I wasted gas and time and I drove back to the restaurant just so they can make the burrito I actually ordered. This burrito they made me today is the driest burrito I've ever had in my life. I wonder if they are under new management or something because their burritos and their customer service isn't as great as it used to be. It's to bad. I used to love this place.
author: Jackie O.

description:
Best drunk food ever!

I've never had food from El Farolito sober before, but it's probably just as good! It's super cheap and portions are humongous. I always order the super quesadilla, which could easily feed 2 sober people, but we all know being hungry while drunk is a whole different story so you should probably get your own if that's the case. I haven't tried anything else because their quesadillas are so good, but I know people who like the burritos and nachos too. I'm sure you probably can't go wrong with anything on the menu though. The only thing I don't like about it is the location, but I think this one is less sketchy and definitely less crowded compared to the one in the Mission since it's farther from all the bars. I actually didn't know this El Farolito existed until my friend drove over here after we saw the line out the door at the other one. It was nice that the line was super short here and there were plenty of available tables.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
OMG! this place is the best! Good cheap eat!! Opens late, till around 3, 4am? The area can be a little rough, but just go in, eat your delicious meal and get out. 

The bf and i came after i got off work around 11pm and I didn't eat dinner so we came. We ordered the SUPER NACHOS!!! omg...cheese, beans, salsa, gauc, sour cream, and your choice of meat, for $6-7? There's nothing you can go wrong. The two of us combined could not finish it. Everytime you order, you get a small handful of chips, with all you can eat salsa. There's the reg red color one, the green one, and my fav the pico de gallo which is the fresh salsa. 

I've also had the tacos or somtimes i order the toastada? which is a crunchy flat taco for i think $3? and with the chips and FREE pico de gallo, i'm stuffed. Absolutely love the price, the food is delicious and freshly made to order, what more can you ask for??? YUMMMM
author: Anita W.

description: Love the food. Hate the cashier. Ever since our buddy with the Polynesian tattoos left, the guy who took over is a jerk. Like come on dude! At least ask me what kind of beans I want. He doesn't say hello. He doesn't ask if we'd like anything else. He just stares at you until you tell him what you want and tell him you're done ordering....
author: Kayla D.

description: Went here because the Yelp menu had good prices, but this place is actually way over priced! A veggie burrito is now $7, totally ridiculous!
author: Darcey P.

description:
This is my favorite of the El Farolito locations. The staff is super friendly and I think the food just tastes a lot better here. You can also get guacamole too which isn't an option at 24th st.

Consistency is a little bit hit or miss sometimes but most of the time it's good.
author: Mike T.

description: This is THE SPOT when it comes to my super burrito Al pastor, quesadilla Suiza, shrimp quesadilla or the super quesadilla...i'd go here at any time of the day to have my treat and it's always on point.
author: Erick M.

description:
Late night, cheap eats. Late night, good, cheap eats. 

Entertainment as well because everyone else around you has also partook in weekend debauchery. This one is the better location IMO because it has more seating and less aggression (I've experienced first hand unpleasantness at the other loc in addition to hearing stories from friends)

Big portions too in case you're too lazy to cook/go to brunch in the morning. It's a win win.
author: Geralyn Y.

description:
Need a taqueria fix?  El Farolito is the place to go.  It's an awesome Mexican spot in the Excelsior district that is close to parking and bus stops.  So if you decide you want some nachos at 1 o'clock in the morning, but have no car?  Take the 14!  The stop is right at the corner.  Drive?  There are plenty of spaces around, just park somewhere close, but you do have to pay for the meter.

The food is great -- there are hella choices to choose from.  This El Farolito will not disappoint you.  If you're coming here at 1 in the afternoon or in the morning, the food that they serve will never let you down.  Yum!
author: Xandra Marie G.

description:
The service was great and we're very nice on my visit. I ordered the enchilada plate, a regular taco de asada and a super taco de asada. I was disappointed with the enchiladas bc the enchilada sauce was just poured over them. I'm used to having the tortilla dipped in the enchilada sauce then frying it in a pan so the tortilla really absorbs the flavor. The enchilada sauce had no flavor, I had to pour a lot of their chip salsa to give it a kick. The enchiladas were a little cold as well. The rest on the plate (rice and beans) were good and warm. The tacos were ok. I think the carne asada could use a little more salt or maybe seasoning. 
I think I'll stick to the quesadillas de chorizo. Side note, the bathrooms were cleaner that what I'd thought they'd be so good job on that.
author: Bianca H.

description:
I'll get straight to the point- the burrito wasn't bad, had I been more familiar with the menu I'm sure I'd be blown away. Folks were nice, chips were good. 

One thing that was a big turn off was that they did not have any spicy sauce. What taqueria lacks on hot sauce? I don't know, but I doubt I'll come back. At least we gave this place a try.
author: Monina C.

description: One of the best taquerias in San Francisco.  Why?  Because it's open really late and has awesome burritos and tacos.  Have a craving for tacos at 12AM on a Thursday--go to El Farolito!  They have the best super carnitas tacos you can find in the middle of the night.  Look, it's not Gary Danko, or the trendiest hipster restaurant, but if you want good food for a great price, El Farolito is the place.
author: Randy M.

description: If you have been wondering if there is such a thing as actual good Mexican food chain, well, this is it. It's still a chain but for a chain, it tastes like a one-off place
author: Samuel B.

description: El Farolito is probably my best burrito place I would drive from the Peninsula to grab one of the tasty carnitas burritos enough for two sittings they are very generous with there portions I wish they had one closer to home since I love Mexican food and it can be nutritious  as well.
author: Stephan C.

description:
My go to spot since it's open late and the food is very satisfying. I usually order a super burrito/quesadilla/nacho el pastor with everything on it. Whichever I am in the mood for. You get lots of rice and beans with the burrito, the quesadilla has chunks of avocado, and the nachos is possibly the larger of the 3 in terms of portion. Get one if those, and a drink (fresca). I like the watermelon, since it's refreshing and not overly sweet. But that's only if they don't have cantaloup. 

People compare it to the place across the street, Guadalajara, both are good. But my cousin prefers el farolito since they cook the shrimp in front of you. Not sure guads does that.
author: Brian F.

description: I came here for a burrito late night because Taqueria Guadalajara was closed across the street. I must say it was tasty and slightly bigger than across the street. The reason a 3 star is they put way too much sour cream in the burrito and it seems quite dry. Good for a quick late bite but I still prefer to have my GUADS whenever opened.
author: Philip M.

description:
Coming here after a horrible experience at Gleneagles Golf Course, it definitely turned my mood around.

The staff was nice and the tacos were delicious. It definitely hit the spot for good cheap Mexican food.
author: Alex T.

description:
This review is long over due....

I remember my very first encounter with the store when I was introduced to it back in 2003.  My ex, knowing full well that I come from San Diego and we know our Mexican Food... but the Super Quiza took me back home.  The Super Quiza is decked out in a large lightly crispy toritilla with your choice of meat, avo, cheese and a slap of sour cream, NOW THAT MEANS BUSINESS!

The service is quick and there's always somewhere to sit.  Try a Super Quiza, I'm telling you it's the ISH!
author: Edrian D.

description: This place never disappoints. The tacos de tripa are amazing! The shrimp cocktail is also good.
author: Valerie F.

description: Service top knock... speed of orders day uuu they get down fast!!! Wootwoot!! Lol if u in a hurry n need a bomb burrito or spa DE res, or whatever you ordering they're good!!
author: Main G.
