description: This is the best burrito place in the world, I have been going here since I was a kid and it has never changed, Super Burrito with carne asada and that green sauce never disappoints! The staff has been the same and are very friendly!
author: Carlos F.

description:
This is probably as authentic as it gets! Hands down one of the best burritos I've ever had, every last bite had so much flavor!

I got the pollo asada regular burrito, but it was a decent size. I couldn't even finish it! The strawberry agua fresca was also really good, the perfect beverage to wash down the awesome burrito with!

Salsa bar is also awesome, and the atmosphere is so absolutely authentic. The service was just fine. The line moved quickly even though it was long, and the food was also ready rather quickly.

I'll definitely be back!
author: Sara K.

description:
I love El Farolitos. It's so good!

But go to the one across the street, Taqueria Guadalajara. I know it's hard to believe anything can be better than the famous El Farolitos, but there is.
author: Betty C.

description: love the strawberry agua fresca. but service could be improved. also, carne asada here is never as good as pollo - just not as fresh. torta is solid. tostadas are more like an open hard taco, literally some taco innards on a 5 inch tortilla chip. will keep coming though because it's nextdoor to the laundromat, until i finally try the other taqueria across the street.
author: Anna S.

description:
Went to this spot during noon and it was crowded!

The prices are very cheap for a large quantity of food. I ordered the Carne Asada Quesadilla Suiza and El Pastor soft taco. All i can say is this is one of the best mexican food i have ever ate. Spot on.
author: Ray H.

description: The exact same menu as Mission and 24th, just not as many people and less condiments. There is 2 large screen TVs that they had the soccer game on.
author: M C.

description:
This is THEE best mexican joint I've ever been to!!

They don't skimp on portions.

Super Nachos w/ Everything
http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/5C5fdbuw_z7s4BOpfablQQ/l

Super Quesadilla w/ Everything...rice added
http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/r1kFyx1lyeKUfmxwuvF_FA/l

(Friday, March 27, 2009)
author: Kenny C.

description:
OVERALL: 3.9

FOOD: 4
SERVICE: 4
AMBIANCE: 3
VALUE: 4.5

This Farolito may be farrrrrrrrrrr beyond the Outer Mission, but it's well worth the hike.  Have been to the location on 24th, but this one's farrrrrrrolito better (you get my point).  Quieter, faster assembly line, cleaner, less greasy, fewer stumbly drunks, space to actually breathe, walk, sit, and enjoy the delicious food...and plenty of parking!

Abandoned my beloved camarones & al pastor for an exotic one night stand with lengua & cabeza....yup, decided to try the other side of the tracks with the Badder Boys of taco land.  Honestly, not convinced the name accurately describes the meat--could've been mexican beef pot roast in a corn tortilla--YUM!

LENGUA: well-seasoned, tender sliced meat...forget about anatomy and just try it already!

CABEZA: same flavor as lengua, though meat was shredded and even softer.  Good, but preferred the neater & firmer lengua texture.

At the end of the night, had a fun romp....but I'll be going back to camarones & al pastor.
author: Amy K.

description: THE BEST BURRITOS EVERRRRRR!!!!! (The only thing I could ever complain about is there being a kind of long line during peak hours but (duh) and also obviously there's going to be a long line for the best burritos that ever existed.)
author: Leila N.

description: when there's a line at the other el far, this one is great. friendly staff, fresh food, and great drunchies.
author: Sean P.

description:
I must say that this place is absolutely delicious.  The place can get a bit dirty which is why the one star is gone, but other than that this place is pretty damn good.

Their tacos, nachos, and everything else on their menu is always stacked -- there's never a lack of filling.  All their food is served at the perfect temperature and their service is quick.

I recommend the nachos or the quesadilla or the tacos ... ok, ok -- I recommend everything.  Great place, great food ... especially after a late night of drinking.

The line can get a bit long at dinner time and after 1:45am, so go earlier or you'll be waiting for a while.
author: Pia V.

description:
My lengua burrito at El Farolito paled in comparison to its flavorfully vibrant counterpart across the street at Taqueria Guadalajara.  Although the ingredients are imaginably similar, the burrito was soggy and limp in my hands as I anticipated with false hope that each bite would improve upon the previous one.  The salsa variety at El Farolito also fell short of its big brother taqueria across the street.

A minor and possibly misguided expectation for cleanliness was unfulfilled as we sat amid countless spills and sticky table tops the entire meal.
author: Andrew M.

description:
El Farolitos is without a doubt my favorite taqueria. anywhere. 

My boyfriend got me hooked on their carne asada burritos and quesadilla suizas (carne asada). SO GOOD and HUGE PORTIONS! You won't regret coming here -- the BEST!
author: Diana P.

description: Their carne asada burrito is amazing! i have tried multiple mexican places and this one ranks as probably the best! Perfect portion of meat, bean, rice, and cheese! I absolutely love this place and dream of eating their burrito Their quesadilla, nachos, and green sauce are great as well!
author: Laurie A.

description:
I've been coming here ever since I can remember the word burrito.

Dingy dark place, not the cleanest looking or the best customer service but they make a DAMN good burrito at a cheap price. Serving sizes are huge. They're open late, but the lines here usually get pretty crazy. I suggest weekday afternoons.
author: Neek W.

description:
This place kicks major ass. The burritos here are huge and come with chips. Price is around $6-$7. Literally the best in the city. Plus, the guys who work here are super friendly if you talk to them. If you talk to them in Spanish they will love you forever. Especially if you don't speak spanish.

I used to come here on a weekly basis as a CCSF student on the Ocean Campus. Way better than the crap they've got on campus (minus the Pierre Coste Restaurant, that place is awesome).
author: Jesse C.

description:
I've been coming here since about 5 years ago with my mom and her friend, who showed me this wonderful taqueria in the first place. I used to go there on a weekly basis or so for about 2 years or so, then eventually, I stopped going for a while, for reasons I can't seem to remember. Anyways, recently, starting about a 2-3 months ago, I started going there on a weekly basis again.

Everything there seems to be the same. The same great tasting food, the same friendly atmosphere, and the same good ol' friendly customer service. Whenever I go there, the only thing I really order is the Carne Asada Super Suiza. For roughly $7, it fills me up for lunch and dinner. In fact, whenever I go there, it's the only and single meal I eat the entire day. Everything's very convenient, made quick, fresh, and ready to go. In addition to this, chips are also included for free too! The salsa bar is a little "wattery" but that isn't too much of an issue. All in all, it's great authentic Mexican food! Large proportions, great prices, and quick and fast friendly service!
author: Dennis L.

description: Shrimp burrito, Shrimp quesadilla! aw MAN the memories. I used to live near here and would get one of these and it is always yummy and fast. Need to come back for another trip sometime, in which case I will update.
author: Mary H.

description:
BEST burrito I've ever had. 

My friend told me that I had to try El Farlito because they had the best burritos. When she took me, and I took that bite, it was heaven in my mouth. I got the super burrito with carne asada. It's definitely affordable with big portions. :) DELICIOUS.
author: Kathy L.

description:
One word to describe the food: salty. 

I don't care if people have raved about this place for years or what great things El Farolito has to offer. The meat is salty and I felt like I was in the desert searching for that mirage of a pool of water with a palm tree hanging over it. The only reason why people come here is either because it's open late or people are drunk and want something to eat. I've been here twice and I think that's plenty of times for me to confidently say that I don't want to make another trip down here again.
author: Carol L.

description:
El Farolito never fails to make me happy. A good burrito in general makes me really happy. I could eat burritos all day if I was able to stomach it.  If I could give El Farolito 10 stars, I would because I think it's one of the best places to get a mission style burrito in San Francisco. The quality of food is always very consistent and I've never had a bad burrito from here. My favorite is the carne asada super burrito, which consists of meat, guac, pico de gallo, cheese, sour cream rice and beans (I think). What I like about El Farolito in comparison to other burrito joints, say... like Taqueria Guadalajara across the street, is that distribution of every layer across the entirety of the burrito. Don't get me wrong though. I love Taqueria Guadalajara's al pastor. Bomb.com. But you know how sometimes some taquerias wrap a burrito in layers? Like you start off eating a burrito with just meat. Then sour cream, then whatever else and it's just not evenly distributed! I've never had that problem with El Faro burritos. 

What makes me a credible burrito source, you say? Credible is questionable. But I definitely have had my fair share of burritos in my day. You might think? HA! What does a little AZN girl know about them burritos? I've been very lucky to have lived in 3 of the greatest food meccas in California (SF, SD, LA), and being the burrito enthusiast I am, I've always searched for the best burrito in each city. Growing up in SF, I've lived off of mission style burritos. El Farolito always my favorite. When I went to SD for university, I lived off of San Diego style burritos (more specifically carne asada burritos from Vallarta's, Rigoberto's, or Lolita's... or surf and turf burritos from Lucha Libre and their amazing crack sauce). Currently living in LA... actually I haven't found an amazing burrito joint yet but tacos in LA are delicious. Through it all, I still love El Farolito. It just means that it is THAT good. Trust.
author: Jenny N.

description:
If you're looking for taqueria standards done right, it's hard to find a better place than El Farolito. The food is flavorful and priced reasonably. Excellent veggie burritos with avocado and black beans. And if your body is up for the oil and calories, the chile relleno burrito is preposterously delicious.

I only wish that they had some slightly smaller, cheaper plate options, as their plates are daunting for dinner, and insurmountable for lunch. (I suppose I could also wish for the self restraint to just eat half and save the rest for later.) Also, having to pay 50 cents extra for chips is a bummer, but the service is fast enough that chips are pretty unnecessary.
author: Ben F.

description:
Recommend:

Carne Asada burrito or Al Pastor. Both very tasty and filling. 

Tip: They put cilantro in their burritos, so if you aren't a fan order without. 

Pros
- One of the top Mexican joints in the city
- Multiple locations around the bay
- Convenience: open til 2:30 weekdays, 3:30- weekends
- Good especially after bar or club hopping in the city -
- Open almost every day of the year (with a few days off) 

Cons

Like most parking in the city can be a hassle. 

I haven't been there in awhile but when I used to go often it is always the same guys working there. They are consistent and make the food how you want it.
author: Justin R.

description:
Good food and fast. This is my nacho stop every two weeks when I spoil myself. (I love nachos!) 

The meat is seasoned pretty good and they always stuff their burritos nicely. The quesadillas are massive and super good. Nachos...yum.

Sometimes they have their days...little salty or just too much juices on my nachos but normally, I'm a satisfied customer.
author: Michael H.

description:
El Farolito: my 3am mistress

I'll admit it. El Farolito definitely hits the spot after a hard night of drunken debauchery. I'm sure there has to be some science behind the pleasures of a boozy burrito or a noshed nachos. I came here with a friend at 2:30am and ordered a plate of lengua nachos while my friend ordered the carne asada burrito. The food came out fast and we were half way through everything by 2:40am before we even realized what had happened. Sure, I was full and sated but I wasn't very excited. I'm not sure if that was a good thing or not, since the meal was simply forgettable. I wasn't particularly blown away by anything and I was drunk. When I'm drunk, I get blown away pretty easily. They could have snuck a jalapeno into my nachos and I would have ran around the taqueria like Speedy Gonzales, pretending my fingers were six shooters. Luckily for my dignity, they didn't.

While my nachos were good, they were just that: good. I couldn't vouch for El Farolito like many of the die-hard fans who live and die by their Super Suiza Quesadilla or their Carne Asada Burrito. Will I be coming back here for a bite? Maybe. Maybe not. Perhaps, on another boozy night in the city, I'll be back. So if you hear shrills and screams coming from some Asian guy at 3am, don't worry. They just snuck a jalapeno into my nachos.
author: Frank Y.

description:
There must have been a change in customer service bc they really do suck!!

For one, when a customer calls in to place an order, make sure you take down their name and number so orders aren't lost. 

And two; When running the cashier, being bilingual helps. Not everyone that walks into a Taqueria speaks Spanish. *It took us 15 minutes just to place our order bc he couldn't understand what I was saying and vice versa. 
*I'm going to have to brush up on my Spanish :)

THANKS to all the cooks working swiftly to get all of the orders out in 5-10 minutes flat. They definitely keep this place running :)
author: Anonymous P.

description:
SIMPLY the BEST Burrito in SF, making it the best BURRITO in the BAY AREA, making it the BEST Burrito in CALIFORNIA, MAKING IT THE BEST BURRITO In the WORLD.

I was born and raise in SF's Mission District, so i know burrito's. I call this place La Mecca, because it is truly the holy land of burritos.

Its got the size, ts got the taste, and the serivce is so quick, you might get your burrito before you settle in your seat!

There are many El Farolito's but this one is by far my favorit. (followed by 24th and Alabama, and then 24th and mission)

if there is one thing they could improve its the consistency of the salsa Verde, sometimes it too hot, sometimes it needs more of a kick, but then you have nights were its perfect!
author: Ernesto P.

description: I haven't had them in awhile because this was the last thing I ate when I got food poisoning (it wasn't there fault. I are something downtown that ruined me but before it hit--and hit hard i might add--I ate here for dinner) now every time I smell them I get nausea. It sucks cuz I really miss there food!
author: Samantha E.

description:
My weekly burrito lunch land here, which is also happen to be my 800th review. We can endlessly debate on the best overall taqueria. Whether it's the two 24th St. locations or the outer-Mission location, El Farolito is by a huge-margin my favorite taqueria in the entire Bay Area. And it's also a favorite of Yelp's with the sticker visibly on the glass door. 

The quiet outer-Mission restaurant is bigger and a lot cleaner than the two busy 24th St. locations. But all three locations make some good meats to form some amazing super burrito, tacos, nachos and quesadilla. 

I stuck with what El Farolito specializes and cooks best; which is the Carne Asada (Grilled Steak) Super-burrito. For $6.00, the super silver bullet has choices from one of their tasty meats and beans, rice, cheese, guacamole and sour cream in a flour tortilla. The two busy 24th street location charge $.50 for a basket or bag of tortilla chip. But with this location, the chips are also included with our meal and refills are also free. The tasty and greasy filling in my colorful burrito, make a great dip for the endless chips. 

I believe all three locations including the outer-Mission location, in which I paid my meal, are "cash only". I'm so happy that I made my 800th review to my favorite taqueria in the Bay Area.
author: Matt G.

description:
This place is next to my girlfriend's place, which is perfect for late night food runs!

They have all the basics, from carne asada to lengua, tasting as authentic as it can get out here in SF. My favorite are the quesadillas because they pack so much between two flour tortillas flavor explode in your mouth with every bite. If you LOVE cheese (like me) you HAVE to get it. 

One drawback are the chips. They are corn chips, not bad.. but I do prefer the classical flour chip. I ordered nachos one night and man it was so hard to eat with the corn chips =[
author: Kevin C.

description: I usually go to the El Farlito on Mission and 24th, but my friends showed me this location which is much bigger! The Carne Asada Tacos are my favorite, it is topped with fresh onions, cilantro, and salsa. I've also tried the Super Quesadilla, Super Burrito, Chips/Salsa, and Horchata. I feel like you can't go wrong with anything on the menu... this place is too good.
author: Elaine N.

description: Came in for a late night snack and WOW! Had to order another one for myself after eating half of my boyfriend's burrito (and this is coming from a girl with a small appetite). Their super carne asada burritos were burning hot! They cook the meat as you order them and bring them to your table for you. Of course, there was a short line (maybe 5 or so minutes of wait?) but it was worth it!
author: Connie Y.

description: Cant say no with the supper Taco with chicken , they are so good, come back again tomorrow for sure ...
author: Bill J.

description: This is the best burrito place I've tried yet.  All the ingredients combined make the best tasting burrito I've had yet.  The chicken is seasoned perfectly and could actually stand alone.  This is now my all time favorite spot for burritos.
author: L C.

description:
Tried everything on the menu and fell in love with everything on the menu.  Burritos and tacos are awesome.  Cooked to perfection with the freshest ingredients.  Super moist meats and super delicious sauces.  You can't go wrong with a burrito from this spot!

Also, try their super nachos with everything on it.  Fills you up leaves you super happy!
author: Chai S.

description:
The food is great but the service with several of the workers sucks! When waiting for a table and asking a worker to clear one of the 4 dirty tables, he sneered "Wait!". Now i understand Mexican culture is not high on customer service but this was ridiculous.

The worker at the counter, who's brother works there also is awesome! But again if you are not interested in grumpy faces, and bad attitudes this is DEFINITELY not your spot.

Overall the food is affordable and a 7 out of 10. But the lack of cleanliness, poor customer service and confrontation makes it a pass.

From here on out i'll  be dining Mexican food elsewhere. When are they going to learn People want service in addition to quality and price?
author: Andrew N.

description: This is one of the spots I love going to. Usually, I get the carne asada quesadilla! You can't go wrong with that.
author: Ahmed A.

description:
Yes, the burrito here is good. That has been established. But what about their TORTAS?!?!?!? Fucking awesome. They easily rank as some of my most favorite in the city.  

Torta highlights:

1) They cook the cheese directly on the grill creating that slightly crispy cheese love.

2) They use thin slices of carne asada rather than chopping it up. It really does something to the texture of the sando. 

3) They use delicious fresh bread and tons of avocado and jalepenos. 

This sandwich is pure love. Try it, but take it to go. This location is quite grimy and pretty lacking in any atmosphere (hence only 4 stars).
author: L A.

description: I grew up in this neighborhood and was always faithful, but through the years they became very stingy with what they put in the burrito. I ordered a carne asada super burrito with extra sour cream. Half way through the burrito, there was no sour cream. When I approached the cashier about it they told me the sour cream is on the other side of the burrito and if I wanted even more I would have to pay another dollar in addition to what I originally paid for the extra. Uh. No thanks, you can find me at Guadalajara across the street.
author: Rinna P.

description:
After returning here late last night for my umpteenth time, thought I would jot it down.

Taquerias don't get any better than this joint. The chips are good, the salsa's always fresh and because they have a salsa bar, you can get verde, picante, fresca, basically whatever your little heart desires. 

Since so many other taqueria joints have decent burritos but lousy tacos, I always get the carna asada (soft tacos) here. They are just done dead on. The tortilla is soft and hot, the meat is off the hook and smoking hot off the grill, and the taco has just the right amount of onions, cilantro and hot sauce on it. Perfecto!! My mouth is watering just typing this. I can't go back again tonight, can I? Can I????
author: Dom L.

description: I had the biggest breakfast burrito of my life here the other day. It was delicious! I was full and should've put it down about halfway thru, but it was so good that I just devoured the whole damn thing. I wasn't the least bit of hungry for nearly 12 hours, no joke. So if you're on a budget and want to be full for most of the day for less than $10, get a breakfast burrito here!
author: Vincent L.

description: Yum Yum Yum. Amazing burritos. Always a long line but it goes by quickly. They even have a mariachi singer sometimes....really makes me feel like I'm in Mexico!
author: Mary D.

description:
Late night brain food? More like a night cap! 

I used to use this place as an excuse for brain food for my late nights studying, but always ended up sprawled out on my bed post-meal. So crammers, beware of failed exams or half completed essays.

I LOVE THIS PLACE! When I first moved to the area, a couple of people suggested this place - after the first bite, it was love. 

Suggestions:
Super quesadilla with carne asada.
Super quesadilla with carnitas (WINNER)
Tacos with carnitas.

I used to always get the Super Quesadilla with carne asada, but after trying it with carnitas it was no turning back! 

YOU MUST get the salsa - I want to say it's pico de gallo, anyway it is BOMB.COM. Add a kick of lemon/lime and it's smooth eating from there. 

Once you order, you can watch them slap on the ingredients - everything is fresh and plentiful. 

In comparison to a lot of other taquerias I've eaten at, this is by far my top fav! It's a perfect balance of ingredients. Not too salty, soggy, or bland. Some places are a hit or miss with the meats too - I noticed that sometimes it would taste like wet dog. (ok I've never tasted a wet dog, but I would think that's what it would taste like). This place, however, has consistent delicious meat. 

For those who have had La Victoria's in San Jose, buy a bottle of their orange sauce and lay it on a meal from here.
author: Ashley C.

description:
BEST SHRIMP TACOS EVER!

Every time I come here, try as I might, I can't leave without ordering a shrimp taco. These tacos come with salsa, bell peppers, cilantros, onions, and of course 6 giant, juicy shrimp! All thrown atop two tiny tortillas that can barely hold all of the ingredients together. The salsa is BOMB and has just the right amount of kick to it; these tacos definitely wouldn't be half as good without it. 

The old, grungy "tables and benches" feel of this place gives it lots of character. They're open late which great for people who live in the neighborhood because not much else is. 

Had to subtract a star because their burritos are pretty underwhelming to me. Yes, they're huge and you definitely get the bang for your buck, but taste-wise, they're just alright.
author: Helen L.

description: When you just wanna fill your empty stomach with your limited budget, this is the best place!
author: Naho I.

description:
So many good SF taqueria spots, so little time. Man there are so many. El Farolito is one of them.

El Farolito:
*is on (outer) Mission Street
*is cheap (super burrito cost about $6)
*is yummy, fast, & easy
*offers complimentary chips & salsa

Bottom line: good mission taqueria, so good that their super burritos made it on the SF's 2010 7x7 list.
author: Joy A.

description:
El Farolito is one of my favorite taquerias in the City.  I love their carne asada, pastor and lengua super burritos.  Its huge, filled with beans, sour cream, guacamole, rice and salsa.  They are very generous with their portion s and everything is seasoned to perfection.  

El Farolito an authentic no non sense taqueria where you'll often hear banda or mariachi music blasting an the TV is usually on the soccer game or a novela.
author: Henry S.

description:
Nothing will beat my Farolito on 24th but we came here on Cholo's lunch break and 5 star for the service and the huge cups for the frescas...Mmmmm Strawberry frescas...our favorite...and and yes Bud Lite too.

We got our usual tacos and got them togo.
author: Malou C.

description: By far the best taqueria in town, my family and I have been coming here for years. The fresh avocado  in my burrito, the meat is the best,  and its open until 3am!! Many a nights after clubbing we have ended up here! This is always our go to place for burritos, tacos, tostadas and horchata!
author: Monica L.

description:
People have been raving about El Farolito since I've told them I'm now in SF. Apparently deemed the best burrito place around, I was expecting mouth-watering, must-have, food-orgasmic burritos. Maybe it was too hyped up for me to really be impressed, but while El Farolito's is good, it wasn't as spectacular as everyone made it out to be.

The food quality is very good. I ordered the carnitas burrito and their carnitas tasted fresh and had good flavour. Overall the burrito was good. Also, when I think super burrito, I think of a larger burrito - not a burrito with added guac and sour cream and the same size. 

There's definitely better burritos out there where you can get more for your money, but I guess those are in SoCal and this is one of the better places up here.

Still good, probably great drunk food, definitely coming back if I do need a burriot fix.
author: Angela K.

description:
Open late, decent prices, decent food.

Craving a super carne asada quesadilla then I come here (cheese, meat, avocado and sour cream).  Or a night at the bars or clubs I stop by here for a late night dinner.  Not a big fan of their burritos; super tacos are okay (but I think La Corneta Taqueria in Glen Park is much better in terms of quality and price).

Average taqueria, if you're nearby stop by. If its 2am in the morning, stop by - if not, then there are plenty of other spots to eat at.
author: Lisa T.

description: Compared to taqueria cancun, I would say this place isn't as good.  The best thing about this place is that it's opened past 12 which is why they get a lot of customers late at night.  Majority o the people who come around 2am are those  who just came from the club.  Overall, if you're hungry and drunk, just come to el farolito for a good old burrito!
author: Steven S.

description:
Delicious!  My goto place for a late night - after drinking - food crave.

Make sure to get the Super Quesadilla and not the Regular Quesadilla.  The Regular Quesadilla is a lot smaller than the Super, but you will not know that by reading the menu.  I thought I could go without the sour cream, but not only did I not get the sour cream, I also did not get the amount of meat I wanted either!

Highly recommended.  See you there tonight!
author: Mike C.

description: I was seriously not a big fan of burritos and tacos till I tried El Farolito's. My boyfriend tried to persuade me into liking Mexican food so he would always take me here for lunch/dinner since he lives a couple of blocks away. I fell in love with their super nachos and carne asada super burrito. Even talking about it makes me want one now. I love how they're not stingy with their chips like other taquerias. Every time I'm in my hometown and I'm craving for a burrito, I think about El Farolitos and makes me miss coming here every week. Also another pro about this taqueria is that they're open late.
author: Janice V.

description:
MMMM.. El Farolito! Two words: Wet Burrito. It's their normal huge burrito topped with enchilada sauce and a fresh tomato slice. The sauce has a sweet and tangy taste to it that is so good! The whole thing lasts me at least two meals, sometimes three. You also get a free side of tortilla chips.

Okay, so I admit I haven't really ventured much around their menu because I have always stuck to the wet burrito, but why would I when it is so good. This is the place to go for a late night bite or a morning after hangover cure.
author: Danielle G.

description:
This is the best place for late night Mexican food after a night of drinking in the city.  So i have to admit, i've only had it drunk so I can't say how the food tastes sober, but it's pretty damn good regardless.  The portions are huge and i love the fact that they use FRESH avocados and are VERY generous with them too.  i feel like they must've stuffed my quesadilla with at LEAST half an avocado...probably more.  yummmmmm! they also give so much food that i end up taking half of it home and eating it the next day for lunch, and it's just as good as the night before.  This place is legit, and i wouldn't mind coming here and trying this place out in the daytime, non-intoxicated =)

Oh, just a couple of things about this place...the line can get kind of long and the place can get pretty freaking packed during the wee hours of the night, but i def think it's worth the wait.  it's also kinda on the dirty side as well...like the tables and floors and stuff.  But what real Mexican restaurant isn't??? hehe =)
author: Cat P.

description:
After an unsuccessful attempt to purchase tile adhesive in SF at 7pm I ended up in Daly City.  Then I ended up at a highly rated Mexican joint that was closed (would have been open if the Yelp/Mapquest interface didn't suck so bad).  I saw an In N Out sign and headed towards the familiar lights, but turned back when I saw the super sized line.  

So I cruised down the Mission with nothing but purposelessness and finding a good taqueria in mind.  I wanted to try Taqueria Guadalajara, but found a spot in front of El Farolito.  Cops were parked outside in the red zone, so I figured if they trust the workers to not cough a lung cookie into the mole, I'd give it a shot.

What a mistake.  I got a superior carne asada burrito and a carnitas taco.  The carnitas was ok, but the meat was a mixture of gristle, big chunks of meat and what carnitas should be--crispy torn strips of succulent pork.  Too much of the former and not enough of the latter.

Onto the burrito.  The only thing superior about it was how ordinary it was.  The meat had good flavor, but every third bite was full of gristle and the beans and rice were flavorless and plain.  4.5 yelp stars in the Mission late on a Saturday night for hopelessly ordinary Mexican food that tasted like it was made in a hospital cafeteria?
author: Nobody M.

description:
I hate secrets. What I hate more than secrets are things that are only slightly secretive but should be damn obvious! GRRRR El Farolito's salsa here is really really good and I can't seem to stay away:( the food here is also exceptionally deliicious. 

I always order the regular taco: just tortilla, meat, cilantro and salsa. How can something so simple be SOOO ADDICTING. oddly two is enough to fill me up though i always want to order more just for the satisfaction of having delicious food pile up before me, but I don't think my boyfriend would appreciate sitting with a cow stuffing her face with more than she can chew. He always orders the super burrito with rice, beans, meat, guac, cheese and of course top it with SALSAAAA. Try it, you'll never want to try anything else.
author: Connie C.

description:
super suiza...
I've been coming here for years
still my number one

=]
author: stevie b.

description:
There are so many Mexican places in this neighborhood so it seems that it would be important to make sure that you rock in every way possible... This place must not have brought their A game today.  

I got the carne asada super burrito and well the meat was not that seasoned and there was a ton of sour cream. There just was not that much seasoning going on here. The salsa was not that spicy and it was really watery.  I think that I am going to stick to the original place I went to in this area
author: Jennifer S.

description: Been a couple times.  Good super burritos.  Carne asada was good.  Al pastor was a bit weak, wish they had a better recipe because everything else is on point.  Salsas are good too.
author: T. E.

description:
Hungry?  Craving Mexican food?  Dateless for the night?

This is the place for you!!  First, food servings are large.  After the halfway mark, I struggle, but it's just that good to not stop munchin.  Yum-yum!  Second, large selection of Mexican food to meet the variety of taste buds.  Warning, you should not have el farlito during a date or before a date.  Yes, you might have a date, but in the end - dateless.  Haha!  El Farlito ... more like El FARTlito!

I love their shrimp burritos!  Definitely hits the spot while or before watching a game!
author: romeo b.

description:
Another spot where I drive by almost every day but never tried. I have always noticed this bigger than usual Mexican restaurant. After searching it up on Yelp and finding out that it has great reviews, I finally ate here.

Got a steak and shrimp super burrito which comes with tortilla chips. Total: $10.50. 
Not bad for the size of this burrito. And in here, Super really means SUPER!  If I can't finish it in one sitting, then its pretty dam big.

The taste and flavor is really on the spot. It's not too salty, hot, or bland. To get this perfect flavor takes time and skill and I assume they mastered both.

This place is truly an authentic Mexican restaurant that in the Mission, the capital of Mexican food in the city. 

Parking can be hassle and neighborhood is borderline is sketchy. But its pretty safe in the day time.

Definitely, definitely try this place. Have to be the top 5 Mexican taqueria in the CITY. 

Last quick tip and reminder: The salsa for the tortilla chips are self serve and is located in the front table. They did not tell me this or give me salsa the fist time I ordered there, I guess they think everyone is a regular. Now that you know, you wont be without salsa!
author: U L.

description: By far the best burritos I've had. Personal favorite but one of the most expensive on the menu -- $9.60 for a Super Shrimp Burrito. A wet, juicy wrapped burrito.
author: Nathaniel N.

description: Shrimp quesadilla mad bomb! Shrimp is actually a little sweet also, but I suggest to let it cool down for a bit before you eat it to prevent the cheese from dripping =)
author: J C.

description:
Since my introduction to El Farolito, I come here a lot. And I do mean a lot. Because I live nearby, it's no problem for me to drive by when the hunger pangs call and I feel like eating something really really bad for me at 12-am. 

I've noticed that since coming here these past few years the quality has gone down a little and I no longer want to finish the other half of my Super Carne Asada Burrito. Instead, I've been getting the Super Carne Asada Tacos instead. Just the right proportions for me and a little lighter than the super burrito. 

Their salsa bar is awesome, especially the pico di gallo. It has the perfect amount of heat. I love that I can get as much as I want because I use so much it's like I drink the stuff. Speaking of drinks, the Strawberry Aqua Fresca is sooo good. It's the real stuff, cause when you get to the bottom, you get all the seeds and everything.
author: Adrianna C.

description:
Got a super steak quesadilla.  Was still super hot when I got home (10 minute drive later.. had to wait a bit to unwrap the damn thing).  The carne asada was delicious!  Really, some of the best I had.  I felt the quesadilla was a bit greasy (a lot of cheese) but maybe it's because I haven't had one in a while...

There is a salsa bar.  Some guy got his hand in there.  Another guy dipped his chip directly into the salsa.  Things I can't unsee. 

I think there is also unlimited chips for dine-in 'cause some patron just held up his plate and got some more!   Chips were a little stale though.. not salty like I had hoped (good thing not everyone likes salty).

The super quesadilla cost about $8 and I couldn't even finish half (even while drunk!).  Glad I took it to go because the dining area was kinda grungy and old, think cafeteria style.

Food: 4/5
Price: 3.5/5
Atmosphere: 1.5/5
Service 3/5

I'm not good at math.  Somewhere around 3.5 - 4 stars overall.
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
pricey but fair.

food is pretty good.

carne asada is bomb.
author: Shock S.

description:
To the owner or manager of this particular location. Let me first start by saying your food is delicious! I've lived in the Excelsior district for the past 28 years and ever since I've had a job and my very first paychecks, I have always enjoyed your burritos and super nachos. 
With that made clear. The reason I have unfortunately placed two stars for this review is plain and simple. It is 6:35 on the night of October 26th and I have probably had the worst service I've ever had here. I don't expect much and I've had some so so experiences here but never anything that has made me take time out of my day to write a negative review. The cashier you have right now is just horrible. Seemed annoyed with any question I had. I don't want to say much more. I just want to let you know he shouldn't be on the register. I am not the type of person to say I will never be back but I WILL use the power of my dollar and debate whether to go in when he is at the register. The taqueria across the street has pretty good food too.
author: Felix C.

description:
Growing up in Excelsior has its perks, and one of them has got to be El Farolito Taqueria! It's the best place to get your fix for great Mexican food.  (If you're by 24th and Valencia I'd try Papalote's- another great place worthy of a great review!) The most important things you need to know: the food is savory & flavorful, they serve large portions, they're open late, the people are great and the prices are incredibly reasonable. 

The parking there can be difficult because it is located near a busy intersection of Mission and Excelsior. But definitely not as busy as the areas on 24th and Mission. If you drive up towards the neighborhood you might score parking and you can just walk down to the restaurant. Totally worth it. 

They have ample seating inside with the TV screens blaring the latest sporting events. Usually when I go it's soccer, but I digress. 

Favorite things to order: the Super Burrito with Carne Asada and extra Sour Cream, the Super Quesadilla Suiza, Aguas Frescas-Strawberry. They give you free tortilla chips with your choice of dip: salsa or avocado. They have beer on the menu too (american or mexican).

Late night: Clubbers mosey on over here (typically from Bottoms Up) to grab a late night meal. 

My cousin used to live in San Francisco and now she lives up in Idaho,  but whenever I visit her I HAVE to bring a Supreme Burrito from El Farolitos!

Check out their menu here: http://www.elfarolitoinc.com/
author: Jerisa V.

description: This place used to be better or my palette has matured.  Ordinary no frill Mexican food. I've found some really great taquerias because this place started sucking.
author: Chris F.

description:
I must admit, as some people have a "sweet tooth" I consider myself to have a "burrito tooth". I get random cravings for burritos amidst other meals that I could only conclude it's my hidden "burrito tooth" calling for a craving.

Anyway, I've had a fair share of weak burritos and burritos that shouldn't even be classified as a burrito, so when the whole world told me that I should try El Farolito for the best Mexican food, I did not hesitate. El Farolito definitely hasn't failed me since the first time I tried them. So far I've tried their quesadillas, nachos, burritos and most recently their tacos.

So here's the life changing moment. As I mentioned I'm an avid burrito fan, BUT despite having the "baby" burrito size I can never seem to finish an entire burrito! And I'm not really the cold food left over type of girl so I had to make minor adjustments to pleasing my "burrito tooth"-- I realized that perhaps it was just a "Mexican food tooth" rather than a "burrito tooth" because the last time I went to El Farolito my friend persuaded me to get the tacos instead of a burrito. At first I was a little skeptical. I mean I've tried tacos at other places and those things seem TINY. I thought that investing my money into a burrito would be the best choice because despite the fact that I can never finish it whole, I'd still be fulfilled. But somehow, I decided it was time for a change and just go with the taco instead.

I went with the shrimp taco since shrimp never seems to fail. When my plate came, I already felt disappointed. I thought a six year old could eat this plate and still would have hunger pangs, but I was wrong! One shrimp taco from El Farolito does wonders. You know the story where Jesus keeps mass producing bread and fish for his people out of no where? I swear that is exactly what El Farolito's shrimp taco did for me. Even though the plate looked like it was little, somehow the Jesus behind the El Farolito kept providing me with fulfilling goodness that I was stuffed with just one taco. But to say the least, the day I tried El Farolito's shrimp taco was by far the most life changing event ever.
author: Ally C.

description:
I was skeptical when my sister MADE me come here to try their tacos. But boy, they are DELICIOUSLY TO DIE FOR! I swear it's better than the Socal/San Diego joints that everyone raves about. So good! 

We tried a few of their tacos with different meats, and they were all delicious! We were stuffed with 2 tacos each, but my sister insisted we get an al pastor burrito to go because it's THAT good. The Chile Verde was my FAVORITE! A few hours later, when it was cold, I took my first bite. Boy, it was DELICIOUS (and it was no longer fresh and hot!) 

I am so ready to go back and eat their burritos, and perhaps try their quesadillas too. Too bad my stomach can only fit so much food... :(
author: Diana L.

description:
This place looks kinda run down from the outside, So I go there... since my friend said this place is good. I took his word for it. When you order I guess pretty much anything, you get a side of chips. Water comes straight from the tap, literally. So I order a Shrimp Burrito... it was good. The shrimp they used were fresh and hella big. :)
Was not disappointed at all, will try other things next time I am in the area.
author: Dang-Khoa H.

description:
whenever i crave for burritos... THIS IS THE ONLY PLACE I GO TO!

Love their super carne asada burrito with avocado.

After a night out... my friends and i usually go here for a late night snack. 

They are open late of course!

Fast service.

kinda of greedy with the tortilla chips tho..but its all good!

prices aren't expensive....a super burrito may cost less than $9 but it is HUGE!
author: Sarah F.

description: Usually I'll get a super burrito with carnitas and no salsa in it. The ingredients here are very fresh and i'm glad that they use fresh avocados that are sliced very nicely. I think it's probably one of the best burrito joints in the city hands down.
author: Eric M.

description: Can't beat their burritos in this area.  This is a go to spot for me.  I will often drive out of my way to get lunch here, sometimes that means crossing the Bay Bridge.
author: Bay M.

description: I wish this place was good, but it is not. Their late hours make them popular I guess, but their vegi burritos are among the worst in town - and I've done a lot of research on the subject. The beans (which are often under cooked), the rice (which is often soapy tasting), the salsa all taste like they've had a shaker of salt dumped into it. The portions are huge, but given that the food is bad that's not exactly a selling point. Plus the prices vary up to 2 dollars for the same burrito depending on who's working. I do not recommend.
author: Dan W.

description:
Sad how their food is quite delicious while their customer service is quite horrendous. 

I ordered three burritos while the cashier only gave me two bags. I tried explaining to him that the meal is for three people and should come with three bags of chips. Then this guy had the balls to tell me "only one bag of chip per person and I already gave you two. One more bag will be 60 cents" Did this asshole not understand what I just said? Did he want my whole family to come buy their meal separately? 

The attitude was horrible and I was just putting money in his pocket to teach him some customer service. If I ever eat here again my name is not Dorian!
author: Dorian T.

description:
BEST burritos in SF!   We are regulars.  My brothers come all the way from East Palo Alto for burritos at this place.

Shrimp cocktails are off the hook!  

Enjoy!!!
author: Carina M.

description:
Opens late! My kind of place to get some late night dinner.

Fast, cheap, a crapload amount, and delicious burritos.

The quesadilla were different form what i'm used to. I'm used to the round tortillas cut into quarters. Theirs are wrapped without the ends tucked in, so watch out for food falling out!
author: Jennifer Q.

description: This place has the best carne asada burrito ever! Pretty quick service and friendly staff. I go here alot for my lunch break.
author: Adrienne W.

description:
GDG: GOD DAMN GREAT! I tried both places El Farolito and Taqueria Guadalajara (Across the street) on the same day and El Farolito definitely won out! The tacos, despite being $2.25 each, they have loads of meat piled a good 2 or 3 inches on their tacos. It was amazing! The pastor was the best I've had in the bay! and the best I've had since leaving Los Angeles! The chile verde and the carnitas are right up there for #2 and #3 favorite behind the al pastor! The carna asada was so-so.

Pros:
- GDG: GOD DAMN GREAT Food
- Loads of meat on the tacos
- Friendly Staff
- Clean (for this type of restaurant)

Cons: 
- $2.25 for a taco (usually $1.25 at other places)

Overall: RECOMMENDED! Definitely better than Taqueria Guadalajara across the street!

p.s. I WILL BE BACK! IT'S SO GOOD!
author: Kevin L.

description: This was my Go-To taqueria joint when I lived in the city.  After moving to Miami, I realize what I miss:  REAL Mexican food.  However, I try to come here whenever I come back to SF.  It's great after a night out drinking.  Mexican food always seems to taste better when you're drunk.  The pastor is great.  I generally order everything here with their pastor.  You really can't go wrong with pastor in the burritos or tacos.  I'm not a huge fan of their tortilla chips, they taste like regular chips you get from the grocery store,  but their salsas are good.  The avocados are sliced and always fresh.  There's a ton of taquerias around the Mission/ Outer Mission/ Excelsior but this where I always choose to hit up for quick, fresh, greasy Mexican food!
author: Kevin C.

description:
258 reviews and 4.5 stars??!!!  Like we say in Norcal, it's HELLA good!  I'll tell you WHY:

El Farolito's is HANDS DOWN THE BEST Mexican food in San Francisco.  Every authentic (or so-called authentic) Mexican restaurant I've been to thus far doesn't TOUCH this place at all, and I've been to  quite a number of Mexican restaurants spanning the West Coast.  One that comes to a close 2nd place that I love is Avila's El Ranchito Mexican Restaurant in Corona Del Mar, CA.  El Farolito's, however, makes that place look like a joke!

I started going to El Farolito's about 11 or 12 years ago, and if I still lived close by, I would go there every single time I had a craving for authentic Mexican food.

Their super burritos and suizas are probably the best things on the menu.  They are DELISH!

I am truly nostalgic for this place.  This will always be my number 1 favorite Mexican restaurant.  IT IS TO DIE FOR!
author: Brenda R.

description: The only place in town where I go for burritos and quesadillas. Been coming here for almost 10 years now, and the food always taste consistent. I have never been dissatisfied eating here. I usually come late night.The guy that takes your order is very nice. He greets you with a smile. So if you're thinking about some good burritos or quesadillas. Give El farolitos a try, you won't be disappointed.
author: Jay M.

description: When late night munchies called in one time I had to satisfy my appetite after the bar. My brain ran like Speedy Gonzales from eating here because the Carne Asada tacos with the amount of chips and options of salsa provided hit the spot. The nachos were good too despite the messiness but hey I'll still eat it! Overall the prices are a great value because the food is SUPER legit.
author: Brandon H.

description:
3.5
honestly, the only time i come here is when i am drunk....hahaha. my friend used to bartend at bottoms up across the street so i would come here after to get a bite to eat. i really like the quesadillas here. super yummy. the chips are pretty much flavorless pieces of cardboard, but i still munch on it cuz i'm hungry and eagerly watching my food being prepared by the cooks. overall, its not in the best area but have your friends by your side and you will be A-OK :)
author: Angela D.

description:
Boy oh boy! For some real good, cheap eats, especially on the late night creep, this is the place! Those who know, know that El Farolito is one of the go-to spots after a night out on the town. 

I went to the Giants game last Friday and had the best seats ever (at least for me that is). Right after, I was initially craving a burrito but when I got to the spot, I opted for a grande quesadilla suiza. I tell ya, I am never let down when I order this. Fulfilling...to say the least. Topping it off with a nice large horchata to wash it all down. Nothing fancy here, just good ole authentic Mexican food.
author: Ivan F.

description: My friend ordered to go on 8-18-13 12:50am'sh as I waited in front of this restaurant.  He had the burrito and chicken quesadilla.  Afterwards, we returned to the connection bar, outside food was allowed, that was cool. My friend shared the quesadilla which was actually pretty good.
author: Jer W.

description:
El Farolito is a Mission classic! Pretty much the best taqueria in SF, in my opinion. 

My favorite thing to get there is the simple burrito with boiled chicken. Now most folks will get their burrito meats grilled, and I'll admit boiled chicken doesn't sound as appetizing, but trust me. The liquid they use to boil the chicken leaves it both tasty and juicy and it's WHITE meat. No mean feat to keep white meat juicy.

Great for late night, as that's how most people were introduced to it no doubt. But it's great for lunch as well.

Financial District people here's an idea... if you close to BART in the Fi-Di, then your just a short ten minute BART ride to El Farolito which is right at the top of 24th Street/Mission BART. Skip that crappy Financial District burrito and get yourself the REAL DEAL!
author: James S.

description:
AMAZING.

The super suiza quesadilla is divine! Perfectly cheesy, meaty and delicious every time. This quesadilla is always bursting with flavor. They always hook it up with the chips and the salsas are amazingly flavorful.

The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because I always have to wait in a huge line, and they're cash only!
author: Jena R.

description:
whaaaaaat??? i never wrote a review about this place.  for shame...

my buddies and i have been coming here for years...and for only one item on their menu...the super quesadilla with carne asada.  the yummy deliciousness of generous amounts of meat, cheese, avocado, and sour cream...all stuffed in a large tortilla and placed on the grill...SO GOOD!!!

their little salsa bar area is decent...everything you really need to complement whatever you order there.  the guy at the register is always nice and the guys behind the counter are working at lightning speeds to get your food out.

the best quesadillas...ever...you're missing out if you haven't tried one!
author: Jen W.

description: One of the most popular late night drunchies stops. Huge portions at a good price. I always get the carne asada quesadilla or burrito, both of which pretty much have the same ingredients but are contained by their tortillas differently. Hits the spot when a mexican food craving plagues me. Would recommend to friends.
author: Sannie L.

description:
My favorite taqueria hands down! Nom nom nom burnt steak and gooey cheese.....DROOLS! 

A loyal customer since circa 1998! They have the most delish steak and shrimp burrito! I drench it in salsa verde and limes. A must try is the steak super nachos with no beans, add rice, comes with salsa, gooey white cheese, guacamole and hot sauce. YUMS! Another must try is the steak quesadilla - you will not be disappointed. Avocados galore in there and make sure u squeeze lime into each bite. 

A+ for being open late on weekends until like 4am on Saturdays. If you have late night munchies, this is the place for you.

YAH, for burnt STEAK because that's why I keep coming back ^_^
author: Rose L.

description:
El Farolito is my #1 burrito spot. I usually get a super burrito & it always fills me up. I can never finish it, but I love having it as leftovers for the next day. 

I like how they're open late and how service is quick. Parking sucks - day or night, since a lot of people go here. 

Whenever I crave burritos - El Faro is the place I always go.
author: Michelle F.

description:
While there are haters out here, who rightly point out that SF pales in comparison to basically everywhere else in CA that is farther south for overall quality of mexican food, El Farolito delivers in the city. Super Quesadilla is simply unrivaled. Their burrito's have the most meat bar none.

I will say that I rate Taqueria Can-Cun's burritos ever so slightly higher, because of better salsa in the burrito...but Farrolito smashes them on volume of meat. So it's a tradeoff really. Add in that at Farolito there are so many tasty options I usually just come here!

Keep holding it down fellas!
author: Josh S.

description:
Stopped by this place on my road trip down through California and would definitely say that this was one of the best burritos I've ever had.

I ordered their carne asada super burrito and was surprised at how large their servings are. I could only eat about half of it and saved the rest for later. 

With decent prices, amazing food and huge proportions, this place is a must if you're in the area :)
author: Kim E.

description:
I live right next to a taqueria and it was amazing until i came here. 
My friend kept raving about them being the best taqueria in SF so i finally gave it a try. 
OMG
that's all i kept saying. excuse me for talking while eating, but it was superb. by far one of my favorite taquerias....although i still got mad love for the taco trucks.
author: Brenda S.

description:
This is the spot to come to after a night at the bar or club. We usually come here to get a Super Burrito or a Super Quesadilla. It hits the spot and its damn good. 

Price- Decent

Time- Easy street parking, maybe cause we come so late at night lol

Will I come back?- Yes
author: Patrick S.

description:
BEST Carne Asada Quesadillas EVER. 

Yes, even better than its sister store on 24th and Mission.  The super quesadilla at this El Farolito is never soggy like at the other joint; instead the flour tortilla is crunchy filled with warm cheese, sour cream, avocado and savory meat.  

The quesadilla is a little over a foot long which for a normal appetite can be split into two meals and reheated, however whenever I come here with the intention to save the other half, I always end up devouring the ENTIRE quesadilla myself. =X I definitely recommend dining-in to enjoy the goodness.
author: Shirley W.

description:
El Farolito never cease to disappoint me. 

I generally order their super burritos with carne asada meat, super nachos and super quesadillas. Each are huge portions that's worth my money. Just add a tad bit of Tapatio sauce and I'm good to go.

I love this Mexican joint because of its location, easy street parking, debit friendly and the FREE chips and (3) kinds of salsa that comes with your order is fantabulous. 

I gotta say, their food hits the spot whenever I'm craving be if it is lunch, dinner or late night munchies. 

oh and also, the service and staff are great. They have accommodated my needs a few times when I wanted the channel to be switched to a basketball or football game.
author: Anna R.

description: This place is kind of hidden. But it's definitely authentic. A local of the area suggested we come here. I ordered a burrito with guacamole, broiled chicken, onions, and rice. Wow...definitely plane. Why do people even bother with Mexican food if there's no pico de gallo?? It's useless. I tried to submerge the plain burrito in their delicious green sauce, but it did nothing. Don't get the burritos. Their tacos and steak quesadilla looked more promising. The quesadilla was HUGE and dripping with cheese. The tacos are more colourful and stuffed.
author: Han P.

description: Biggest super burrito in the near proximity, carne asada is on point. Even if there's a line, it's worth it to stick it out rather than going across the street. Also, they serve cabeza if you are feeling like getting a lil crazy.
author: Jon P.

description: I can't believe I haven't reviewed my FAVORITE burrito place in SF yet! What! I've been going here for years! My friend lives directly across the street so when I think I'm going to go see Nalini, I'm actually thinking Super Burrito day!! MMM...I remember the days when the super burritos were less than $4 today they are about $6-7 damn inflations! The meat is so good here, the burritos are HUGE! and the salsas are fresh. I HEART MY BURRITO that's why I'm fat. I will miss you during my diet, as soon as my pants are loose again I will come see you. I've also had their taco salad, yum! And I've had their quesadilla, and super nachos real good too!
author: Karen T.

description:
Been going here even before some of the people that work at this location were born.  So after years of loyalty to this taqueria I have to give them one star because of what happened to me today.  I go there with my girl and she orders her usual torta and I order a super burrito.  A few minutes after, the young lady brings me 2 burritos, I tell her politely that the order is wrong, i ordered 1 burrito and 1 torta.  I end up going up to the counter  and telling him that my order is wrong.  He says, no I thought you wanted 2 burritos so thats what I wrote down and thats what you got.  I say, look we just want the torta, we havent touched the food, why cant we just have a torta?  Guy looks at me and says "thats your order because that is what I wrote".  There was a huge line and I didnt want to hold up the line so I just asked for a bag so I could take the food home because I was tired of the showdown that seemed to be happening.

I totally understand that these folks deal with all kinds of rude costumers and the guy taking orders has to have a thick skin, I  have seen some crazy shit at this location. You get folks saying racist things to the workers, drunk and loud folks, etc.  But I have always, and I mean always, been very polite to the folks that work there.  Even as I write this, I cant understand why I could not just get what I ordered.  Screw this place. I'm going to stick to Farolitos on 24th and Alabama.  Besides, finding parking here is about as worse as trying to find parking in China Town or North Beach.
author: Link W.

description: Was running errands and asked a teller at the Wells Fargo nearby where he ate lunch, and he said to get the Super Burrito from here. It did not disappoint! I had the carnitas and it was amazing, succulent and for a great price!
author: Nadia M.

description:
This place easily deserves 5 stars as it serves some of best Mexican food I have ever had. Close to CCSF the place isn't really around anything special but a nice neighborhood. Here I will suggest three of my most favorite items on the menu and hopefully it will get your taste buds going as well.

Always giving a generous portion of meat first up is the most common type of food, the burrito. There is a regular size and a super size that you can order. The difference between the two is one comes with everything and the smaller one comes without guac and sour cream. I use to always order the carne asada but over time my favorite had to be the carnitas. Perfectly seasoned pork with a moth watering appetite made a perfect meal. Each bite brought an explosion of flavors that never get old.

Second up has to be the nachos. Never one to shy away from cheese and chips, this place gives a healthy portion of both along with a ton of meat. Why go to some fancy sit down place and pay more than ten bucks when you can get quality for all around six bucks? The nachos ordered came out huge and fresh and I can tell you they put real cheese on not that cheese whiz stuff.

Last and my personal favorite has to be the quesadilla suiza. Sometimes when I'm just feeling like something with just the meat all compacted together this is what I get. A perfect blend of meat and cheese all shoved together in a compact sandwich type deal in my opinion is amazing.

Since I've been coming here for years now, I always get complimentary chips, I know that they have a policy of charging .50 cents for them but I've never had to worry about that. Just eat in and that shouldn't be a problem. I've always had the best customer service and they even serve you at the table! What's not to like about a fast food joint having some class? Try their horchata or strawberry fresca  and your set for a perfect meal. Also to think that they have a good sized location helps a lot as well.
author: Jason Y.

description:
In a city full of Mexican Restaurants, El Farolito stands far above the rest.  This has to be some of the best Mexican food out there.

This is my absolute favorite place to eat late night...screw it, this might be my favorite place to eat at any time of the day.  

To say the food is perfect is an understatement, the food is always on point and fantastic.  
 
I usually order a Super Carne Asada Quesadilla Suiza with a Super Carne Asada side of Nachos.  This place is great whether it be the fast service, large portions, reasonable prices, or just some flat out great food.
author: David B.

description:
Late Night? Check.
Shrimp + Steak Burrito? Check
Parking? Check.
NO CHECKS. Cash and visa only !
My friend ate a shrimp burrito, then finger banged a girl.
It was THAT good.
and they have some crazy latin music channel always playing some hits.
author: kevin h.

description: I honestly didn't like the food here. I've been to a couple taquerias around SF and this is the worst one. I order a shrimp quesadilla that didn't have any taste at all. My friend got the quesadilla de al pastor. The meat was hard and instead of having that pastor taste, it tasted like a chile or chorizo seasoning taste. Go to taqueria Guadalajara across the street which is way better, you'll thank me for this one. Trust me on this, I'm a Mexicana chick who loves to grub on her Mexican food.
author: Mari M.

description:
Its about damn time I wrote a review for this place. Where to begin about El Farolito. Maybe the fact that they have multiple locations and all of them are damn good?

Well, this location is particular is down the street from my apartment so I frequent this place way too often then I need to. Since I take pride in calling myself a burrito connoisseur, I've had my fair share of burritos. 

Man whatever this place is doing, they are doing it damn right. But I think the highlight for me would be there salsa. Now, when you think salsa.. its usually the red one. But oh does this place do the green one some justice! They use avocado chunks in it! WTF.. You heard me right... 

You know this place is doing something right when there is like 20 other taquerias in the vicinity and they STILL get a large crowd.
author: Jason C.

description:
If the Comic Book Guy from The Simpsons ever ate a burrito here, he would probably say something like, "Best. Burritos. Ever". Do they have the "best burritos ever" here? That's up for debate since I've never been to every place that serves burritos on this planet. But do I think they have the best burritos in the Bay Area? Si, es verdad, mis amigos. One of my friends from college was always hyping this place up, and when I finally made it out here with the old crew, I became a believer in less than 2 bites. The food here definitely lived up to the hype!

I don't believe in writing reviews that only consist of 1 paragraph (well, not anymore, at least), so I'm going to leave you guys with a mini Spanish lesson. It's been a while since I took Spanish in high school (the mid-90's), so my skills might be a little, umm, rusty...

Los burritos son impresionantes en El Farolito. (The burritos are awesome at El Farolito.)

Taco Bell se ponen a la vergüenza. (They put Taco Bell to shame.)

Aquí es su invitación a la fiesta en el elefante de los pantalones. (Here is your invitation to the party in the elephant's pants.)
author: Mark J.

description: I had their super quesadilla, which included lots and lots of cheese, guacamole, and sour cream with carne asada. The portion was HUGE and came with the standard side of chips. It took me two meals to finish it! I thought it was pretty good, but then again it's also pretty hard to screw up a quesadilla, and anything is yummy with lots of cheese!
author: Rose Y.

description:
Mmmmm. I love their food, esp when it's late night. One of the best Mexican food places I've eaten at, and I love how it's so close to where I live! I enjoy how easy to reach this place is... how easy it is for me to get the scrumptious carne asada quesadillas and strawberry water. OMG, you have to try their strawberry water. This is the place where I discovered such thing. Such a yummy invention.

Farolito's is perfect for those times where I'm out all night and hungry.
author: Samantha B.

description:
I was introduced to El Farolito by an old friend of mine when I was in 8th grade, LOL. I still remember what I ordered to this day because it is something I still occasionally order on my visits to El Farolito -- the quesadilla suiza.  I wasn't sure what to expect but let me tell you, it was amazing.

I have been coming to El Farolito frequently, especially during high school, but I have always ordered the super burrito. I went so often that the friendly man at the register knew my order by heart.  I was a pretty picky eater back then and didn't want all those add-ons in my burrito so I was impressed at how good his memory was. Anyway, I have yet to try a burrito as delicious as the super burrito from El Farolito!  The super burrito is filling so I always save the rest for the next day and after a quick reheat in the microwave, it is still just as good.

I highly recommend anyone who is looking to try Authentic, mouth-watering, Mexican food to try El Farolito. I can guarantee that you will become a regular for years to come.
author: Gabby T.

description: So you all should know that not every taqueria is the same. As for me, I have 3 different taquerias where I go to, depending on what I feel like having.. This Farolito's is best known for thier Super Quesadilla Suiza; say it with me now; "Kay-Suh-Dia, Sue-iza"! Lol!!   Really though!! I have had other quesadillas at other places and none compare to El Farolitos! Their prices are very reasonable and they do not charge for chips and salsa like other places do.. This spot is great anytime!!
author: Cesar N.

description: Awful vegetarian burrito.  Too much lettuce.  Too much ice cold salsa.  "Guacamole" that is flavorless, and they maybe put a teaspoon in the burrito.  Therre are loats of taqueria's in SF, find another one.
author: schmoo l.

description: The best Taqueria in the Bay. All the locations are great. The chips are always fresh, the salsa verde is my favorite salsa in existence. Back when I used to eat meat I remember the meat tasting amazing. I now get pretty much the same thing. Veggie nachos, not refried beans, however black and pinto. Not Guacamole, Avocado instead. Add the cilantro and onion, add tomatio sauce, and there you have it. The guys who work at this particular location are really nice guys and have no problem making this altered meal for me.
author: Neil W.

description:
Very popular late night spot in the Excelsior district, since there's not many alternatives in the neighborhood. There's plenty of seats for all the inebriated clientele, but to go seemed like a popular choice.

I tried carnitas, cabeza, and lengua tacos. Carnitas was pretty dry, not very good. Cabeza and lengua were decent, moist and beefy. 

The salsa bar looked a bit unsanitary, with a cleaning rag hanging out right on the front edge. Some of the tasty salsa verde had spilled into the oregano spiced pico de gallo as well. 

Chips are grainy, store bought and a good way for the restaurant to limit the intake of their salsa verde, however I found away around that and used it for my tacos.

Quesadilla suiza and super tacos seemed to be popular choices. I was warned to stay away from the al pastor.
author: Derrick V.

description: Ive been going to this spot for years. The food speaks for itself. Do yourself a favor and go eat there at a late night.
author: Y r.

description: I have been coming to this place for 7 years now and I still love this place. The food here is not over priced and it is so filling. Because this place closes at a very late time, it is a great place to go to after drinking or hanging out with friends.
author: Danny W.

description:
I used to live a few blocks away from El Farolito and didn't realize how good i had it.  I've tried many a burrito up and down the Bay and CA.  El Farolito's is by far my favorite.  I had been dreaming about the day I could again bite into another juicy Mission Style carne asada super burrito for the last few years.  Finally!!! Mmmmmm!!!! 
If you live in SF, you won't understand unless you've been gone awhile.  The only thing I wish they would change are those nasty chips!  Bring your own if you can!
author: N H.

description: This is my favorite burrito place, and trust me I've tried a lot of burritos. My girlfriend likes these burritos so much that I packed them up and brought them to her 3,000 miles away once, and they were still as good as fresh. I'm not into the carne asada, but I love their chicken burrito (with some jalapenos added).  Remember to get it super!
author: Artur R.

description:
Burritos, Super Quesadillas & Tacos de Tripas!

When I was living in SF I swore by this place. I know in SF there is a ton of other places to eat Burritos but this location is my favorite because it is really good. Unlike other locations, The people here take their time to make your burrito or whatever you ordered! Hey sometimes they throw in a bag of chips for free. You can never go wrong by ordering a Burrito de Pollo Asado (tons of flavor in the chicke) or a super quesadilla de carne Asada (sour cream, salsa and avacado just make a killer combination)! On another note, they sometimes  have tacos de tripas (Fried tripe). I know people think it's gross, but just order one, ask for a piece of lemon, squeeze lemong onto taco and throw some salt on it and Bam - Ecstasy! 

Gracias a todos los trabajadores de el Farolito for making great burritos and Quesadillas!
author: John A.

description: Sorry, I failed to see what was so amazing about this place.  Food was pretty mediocre imo.  I went w/ the carne asada dinner which came with two large but thin slices of beef, sliced up avocado, lettuce, a tomato slice and some grilled green onions.  My dish was nothing special although a bite of my gf's carne asada taco showed promise.  But all around, lackluster compared to what I was expecting.
author: Derrick C.

description:
HUMONGOUS shrimp burrito.  it's ridiculous how generous they are with the amount of shrimp: 12!  sure it's close to $10, but worth it.  big enough to feed two, or one with a large appetite.

mmm.
author: Sheri N.

description:
"When I have the munchies and want burrito or quesadilla washed down with some horchata, and I know the only other things open at 1am are Jack in the Crack, Safeway or 7-11, El Farolito is my place!

Living in LA for a few years, I would crave one of their super quesadillas. Their combination of cheese, steak and grease leaves me wanting more. And their portions are huge! My case of the munchies can sometimes be monstrous, but El Farolito's always comes through!

They're open until the crack of dawn for all of you on that late night hype!"
author: Ron C.

description: So good! The super shrimp burrito is my all time favorite. My boyfriend always gets the steak quesadilla or the mini tacos and they're damn good too. The employees are always very friendly.
author: Melissa C.

description: Súper suiza all night long,love this spot,in my hood,fast and open late!
author: Jessie B.

description:
I love this place!!! This is the only place I get my super burritos, seriously I do not go anywhere else. I've been hitting this spot as long as I can remember. I tried getting a super burrito at Orale Orale by my work and I only took ONE bite from that burrito and gave it to my garbage disposal like older brother. 
I love that this place stays open late, which was a big help when I would crave my super burritos in the middle of the night while I was pregnant. Don't get me wrong, super burritos aren't the only thing I order. Everything here is GUUUD.
author: Anna P.

description:
I don't get the big deal about this place.

Well, to be fair, there was only one thing I didn't like, and that was how ridiculously salty the meat was. The price was great, the rest of the burrito was great, the portions were great, but the meat was so salty to the point of almost being inedible.

I'm wondering if this gets such high reviews because people come here so often when drunk and saltiness isn't an issue when you've had a lot to drink.
author: Mark A.

description: You don't know what a good burrito/suiza/taco tastes like until you've eaten here. I have been a loyal customer for many years now. It's cheap, open late night, street parking, gets busy but service is fast and friendly, generous portions, accepts credit cards. What more can you ask for?!  I mean, living in SF, you are surrounded by taquerias, including one right across the street! But, I prefer to always come back to this spot.
author: April C.

description:
This place definitely hits the spot when you're really hungry. The food tastes great and the portions could be more consistent but it's REALLY good. 

I always order the super nachos and they are to die-for. The order always comes with a bag of chips and salsa which are always great to have on the side or with the nachos. 

They open late night so that's a plus for people that are driving around looking for a late night snack. They also have a breakfast menu so I think they open early as well.
author: Just Meeh B.

description:
Yum.  I'm pretty simple when it comes to my food.  I know what I like, and I stick with it.  I don't try new things, at least not on my dime!  

This location is just down the street from my house, so whenever my hubby is in the mood for some good ol' Mexican food, I get the simple as can be, Quesadilla.  

My husband orders an actual burrito, which he loves as well :)
author: Alice E.

description: I LOVE this place.  This is my all time favorite mexican restaurant.  Once you've gotten a burrito here, nothing else will suffice.  It's a plus that this place is open until the AMs, so when you're feeling fat, you know you could just stop by.
author: Karen X.

description:
1. CROWDED at 3AM on a saturday night in the middle of excelsior? they're doing something right.
2. lengua super burrito. 5 star quality. rice was cooked perfectly, beans weren't smothered in lard, lettuce was fresh. tortilla was crisp. green habanero sauce was poppppin, so was the regular salsa. 


3. the strawberry fresca honestly gets 10/5 stars by itself, no joke.
4. clean enough place to grub at, crowd wasn't starting trouble.. enough tables to go around. TV was on some old show with sofia vergara (modern family chica) hosting. she's 15/5 stars.. again, no joke.
5. i left DISGUSTINGLY full.. the burrito was HUGE. and i'm a big boy with a healthy appetite, it takes a lot to fill this stomach.

6. yes the quality and taste out do burrito spots in san jose, however the price does not. $8 FOR A BURRITO?! you realize that for $2 LESS, i can get a drink, cinnamon twists, a 5-layer burrito, beef burrito, AND crunchwrap supreme from taco bells $5-box combo meal!?

BURRITO = CRACCCCKEN. price = no bueno
author: Braden K.

description:
I've only been here for one item - the super nachos. I only have one thing to say about that ... walk across the street and get your nachos at guadalajara. Their nachos are 10x better. But with that being said, the nachos here are better than most other places'. Its a shame they set up shop so close to guadalajara.

*sidenote yay 50 reviews!
author: Colin H.

description: Freakin' huge super burrito! Carne asada was a little over cooked so a lil' chewy. The beans were perfectly seasoned and I love that they put cheese in it! Comes with real chips (not greasy at all) and as much salsa as you like and for about $7 got lunch and leftover burrito for dinner. It's no King Taco (I'm a SoCal girl) but it will do when I want to be reminded of home.
author: Vanessa C.

description: Really great burritos.  Not quite as good as El Pelon in Boston, but the best I've found in San Francisco (and now I'll wait for all of the outraged Californians who think CA has a monopoly on good Mexican food... Ok, all done?  Good.) and generally excellent.  I guess my only complaints are that the burritos feel heavier in the stomach than I think they need to -- granted any burrito is gonna be heavy, but this one especially so -- and that the ingredients *sometimes* don't seem the freshest (depends on the day).
