Still, in all, it's definitely a great choice for a burrito in the city.
author: Ian E.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE! 

The burritos are huge, the price is cheap, and it's open after midnight! I actually saved their phone number into my phone so that my food would be ready when I get there, avoiding the usual long line! I know, I know...lazy and impatient but whatever!

The staff is pretty funny too so that's an extra plus....I only gave them 4 stars because well...the place is a little dirty and the parking is ridiculous. But other than that, its yummy...


My advice...a bottle of La Victoria's Orange sauce + El Farolito Super Burrito/ Super Quesadilla=A MATCH MADE IN HEAVEN.
author: Bianca L.

description:
Even the Oracle of Yelp Talk couldn't seem to answer if/how all these El Farolitos are related, so in the spirit of investigation I headed down to Onondaga & Mission (quite the little food nexus of the Excelsior, isn't it?) to check out this branch.  But, alas, the results are inconclusive.  The signs look alike, but are the menus?  I don't think so.  Perhaps it will just have to be one of those sacred San Francisco mysteries.  At any rate, it's a much larger place than the den-like main Farolito (though the front windows need to be larger), and naturally far less crowded given the location--of course, judging by the Yelp reviews, they get more of a 2 AM rush than a lunch rush anyway (but who the hell is walking around here at 2 AM?  It's not like there's a happening bar scene (note to self: or *is* there?)).

Ok, so on to the important stuff: finally a taqueria that backs up its shrimp dishes with cold hard numbers: they promise a full dozen in every burrito, and they ain't small either (Papalote's, I am looking in your direction).  It's $9, sure, but it looks about the size of a Duraflame log, so it's totally splittable.  And yes, you do get free chips, but they're not fresh-cooked, so meh.  Not that I didn't devour them anyway.
author: Wes M.

description:
Ahh, this place reminds me of off campus lunch in HS. It was either here, hawaiian drive in or safeway. Often it was HERE. 
The Super Burrito with carne asada (back when i ate the flesh of animals). Man was that shit awesome. I've tried the taqueria across the street and it was a-OK but idk, there was a certain flair El Farolito has.I don't come here anymore because I'm never in the area anymore, and because honestly if I'm going to go out of my way for mexican food the only place I'm going is Pancho Villa. But if you are in the area and craving Mexican, don't go across the street, go to El Farolito!
author: Peeta B.

description:
I never fail to stuff my face with a super burrito once a week. 
I must say this will go on my top 5 list of mexican restaurants I lurk to each week. 

I guess it's worth freezing your big toe off to eat here. Really though...sit there on a cold night, and breath out...you'll see your breath. I sat and immaturely kept blowing air and like a little kid "hey it's like im smoking!"

Regardless of my breathing fun, the burrito I would say is not bad. I wouldnt DIE to go here...but I definitely will be returning. I got the carne asada burrito...and the meat was quite tasty!  Salsa, spicy just the way I like it. 

The bf ordered the quesadilla suiza?or  something...whatever it was it was delish...I think a lil more flavorful than the burrito. Full of meat, cheese and creaminess. 

I enjoyed my meal there, while staring at their menu....I found some grammatical errors pretty hilarious...Beacon?  Either a misspelling of bacon or they're adding petroleum in their dishes. YUM gas burrito's...gas either way I guess...(beans) nvm...hardy har. I thought it was funny... but i'm jk...the menu is least of anyones worries...

I love burritos. Wouldn't mind stoppin in again!
author: Catherine O.

description:
this is probably one of the most unappealing looking spots i've ever eaten... but is also probably one of the best spots!

props to my little sister for dragging us all out here to this spot! woot woot! ordered a super carnitas burrito and was NOT disappointed! tried my sister's super shrimp as well and fell in love with that one. i was too full to try my bf's carne asada quesadilla but that looked foodgasmic as well! 

next time.... i'm going to try their SHRIMP QUESADILLA!! mmmm.... sounds to good right now... ::grumbly grumbly tummy::
author: amelia g.

description:
This is the kind of taqueria where you order your food to go.  

It's the definition of hole-in-the-wall and judging strictly by appearances it's pretty grimey.  

If it didn't have so many rave reviews, I'd definitely be skeptical to eat here.  But thankfully, I'm a yelper so I know to trust the fellow yelp community.

Anyways, I'm not a big fan of sour cream but when I saw they put avocado in the super quesadilla I thought twice -- Avocado instead of Guac is deff my kinda place.  Even if I don't love sour cream.  Thank G I did.  This huge quesadilla was bomb!! Oh and the salsa there is soo good, I'm salivating right now just thinking about how fresh and tasty their salsas are.

Overall, a good taqueria I'd definitely go back but to ease my gag reflex I will continue to order to go!!
author: Kat R.

description:
I was lost as hell looking for food one day, walked past Irving Cafe and Deli and tripped over a SUPER QUESADILLA!! Sort of...

I dont think this place is as awesome as the one on 24th and Mission, hence the 1 star deduction. Same menu, same portions, just made slightly different.

Everytime I come here, its always super quesadilla. Don't bother with the damn rice and beans, just get hella meat.
author: Dennis L.

description:
First review! I'm kind of nervous... 

OK, so this place is the SHIT!  This is my favorite Mexican food joint in the city.  I've been coming here for years now.  I remember coming here in high school all the time.  I bring friends from out of town here.  This place holds great memories.. not to mention that it doesn't burn a hole in your wallet.  A perfect place for a broke college student.  
 
I always order their super quesadilla suiza with carne asada and it is the bomb.  They give you two big pieces, so when I come in for lunch, I only eat one piece and leave with dinner already made.  It is so yummy.  Their burritos are good too!  Delicioso. 

The neighborhood isn't that bad either.  I guess the only ones scared are the ones who don't live around there.  

Come and eat here.  Leave with a happy tummy.
author: C E.

description:
THE spot for after club grub. Not because the food is anything special (Many people disagree on that point), but because it's open late. Seating can be tricky so someone from your group needs to stake their claim while the rest of you are in line. Regardless of the food, part of the fun in being here is the variety of people. You'll see neighborhood locals, clubbers, hipsters, crossdressers, and more crackheads than you can shake a pipe at. And because the seating is so close you may make a new friend or two. I met Harry Potter here. It was most magical.

Hogwarts here I come!
author: Sol V.

description:
OK, SO THIS IS WHAT I DO WHEN I COME HERE LATE NIGHT AFTER THE CLUB. 

I ORDER A SUPER QUESADILLA SUIZA W/ CARNE ASADA. 
PAY. 
BEFORE I SIT DOWN I GO TO THE SELF-SERVE SALSA BAR AND FILL 3 CONTAINERS FULL OF THE GREEN HOT SAUCE (b/c this is the hottest one), 3 CONTAINERS FULL OF JALAPENOS, AND 1CONTANER OF LIME. 
I SIT IN ANTICIPATION FOR THIS WONDERFUL FOOD THAT WILL SOON BE SET FORTH IN FRONT OF ME. 
WHEN I GET IT: I SQUEEZE HELLA LIME ON IT, POUR THE GREEN HOT SAUCE ON IT, PUT A JALAPENO ON THAT BAD BOY AND EAT IT JUST LIKE THAT... FOR EACH AND EVERY BITE.
GOOD THING IS, IF YOU RUN OUT OF SALSA, YOU CAN JUST GET THE HELL UP AND GET AS MUCH AS YOU WANT. 
USUALLY I CAN ONLY FINISH 1/2 (these things are huge), SO I BOX UP THE OTHER 1/2 AND RE-UP ON ALL MY FAVORITE CONDIMENTS AND EAT IT FOR BREAKFAST THE NEXT MORNING. 

eating this sort of meal motivates me to go to the gym the next day b/c eating it makes me feel like a fat tub of lard b/c it's so damn good it has to be bad for you.
author: T V.

description:
Coming here after reading the rave reviews, I wanted more.  I wanted the Perfect Burrito.   I really was expecting the world but I think I set myself up for disappointment.  The flavor of the meat was still very good and it was certainly a value with the burrito being pretty big and the prices being A-OK but there were a few things I was quite disappointed.  

First off, their green salsa which you get from the side was very watery.  I really dislike watery salsa because when I end up putting it in on my burrito with each bite, it doesn't stay on top of the burrito and ends up dripping to the bottom so everytime you try to get some sauce on the top, you can never keep it there.  It ends up making the burrito soft and harder to eat as you go along.  I like the salsa think and chunky so it ends up staying on top and you can add more salsa every bite you take.  Yum!  

And another thing I noticed or maybe didn't notice was the sour cream and some of the other fillings in the burrito.  I noticed mainly the meat, the rice and some beans but alot of the other things like sour cream, guacamole and salsa didn't seem like they were present.  I did for sure order the Super so I am assuming it is supposed to be in there but I didn't read the fine print of what the Super includes so.....

The other thing I ordered was the Quesadilla Suiza with Carne Asada.  They make a quesadilla different here as they fold it so you can actually eat it like a burrito.  Very different from anything I've had in the past.  It was really cheesy and by the time I ate half a Super Burrito, I could barely touch the quesadilla.    

Still a pretty great deal and I would definitely give them another try but hopefully, it won't be like Gordo, which I have tried over and over again and it has not ONE time been KICK ASS as some customers have stated...
author: Mark W.

description: I went here a couple days ago during early morning hours and ordred a Chicken Quesadilla Suiza. It was oh so good yet oh so bad and greasy. So if you find yourself in the area, hungry during late night or early morning, and feel like mexican food, this is a pretty good choice to go to.
author: Gerard Y.

description: Its good, nothing I have tried so far is to die for, but legit mex food.  Opened late too, so defiantely a must after the bars :) Also, the ceviche is yummy
author: Justine S.

description:
this place is awesome !! my family goes here a lot ! love the food. the people are great. my friends love it too. I brought my family here from out of state, & they said that they have not experienced a more authentic mexican restaurant. they loved the food. =] Great Service & the food you order is prepared very Quick !
my mom loves the super quesodilla suiza, they hav great tacos, & burritos.
author: Therese S.

description: I have been coming here for about 5 years now but recently I have been so disappointed. The last 3 times I have been my order has been wrong. The first time it was wrong I called and somebody who works there told me they would give me a free meal the next time I went. So the next time I went I informed the cashier of the conversation I have with so and so and he told me because that particular person was not there he could not help me. I still bought food, only to come home and see my order was wrong again. Last night I went to get one again to order my favorite thing. As I go to eat it I see it's wrong again. The only thing that makes my order different is that I ask them to add rice; I don't think that it's that hard to get right. I was so irritated last night, I called the restaurant and nobody answered. I decided to drive all the way back, which is like 15 min away from my house. When I get there the cashier has the audacity to tell me it's my fault, im wrong, and that he never makes mistakes. Why would I take the time to drive all the way back if there was no issue? Hello!! This made me more upset, when I told him I don't want to argue I just want them to remake my order he says they can't, he can add rice to my order but thanks it. Im surprised an establishment that makes so much money cannot afford to make one quesadilla. Then he offers to give me my money back, but won't remake the food. (Didn't make sense to me at all!)  Whatever happened to "the customer is always right?"  I am still mortified that this is the experience, although I love their food I will never go back to El Farolito. I do not support establishments that treat their customers this way.
author: T V.

description:
I have finally wandered away from my usual 'super nachos'. I didn't think this feat was possible, but weirder things have happened. Granted, my first choice upon entering had BEEN the 'super nachos' - only to switch that over to 'regular nachos' and then finally, upon my boyfriend's prodding because he went and said, "Do you want the regular?" Because apparently it's all I ever order at any Mexican restaurant or taqueria. 

After reluctantly eyeballing the menu for a good two minutes, I hesitated - but placed my order for the Quesadilla Suiza with steak. I expected maybe a floppy little thin piece - kind of like the kind you see from Taco Bell. I wasn't holding my breath too much, but when we got home and we sat down to eat in front of the TV. I unwrapped a lovely little surprise. 

Two thick, huge pieces. Cooked just right with a savory, delicious flavor that melted in my mouth with each chew. Sure, it was a little greasy but that sort of thing really doesn't go through your mind nor bother you when you're enjoying the hell out of your meal. Each bite is like the foreplay, each chew is the deed, and the swallow -- well, you know.

I think I've found my new regular.
author: Thea G.

description:
Drunk and hungry as hell at 3:00 A.M. in the Mission?
Sheeeeiiit.
The one and only Farolito.
Don't go here with sober taste buds though.
author: Theo R.

description:
I love burritos, they are one of, if not my favorite food and this El Farolito is my favorite place to go in San Francisco (definitely better than the other two El Farolitos).

The burritos here are amazing and CHEAP, what are they  like $7? For $7 you get a giant burrito,  tightly wrapped so it doesn't fall apart and packed full of very tasty ingredients. They are very moist, far from dry like a lot of other taquerias and  meats are very flavorful and tender,  Ive tried five of their different types of meat and my favorites are the carne asada and the al pastor.

Another thing that keeps me coming back to this place is their horchata...also referred to by me as nectar of the Gods. Their horchata is definitely the BEST horchata that I have ever had. There are times that I will swing by El Farolito just for a cup of their horchata.

The parking in the neighborhood usually isnt too bad, I can always find parking within a block of El Farolito.

Service is very fast, unlike the El Farolito on 24th and Mission which can get VERY busy and quite often has a line out the door, this El Farolito is is usually pretty empty so you'll never have a hard time finding a place to sit and the line is never more than a couple minutes long.

This El Farolito is definitely the best out of the three in San Francisco and in my opinion the best taqueria in the city. Its so good that I think its the culprit behind the 30 pounds Ive gained, which means that I must sadly slow my frequenting of this El Farolito...also known as heaven.
author: Ian P.

description:
Ate here last night after being drunk as funk after Temple SF.  I have no idea why my subconscious mind dragged my drunk cousin to drive me over here.  I have no idea what my drunk ass ordered.  I have no idea how I paid or what I ate and if I ordered in English or en drunken Espanol.  But it must have been good if my stomach doesn't feel like shit in the morning right now like it always used to after eating La Vics after a drunk night in Downtown San Jose.

Oh and my cousin from Boston, told me the (I'm guessing carne asada) burrito that I apparently ordered and passed out after eating half of it, was the BEST SMELLING burrito, she ever smelled before.
author: Chris T.

description:
It's less than a 5 min walk to my school (which is awesome when we get off campus lunch). 

I love to get their burrito carne asada with avocado and I love their nachos and super nachos! I really love how they give you a free bag of chips, because the 24th St & Mission Farolito makes you pay like 50 cents.

All at an affordable price and quick service! A lot of space to sit down with all your friends.
author: Sophia G.

description: I came here a few nights ago and eh, their burritos are alright. Although my boyfriend is a big fan of their burritos, not so much for me. The staff is nice though. I'll always be a La Corneta Glen Park girl, sorry. This may be a bias review but at the same time, it is a preference and their burritos are just not up to par for me.
author: Jessica R.

description:
I recalled my first or second experience here was with the quesadia. It was super good, so I had to make it a SUPER tonight. I aimed for the carne asada AGAIN (not remembering my last review about preferring the carnitas better), and it was good, but not THE BEST. However, I do love how everything thats in it. The melted cheese is MMm mMmm good. I also ordered the carne asada super taco, and it was a bit small for $3 versus the super quesedia/super burrito for 6.50. However, I saw many, many slices of fresh avocado on here and it was smothered in sour cream (more so than the quesedia for its portion). Both were good, but I think the melted cheese on the quesedia wins buy an inch.

The workers were neither friendly or rude today. It could be better. I walked in at around 10:30pm with about 4 people ahead of me. Less than 5 minutes later, there were like more than 10 people behind me? Crazy.

P.S. After eating the taco and about half the quesedia, my stomache is still bulging like an hour and a half later. Alright. I admit. Before going to El Farolito, this fatty had dinner already. I just had a SLIGHT craving for avocado, sour cream, and still went for it anyway. I think after this, I'll be good for a while. That was just way too much to digest.
author: Elaine H.

description: Grew up on these burritos, still a fan. Now that I don't live in the city I try to find time to come out that way just to have that taste in my mouth!
author: Donnie B.

description:
The food is good, but not great. 

Try the Torta, which is a Mexican sandwich.

The customer services is pretty bad. The staff acts like they're doing you a favor by making your food, and in San Francisco there are too many other good restaurants that offer similar food without the attitude.

No parking.
author: Steve K.

description: Mmmmmm ... Late night burritos on a Saturday night. Amazing. Though the guys working here aren't very nice .... Place is delish!
author: Jocelyn A.

description: I f***in love this place! I've been going to this place for as long as I can remember! I defintely like this farolito better than even the farolito on 24th which EVERYONE loves! This one is cleaner!
author: Patricia H.

description: have to give credit where credit is due. This place is the best. Not only is the food great, I have never gotten a stomach ache eating here.  Can't say this for many places lol.
author: Bjj P.

description:
I usually go to their neighbor across the street, Guadalajara, but I decided to give this place a try. Even though I still love Guadalajara across the street, this place is still really good. Once I got in I got the sense that this place knew how to make a good burrito. And boy was I right.

After my first bite in my super burrito with lengua I knew it was good. Bite after bite, next thing I knew I was food. This place know how to make a burrito and it has a lot of seatings to serve burrito lovers like me out there.

Give the place a try. Price isn't too bad either.
author: Sonlay V.

description: Does not even compare to the 24th and Mission El Farolito and the menu is even different. There is more room to sit, however. If you are in the Excelsior choose Guadalajara across the street instead.
author: Lauren B.

description:
El Farolito will always be the taqueria that hits the spot. I order anything from their ceviche, quesadillas, burritos, enchiladas, etc.

Most recently I tried the super shrimp quesadilla and it was so delicious! The shrimp were huge and cooked to perfection. And I love the fact that they put a good helping of avocados and sour cream.

No matter what I order here I always find myself a very satisfied customer. I've been coming here since I was a kid and haven't found a better taqueria than El Farolito.
author: Anne Y.

description:
My friend from SoCal came to visit me over new years. I wanted to make sure he enjoyed his trip, so i asked him what is his favorite type of food. Mexican food.

My SF buddy reccomened this place. My SoCal friend was multi-taskin between eating and going CRAZY about how good it was. Did more than satisfy his cravings for mexican food. Awesome stuff, he COMPLETELY devoured that thing within minutes.
author: Jenny L.

description: My boyfriend's roommate was shocked we didn't know about this place. Being a new resident of the 415/650 area, I was delighted to find a delicious late night Mexican place that wasn't too sketchy. Friggin' scrumptious! Very generous portions and hefty chunks of avocados. Mmmm Super Quesadilla Suiza, 'nuff said.
author: Chelsea P.

description: Funny guys, tasty food, the ability to have no cilantro or onions on your salsa! The prices have gone up in the last 5 years but, what hasnt!
author: P C.

description:
I just moved to SF from Berkeley a few months ago and this spot has become, hands-down, my favorite burrito place in the Bay Area. El Faro's has basically ruined it for me in regards to my former favorite burrito place in Berkeley.

Recommended: Super burrito and super quesadilla.

Things I considered just "okay": Super nachos, horchata (too grainy), and the aguas frescas (too sweet)
author: Amy C.

description: LOVEEEEEEEEEEEEEE this place!!!!!!!! They are super consistent and I love the fact that they are open late. This is now my new fav place, over Cancun!
author: Sharon G.

description:
Here's another great place to eat that is several blocks from me. I've been coming here for 20+ years and it's still one of the best places to buy a really huge burrito for a reasonable price! Their suizas are pretty damn good too!

Edit: They supposedly close at 2am but sometimes they start closing shop a little earlier than that. So don't be suprised if you get there at like 1:15 or 1:30 and it's closed.
author: Conrad C.

description:
over-rated and burritos are tiny. 

place was just okay. i like the burrito place on mission-geneva better. It is called Taqueria La Iguana Azul. the grilled chicked is way better than EL Farolito. 

i think this place is okay because Iguana Azul set the bar so high. 

if you're coming from the land of no burritos you'll probably be somewhat impressed...of the mission style assembly line
author: Greg P.

description:
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
HANDS DOWN--THE BEST TAQUERIA IN CALIFORNIA!

Ive considered the competition, no joke--I'm from SF, living in Dwntn LA, and I dream of El Farolito day and night(shot out to kid cudi). Case in study--the super quesadilla suiza. This bad boy kills it! Forget any taco, burrito, or mulita you've ever had--the super quesadilla suiza(S.Q.S.) is like a Rolls Royce--fill it with what you want; nothing 'rolls' like a Royce and  the same can be said of this art piece! Believe me, the S.Q.S. won't leave disappointed.
author: Xtian D.

description:
Their burritos and quesadillas are gi-normous. Although i'm not a very flour tortilla kinda person. I usually go for the tacos or the echilladas. yummy. Their carne asada is very good and their grilled chicken is kinda sweet but also very good. You can also get your bootleg DvD's from here. There's a lady that kinda opens her bag and a million dvd's come out. 
Good to know that it's open late night, i'll have to stop by there again sometime.
author: Bee C.

description: I had the chicken super burrito which was alright but it wasn't like " wow , this is one of the best burritos I ever had . " This place isn't very clean so I would prefer not to dine in . The bathroom is super dirty and the door can't lock .
author: Eileen L.

description: I went there for a carnitas quesadilla and there was a piece of grisel the size a quarter but round.  That is the grossest quesdilla that I have ever had.  When I called the store to complain to the manager they told me that they had no manager and hung up on me.  Never going back.
author: Lisa P.

description:
This place is awesome!  The food is always delicious, made fresh.  The people are friendly, too!

Try the Enchiladas--they're delicious! Love the sauce they put on them and the grilled chicken anything is always good!  I also love their tacos and their "alambres"--a bit spicy, good!  Mmmm.....
author: OLGA M.

description: Great prices.  Burrito doesn't get wet because they grill the tortilla and melt the cheese.  Love this!  Free chips are fresh, tasty and not greasy.  Three choices of beans.  Grilled chicken that actually tastes grilled.  Def going back.
author: Lee U.

description: Honestly these were the best nachos I've ever had. Covered in cheese, meat, sour cream, guac, salsa. So tasty! I had the carnitas and they were still moist and very tasty. I think it was a fantastic deal ($6.50 for super nachos) for such a large portion. I looked over to the table next to me and the quesadillas looked fabulous too! I'll definitely be returning to this place.
author: Bert W.

description: Ordered a super carne asada burrito, it was good but not great.  The meat was a bit salty and I had a big chunk of unedible meat tendon or something.  The burrito was a little plain till I tried it with some of the red sauce.  The red sauce made the burrito taste much better.  The burrito was also huge!  You can sit down and watch soccer at the bar and order food.
author: Rajiv P.

description: Awesome super quesadillas with carne asada, highly recommend!
author: Stan L.

description: ME + elfarlito QUESDILLAS/BURRITOS = 4EVVERRRRR!
author: Annie L.

description:
Whenever I'm in the mood for a good burrito but am to lazy to go further into the mission i hit up this place or when I'm heading home late night from a club/bar i also hit this place up.

I can always count on my food to taste as good as it did on my previous visits here. My faves are the super burritos and the super nachos. The meat is always juicy and flavorful. The guy preparing the food is always generous with all the ingredients.

Only reason why i took one star off is because the place seems like it needs some better cleaning and some times i do wake up with a tummy ache but i think that from mixing large amounts of alcohol and late night Mexican food.
author: Alfredo N.

description: El Farolito is our place of choice for late night . The food comes fast and although it's a little expensive it fills you up right away. No gimmicks and no Mariachi bands; this is where the locals come to eat.  If you come here don't forget the strawberry drink (We LOVE it.) Quesadillas, Burritos and tacos are all good so get what you want just don't forget the strawberry.
author: Samuel P.

description:
I got the super burrito with boiled chicken and it was the perfect post-Bay to Breakers meal.  I recommend the grilled chicken over the boiled chicken though because the boiled chicken made for a really drippy burrito (knife and fork needed).
And, be warned, their salsas are hot!  So, if you're a "Pace Picante Mild" kind of person, you probably won't be able to handle them.

Although the burrito was tasty, I had to only give it 3 stars as it did something wicked to my stomach later that day.
author: Joanne S.

description: The best burritos around, I think. Unless u guys tell me otherwise. When I come here, I always get the super burrito and sometimes get tacos when I dnt feel as hungry. No matter what you order, you won't regret it. The prices r reasonable too so I recommend this to everyone who like to try good food.
author: Allan W.

description: I would come here every week at least 3 times with my roomies because the Super Carne Asada, and Super Carnitas Burritos are too good to let go!
author: Jeffrey G.

description:
Pro:  Big fat burrito, chips 'n salsa, SUPER cheap, taste like Mexican food heaven

Con:  So damn far from Sunset (and anywhere else)

I live less than a minute away from El Burrito Express and choose to drive all the way to El Farolito - if that isn't loyalty, I just must be cheap...
author: Violet C.

description: The tacos are ok, but for San Francisco, this is the BEST Mexican restaurant I've been to. Why just "ok"? Because I'm used to $1 tacos full of meat and condiments on the side!! The steak quesadillas are HUGE and quite delicious. Free chips anyone!? Chipotle's $2 chips can't top this.
author: Marissa P.

description: Well its good and that the service was good. I do prefer this place over other taquerias in the Excelcior though.
author: R C.

description: Near the Ingleside, hungry but have no flow? This is a cheap place to get a big meal. Prices are just right & you'll be full after eating. Variety of Mex meals, lots o space, specialty Mex sodas and beers. Parking can be rough. Descent place to go after a night of heavy drinking.
author: Cee B.

description: I've only been to El Farolito once but that was enough. It was at noon and i am so hungry, Then my sis and friend decided to go there. My friend ordered a super burrito, pretty big, i ordered a regular burrito, still big, and my sis ordered super nachos, OMG. They were only $21 in total. I was very impressed. But the best thing was the super nacho, it's only $6.50!!!! and it was big and yummy. Me and my sis couldn't finish the regular burrito and super nachos.  The only down side is the waiter. One  of the waiter was kind of mean when we were asking about sour cream. But other then that, everything else was some awesome. I would recommend this place for nachos and burrito lovers.  : )
author: Lily L.

description: After one humungous super quesadilla suiza with lengua, I was sold. This place is every Mexican food lover's wet dream. Large portions, fresh ingredients,  cheap prices, and open late. Oh yes, and ceviche. Mmmmmm........
author: Irene C.

description:
I love the super quesadilla suiza, they also have shrimp burritos - its not on the menu - its on a  piece of paper taped up somewhere. The carne asada hasn't disappointed me. The breakfast is yummy.

I love this place because the orange and brown booths from the 70's, not-bright lighting, the loud jukebox and grimy-ness add to the charm. Its big enough to bring 5 of your friends and not have seating issues. There are also gum/sticker machines. 

It helps me forget that my beautiful Mission has been gentrified, and that maybe the night I'm there, a couple of mariachis will come in to eat, not to play music.
author: Cheryl D.

description:
hands down best thing here------------drumroll please--------------

SHRIMP QUISADILLA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHh

taste like lobster
author: kim w.

description:
Add a few pueblos this area of Mission St and it would be like you're in Mexico because there's 20 Mex restaurants per block. El Faro here definitely delivers with great food starting with the salsa bar, the tomatillo salsa is one of the best around. 

The al pastor burrito was tasty and juicy. They forgot to put guacamole in my burrito which i didnt realize until 3/4 through eating but I got some on the side and it was worth it. The guy tries to tell me its hidden between the tomatoes, that dude must be colorblind since there was no a speck of green. Overall, good food and bad liars.
author: Ed L.

description:
Given my prediliction for cheap eats, I would recommend this and it's sister on Mission and 24th.  This one is a little less crowded.  So far they have managed not to succumb to burrito inflation (in price, not size.)  A little gritty - this one has seats from a theme park.  If they had a clown it would totally fit the decor, but then the burritos would cost more.  The tortas here are the most delicious I've ever had.

-Mark
author: Mark W.

description:
It's a good burrito. I go here from time to time after school or on my lunch hour and it's a really good find. You're in and you're out with a great lunch with nothing else to it.

I'd recommend this place wholeheartedly.
author: Rick C.

description: So there I was 2:30 AM amongst all the other drunk chics with smudged eyeliner, faded lipstick, frizzy hair, smelling like alcohol, drunk off my ass and still trying to act all hot but very likely not looking like it. None of that mattered because I was in a state of eternal bliss! Nothing around me mattered anymore after biting into one of the most delicious super burrito and super nachos ever!!! Gobs of sour cream, loads of perfectly seared carne asada and plenty of melted cheese and flavor flavor flavor. I don't remember what clubs I went to or how I got home but I do remember myself cramming food in my mouth and saying repeatedly how happy I was at that moment....
author: Sucia H.

description:
I love the super suizas at this taqueria and the super burritos are great as well. The guys behind the counter are super fast and you'll receive your food as fast as you order it. 

Stop by whenever you are in the Mission!
author: La C.

description: The absolute BEST place for quick (and I mean quick) and cheap Mexican food. Hefty portions with a great taste. You gotta love their salsas too. I believe this is the only one (there are a few El Farolito locations) that takes card, as the others are cash only with an ATM machine inside. There's plenty of street parking around and they're open until 2 or 3AM, I forget. You haven't lived until you've had their super quesadillas or super burritos!!!!!!!!
author: Jonny A.

description: Their juevos rancheros plates are hufuckingmongous and arrive piping hot.
author: Alex H.

description:
I don't understand why this location has a lower rating than the one on 24th & Mission...

Same phenomenal food as any other El Farolito without the attitude of the 24th & Mission location. I've been to my share of taquerias and this is by far the best. Best service, best quality of food, BEST horchata, fastest, open late, dirt cheap. 

After a night out on the town my woman and I will stop in here to share a plate of nachos or a quesadilla and a horchata. complete meal for both of us for under $8. beat that.
author: Panos M.

description: Great Cheap Eats. Open late night for the after club crowd. This place tends to be hopping around rush hour, but nothing like its sister location on 24th and Mission.  The burritos are good and big. Have your choice of Carne Asada, Carnitas, Al Pasor, Chile Verde, and Pollo Asado Pinto or black beans.  The tortas ain't bad and the Quesadillas Suizas are to die for.  A great alternative to locals who don't want to stand in lines that being next to a bart station bring. A lot less homeless folk and overall cleanliness is great.  They didn't seem to mind me and my room mate picking up a 40 and discreetly drinking it with our meals in the back(we asked for paper cups) even though they do sell beer. Oh and do try the salsa verde!
author: Carlos S.

description:
Not much to say except the following is THE BEST IN TOWN:

Carne asada super burrito
Carne asada super quesadilla
Carne asada super nachos

If you don't want to trek down to the heart of the Mission, then this spot in the outter Mission is perfect. Open late, great prices, and fast service. Grab a burrito then go down a block to the End Up bar (check my review).
author: Axel G.

description:
Now I love me some Don Chuys but this is the spot in the E to get burritos.
Actually the call here is the super suiza quesadillas and the shrimp coctail.
Late night.
Beer
author: Scotty B.

description:
Ive been eating at this place since before the place burned down once.

I used to eat at this place after school with buddies and enjoyed their super burrito with carne asada and then i learned about the super quesdilla suiza and became my favorite.  The strawberry fresca can be addicting but packed with ton of sugar. Their meat used to be chucky pieces, now its finely diced and i wish it was like how it was years ago.

I notice when they make their nachos the chips sometimes arent crunchy because they would prepackage the container with the chips on the side already and when an order is place they would add the meat and all.  The next day they would prepackage more and the ones that are left all the way at the bottom of the list ends up stale and not crunchy at all.  Disappointing.

This joint opens late til 2am or so.  Good place to grab a bite if out late and feeling hungry to have one of guilty night food session.
author: Mabel C.

description:
Only tried the Super Quesadillas! Can't go wrong w/ the Carne Asada or Al Pastor (this sometimes can be pretty oily)! whether you dine-in or take-out, the chips/Salsa are complimentary w/ your meal.

Food is cheap
Portions are big 
Plenty of Seating
FAST service!!!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Man... sometimes its good and sometimes its great! Their food is usually on point, as I can only remember one time out of all the years that I've been here that their meat was dry. Whether its a carne asada super burrito (w/ extra jalapenos), a shrimp super quesodilla suiza, or some al pastor tacos, this place is reliable for some tasty mexican food (especially after a RIDICULOUS hangover). 

Their salsas is what I crave for the most though, as I cop at least 6 greens and 6 freshly diced every time I come through. And their strawberry fresca tastes like strawberry juice, where as other places make it taste like strawberry candy. If you're drunk and coming out of a club, this is a must on the way home
author: Ray P.

description: I never eat mexican food until one day my friend took me there. i ordered the super shrimp quesadilla added with steak and it was bomb! i usually come here after the clubbing or at the bar. i believe theyre opened till 3 or 4am on weekends. i think its a bit pricey, but it was worth it. it comes with chips too...i recommend coming here to get your grub on
author: Bombdiggity b.

description: open late till 2am ,,beef tacos with everything my favorite so good,fast service too so yeah i have been coming here 6 years cant get enough.
author: Nina B.

description:
super nachos: carne asada - $6.95

can feed a small village! amazing how crispy the chips were after being smothered with copious amounts of melty cheese, chopped carne asada, guac, sourcream, and salsa and i think there were beans somewhere in there too. no doubt hit the spot, had to waddle myself outta there but worth it

and free chips and salsa ! if you can spare the tummy space
author: isabelle g.

description: Conveniently a few blocks away from my house. Not as crowded as the 24th street location, which is where I used to go when I was still living in that area. But the best part is that they accept debit cards. You don't know how many times I've had to skip out on a super burrito because I didn't have enough cash on me.
author: EJ S.

description: This place makes the best carne asada. my outh is watering just thinking about it. all their food is cooked to perfection and i havnt had one bad order from here. everything is good but i love their burritos, quesidillas, and nachos...I'm getting hungry right now....also if you want a break from meat, their shrimp and quesdilla burritos are heaven...i cant rave enough about this place. this is the burrito place for me! :D. Their decor could be updated, but i rather like the look...it looks like it belongs in the Mission...It's Home :D
author: Justin C.

description: i really wish i had seen GMO G.'s review before heading to this place. we were in desperate need for a late night dinner when we arrived in the city and stopped by here. biggest mistake. coming from LA, we obviously expected a rather decent mex joint given the number of reviews. this place is disgusting (cleanliness perspective). their food is par- at best. wish i hadn't wasted my time and money on this place.
author: J W.

description: Super burrito. Good. Really cheap considering its a good amount of food and very good quality. And it comes with chips + salsa to munch on while you wait for the super burrito.
author: Matthew T.

description: Who Yelps a burrito place at 7:42AM? I do, i do , i do, ooo! I kinda sorta use to live up the street from here and because i've moved to the other side of town its an inconvenience for me to come .. but who gives a sh**!I love this place! The burritos are delicious! The pollo and carne is always well seasoned and cooked to juicy perfection! The super shrimp burrito is bomb. If you dont know you better ask.. YELP! Sorry i think its the coffee i drank this morning.. Anyway. The quesadillas are more than enough! Two large extra cheeseeeeyy gooey flour tortillas with sour cream & avocado. Although, i must say their salsa is either a hit or miss... The service is OK. Location is not feasible but eh.. i enjoy watching telemundo while inhaling my nom nom nom burrito.
author: Karen A.

description:
helllooo burrrito place!

i used to always get quesidillas, not burritos, but i changed for the better! lol
their burritos here are huge and juicy and filling as heck! we always get the super burrito with no beans and steak. i could prolly eat the whole thing but i try to slow myself down haha and eat only half =P we tried a sandwich version once, it was messy and harder to eat, still good but burritoes are easier. its always a fight between which burrito place to go to! this one or the one across the street! 
parking isn't too bad sometimes, and the foods cheap! they have a tasty strawberry drink too!
author: Christine M.

description: Ordered two Super Tacos for $2.95 each and next to their burritos and quesadillas that they serve up, these are some of the best in SF.  I go here because it's the closest place for me to get some real good Mexican food.  As of mid Dec. it appears they are fixing the sidewalk area of the front of the restaurant so there's a slight detour to get inside, but it's no problem.  This place and Panchovilla's are places to check out if you've never been to either of them - and they both give you free chips, which should always be the norm, not the exception!
author: Kahanalei M.

description: Been coming here since I was a young buck as well, and I still love the place. I usually make my order simple: cheese enchiladas meal or a carne asada burrito surpreme. I've tried the tortas, quesadillas and tacos, they're yummy too. I love how they're open late, but beware, this is one of the places everybody and their mamas goes to after a club, so try not to go late night on the weekend. Friends have also had the shrimp+steak burrito which they can't get enough of.
author: Dijonne M.

description:
LOVE IT.  Staff is always super friendly, burrito is always huge and tasty. They normally have univision or some such playing on the tv, which only adds to the ambiance.  Also, LIMITLESS SALSA BAR!  Most places charge, or you have to schmooze for extra salsa, but not El Farolito.  They put the goods right out in the open for all to take, and no one will raise an eyebrow as you furtively shovel 9 cups of salsa verde into your bag (because yes, it's that good).

YUM CITY.
author: Amber M.

description:
First off, El Farolito is Hands Down the Best Burritos in the City!  
Better than La Taq, or La Corneta, simply because of the size, price and way they make the burrito.  They know what they're doing.

But, if you're deciding which El Farolito to go to... then, The Onondaga joint is Better than the 23rd spot Hands Down!

HELLLLLLA CLEANER!

The Burritos are a little better too, just because of the locale and space, compared to the 23rd spot which is too packed.

PLUS... they give free chips all the time and they accept Credit Card!

Onondaga/Mission is better than 23rd/Mission


TIP:  GET THE SUPER BURRITO.
either Carnitas (Pork)  or the Grilled Chicken.  
Skip the Boiled Chicked, cuz the Grilled Chicken is Bomb!
author: Samurai J.

description:
OMG, the grilled chicken quesadilla or the shrimp quesadilla (or burrito, depending on the mood)...mmmm, add avocado & onion...with a strawberry fresca to wash it all down...so crackin...& it's open til 3 am?!?!?!  SHUT YOUR MOUTH...

So much more bang for your buck compared to the highly overrated Pancho Villa (especially their steak & shrimp super burrito!!!), & this location is MUCH better than its sketchy counterpart on 24th.  I'm a lil irked that SF's pricing is so much different than their Oakland counterpart's though...
author: Amoura B.

description:
This is the place I always go to when I have a late night craving for Mexican food. I'm not sure when they close, but I've been here at 2 a.m. and this place is still serving customers. 

There's a ton of other taquerias in this area, I've tried a few and this one is the best, although it 's not my all time favorite (that would be La Victoria in San Jose). I like how this place gives you free chips and salsa, you never know which places will do that.

When I'm really hungry I get the super wet burrito and carnitas is always the meat of my choice when it comes to mexican. It's so good with the enchilada sauce all over it with tomatoes, sour cream, and guacamole mmm.... The quesadillas are pretty good too (although I prefer the ones at La Victoria, best quesadillas ever!), they're big and so cheesy and they don't skimp on the meat.

This (and La Victoria) is the place I benchmark other taquerias against. I mean it's so good here I'm willing to drive 20 minutes from home to get a burrito and suffer another 20 minutes of mouth watering anticipation on the way back!
author: Felix T.

description: I always have those random cravings for a burrito and sometimes that's at like 2 in the morning and what do you know this place is still open! I love me a nice fat super shrimp burrito and they stuff your burrito here! They never fail to impress one of the better burrito places I've been too in the city.
author: Aaron L.

description: Best place for auth Mexican food!!!
author: Denise N.

description:
too good for words to describe how delectable the food was, but i'll try.

i came here with two friends, one who was familiar with the place and the other was like me, new but ready for our taste buds to savour what was to come.

my friend and i shared a huuuuge wet burrito with chorizo (mexican sausage) and my other friend got his usual carne asada burrito. 

UM, CAN YOU SAY HEAVEN?
-the wet burrito just melted in my mouth and i devoured that thing (my half, at least). my friend agreed that it was pretty awesome.
-nachos come with unlimited salsa. a few salsas to choose from too!
-decent price for the gigantic size of a wet burrito.
-friendly cooks and workers. they really work for the customer's satisfaction!

YEAH--it was heaven.
author: Victoria N.

description: Kinda run down and a bit dirty. Staff is nice. Had a grilled chicken super burrito. Pretty good. The house salsa is a bit too salty for my taste.
author: Markl F.

description: I haven't been to this spot in a while.  Used to go at least once a month when my buddies lived down the street.  Seems like at least once a month we would stop by and grab some late night eats after a night out on the town.  Love the burritos here.  The 24th and Mission st location is also a 5 star joint!
author: Brian A.

description: Drunken hot mess and hungry as hell for some Mexican food. El Farolito is the place to go. Good food and open late.........
author: Nette A.

description: My dear ol' dad has been bringing home burritos from this place every so often for the past few months, and I never knew where they came from until now. Turns out that I'd been here with some friends a while back. I remember having their carne asada quesadilla, and it was HUGE! I was more than happy to take home the leftovers and have them for lunch the next day. The burritos are excellent. My dad orders them sans the beans, ya know, just to keep it classy and not gassy. Kidding! With or without them, they're awesome. No need to add anything to this stuff while eating them because they're not dry. That alone deserves the extra star. I only ate half of the one I got today, so I'm thinking about attacking the other half right about.....now! El Farlito's Phe*nomnomnom*enal! =)
author: Rhia R.

description:
This place is plain NASTY! A late friend of mine first introduced me to El Farolito a decade ago. I gave it a try, but after the second visit, my only incentive for returning was to hang with her.  I'd just sit aside her and try not to breathe anything in.

The facilities inside are poorly lit and you've got a dive bar right next door. I cant count how many times they've botched my order, but I do remember that one time where they screwed up 4 times in a row! You can smell the canned ingredients in the air and taste it on your tongue. Hell, you can see them hauling it in from their storage room! I'm sure they've got reasonable prices, but can you put a price tag on your digestive system?
author: Honest J.

description: Great place to come at any given time to get mexican food. My personal favorite is the tacos because of the flavor, Get a burrito if you want to get full, and the in between quesadilla. Great location and fast service. What more can you ask for!
author: Willie C.

description: This is where I go for burritos in SF...they dont cost a arm and a leg and they are delicious. Super Burrito de carne asada is bomb! also try they super nachos and tortas. But if you are not that hungry a couple of tacos with suffice. Try this place if you have a chance I'm telling you you will walk out of there with a smile and food coma!
author: Eric S.

description: A very good place to if you're craving mexican food. They serve burritos, tacos, nachos... they all can come with meat,cheese,guacomole, salsa, rice, sour cream, and beans.  They're all AMAZINGLY good. My personal favorite is the super shrimp burrito. Though it ends up to be $10...it comes packed with a dozen shrimp. They're also big ones too. I also like the carne asada which is grilled in the open. The carnitas meat is what i find to be a hit and miss sometimes. Somedays it is just fine, while other days i find it be so salty i think i'm eating something that came out of the ocean. Yes, and i'm not exagerrating how salty it gets. Other than the oddly salty carnitas, this place is delicious for a mexican meal.
author: Jeffrey L.

description: Food is just okay to me here. I would much rather prefer Guadalajara across the street. There food isn't bad but it's also not hella good. To me, it's just your regular taqueria with nothing that really stands out.  I could give it 4 stars, but when you have a much better burrito spot across the street it's kind of hard to give them that credit. If Guadalajara wasn't there, then maybe I'd give it to them since I wouldn't have anything to compare it to but I do.
author: Krystle A.

description: This place is open late and has all sorts of meats to choose from.  I had the al pastor super burrito, I am coming back the next time I get hammered.
author: Matthew P.

description: I would end up at a taqueria on Halloween night.. Seeing as the whole club scene didn't work out. Caterpillar feelers and all, I hopped in the camry and headed for late night burritos. I ordered a veggie burrito with mild sauce, and of course a horchata. The veggie burrito consisted of rice, beans, lettuce, pico de gallo, & sauce. It was a nice sized reasonably priced plate, but the burrito fell short of any enjoyment. Again I am faced with filler food. I'm perfectly fine ordering a burrito without all the fix-in's of a super. I prefer it that way! So I can really get down to the science of it's wonderful taste.. This was not the case. The rice was good, the refried beans - average.  I ordered mild sauce but received mild flavor instead.  It did fill me up for the night, so that's a plus in itself. The horchata was good and I like the late hours. I just wish I would have enjoyed it so I could have put those late hours to use!
author: Honey B.

description: Mmmmm what else can I say about El Farolito burritos... It's that good!!! This is my 2nd visit to a El Farolito restaurant and they never fail to amaze me with their delicous burritos... I will always go back for more & more & more.
author: Linda L.

description:
background: customer since 1998

+  inexpensive, excellent menu, quick preparation, easy going staff, conveniently located near public transportation, YUMMY

-  metered parking, lack of seating due to frequent customers
author: j f.

description: I'm gonna start off with how much I LOVE my neighborhood. This place is located 3 walking distance blocks from my house, automatic 249287593785 points for impatient hungry people like me. One time on my way home, I decided to stop by to grab some lunch and put 10 minutes in the meter since that's usually about how long it'll take.  In and out in 5 MINUTES. That's skill right there. Even with a line of people around lunchtime, those guys will serve it up in no longer than 10 minutes. And the food is always HOT HOT fresh, even when you get home. Mmmm..got me craving for one of their super carnitas burritos now...
author: Jen L.

description: It's open pretty late on weekends, and it's usually packed but their service is fast. Aside from drunk pervs & a dirty bathroom, this place is pretty bomb. The food gets me full, and it's a good place to go if you're craving a burrito after the club, hah.
author: Sara L.

description: For San Francisco I think this is close to the best the bay has to offer. The chips and salsa are always fresh, grilled chicken tacos are a light alternative to supreme nachos, which I highly recommend, and they have big vats of bubbling meat going all day long. Expect to wait in a short line and try the carnitas as well.
author: M K.

description:
El Farolito is awesome!!!! the burritos are huge, the super nachos are good, the staff is nice and the price for the amount of food u get is great. 
although the place itself is alittle ghetto, i think it gives it character.

my lazy ass from daly city who can't parallel park if his life depended on it, still manages to drive over there and risk hitting cars trying to park. i already lost one of the three missing hubcaps from my car  trying to park to get some el farolito.
if you are craving mexican food i highly recommend el farolito
author: Michael D.

description:
El Farolito one of the best Taquieras in the city, I like this Farolito better than the one one Mission and 24th, not as crowded with people and more closer to home.

Like their Tacos al pastor and carnitas, as well as de cabeza, but unfortunately they don't serve Tacos de Seso anymore, which the other Farolito still does, but like I said it's too crowded. Their Pollo Asado Super Burrito is pretty good as well.

Y si hablas Espanol toda las vezes te llaman "Primo" pero como yo creci en el Sur de California, La Raza de alla los llamamos entre uno a otro "Compa" en vez de "Primo"
author: Alberto L.

description: GREAATT PLACE! The price is great, the burritos are fat and tasty.  The only issue is the place is kinda dirty..
author: Lily W.

description: The BEST burritos in the city!!!  I loved this place and its the thing I miss most about not living in SF.  The meat, sour cream, everything!  And at the best price too.  El Farolito is the best Taquria in SF!
author: Brent F.

description:
This is my favorite taqueria, EVER! I go here at least once a week after school to chow down. The staff is so friendly, I always go there and attempt to order in Spanish, and the staff is so friendly even though it's really bad and don't roll their eyes at my awful accent, and actually talk back, and also so that I can understand.
I would definately recomend the quesadilla's. Meat, cheese, sour cream and avacado. Yum! Thats all you need.
author: Samantha O.

description:
another GOOD EAT in the excelsior!  aah i love it.

el faro's always been one of my favorite taqueria's but after recently tasting their SUPER SHRIMP BURRITO, my love for them rose to a whole new level.  It was absolutely the best shrimp burrito i have ever tasted.  and thank you el faro for always being open super late (i dont think ive ever seen it closed).
author: Francia T.

description: We live in SF and have some killer places to go to in the Mission including some pretty great taco trucks.  But if we don't want to deal with some of the  congestion on the Mission during the weekend and just happen to be on our way to visit family in SSF, we always stop off here.  Both the tacos and the burritos are great and you can tell everything is really fresh.  We tried a different place on Baden Ave. a few weeks ago and my hubby and I agree that El Farolito is way better and worth the extra spin around the block to look for parking or at least walk to from where ever you find a spot.
author: Kathleen F.

description: The portion here is huge! :) Loving the Super Quesadilla with Carne Asada. Also, if you go, you have to try the Super Burrito and the Tacos. Very tasteful and it'll definitely keep you full for the rest of the day! Chips are complimentary with order and the salsa are bomb ass!! :D Salsa is self-served so get as much as you want. Pretty decent price.
author: Nancy N.

description: Burritos, yum.  Quesadillas, yum. Chips, yum.  Salsa, yum.  Agua fresca, double yum.  Avocado green salsa, triple yum.  Huge shrimp are a plus for me.  The late hours are a plus, too.  No need to be long winded, El Farolito is a great lil hole in the wall place.
author: Jasmine D.

description: When I ever want a burrito or quesadilla, I think of here. It's a little out of my way but I'll still come here for it. Gigantic burritos and gigantic quesadilla.. Filled with meat all the time and it's cheap. Open late night which is another plus.. I've been here for over 6-7 years and I'll always be a fan of theirs.. I feel like a super carne asada burrito with no beans right now!
author: Juliane N.

description: I'm usually not a fan of Mexican food, but their steak burritos got me going back.  Top it off with tortilla chips n salsa and you're good go.  They open late and their burritos are HUGE.  By far the best burrito I've ever eaten.  If you ever decide to go there, PLEASE get the steak burrito.  You will not regret it.
author: hello k.

description: The Food is damn good - so good and so fattening it gives you baby heart attacks. You literally get a dozen prawns in your burrito - that in itself deserves 5 fatman stars. Plus! It's open late - so on those nights of drunken madness, you can go to el farolito, eat a super shrimp quesadilla suiza, pass out...and wake up w/ super carb face. :)
author: Sheena U.

description:
this place used to be my source for dinner a few years ago when i was renting a room at this apartment that was literally across the street.
the people i was renting from were so filthy i just couldn't dare to use their kitchen to cook, so i sufferent for 6 months...
luckily there was this el farolito as well as the little hawaiian bbq place next to it...
author: charlotte s.

description: They have the best carne asada plate.  It is delicious!  I'd really like to go back and get another one some time. However, I am hesitant to do so as the first and only time I was there I watched the guy behind the counter handle raw meat and then proceed to touch other food without washing his hands...ever.  I really am not a stickler for most things, but I'm pretty sure he had to have training about that sort of thing.  Anyway, I ate the food (I mean I paid for it so I was gonna eat it) and luckily did not get sick.  But I'm not sure I would go back.  Ok...I would probably go back, but with reservations.
author: Chanelle L.

description: Im a fan of this place because its the closest Mexican food spot near my house. The food is great but a bit pricey compared to other Mexican restaurants. The thing to get is the steak burrito with Fresca( Pineapple or Strawberry). And that's basically two meals in one.
author: Raymond S.

description:
after a night of drinking at bottom's up my friends and i head over here to top of the night with carne asada nachos, cheesy quesadilla, huge burritos and wash it all down with fresca. 

i'm giving it only three stars because one night i had the seafood burrito and a few days later i had an allergic reaction and no, i am not allergic to seafood.
author: Lola L.

description: This place is good, but it could be better. I ordered a veggie burrito and it tasted great, but i couldnt even finish it because  it got so soggy that it fell apart halfway through
author: Wo W.

description: Finally tried the Menudo here to cure a hangover a couple of weeks ago and it as good. Mind you, not as good as the Salvadorean stff my sister can make, but it was really good.  They actually give you more meat than Chava's, and Chava's is known for good soups. If you're squeamish about trying new things in your soup, give it a shot - hey, I don't like tongue or brains (which this soup does not have), but some people eat them at taquerias, go figure.
author: J H.

description: I drive half way across town for this place... can't even count the number of places I see in my rear view on my way to Farolito.
author: Mario C.

description:
saw a rat here and also got a bum begging for a dollar.

other than that, it was a GREAT  super burrito
author: Bobby B.

description: Having been pretty disappointed by the location on 24th, I think this one is a bit of an improvement.  Not as grimy in appearance, or sketchy in clientele... pretty much just your typical outer-Mission taqueria.  The super burrito was big but had too much sour cream, the chicken could have been more flavorful and the salsa's were average.  I did kinda dig the old-school yellow & brown plastic and linoleum decor, drenched in harsh fluorescent lighting.  And, of course, having an international soccer game on Fox Sports en Espanol gave them some brownie points.  Good for filling the tummy but when I'm jones'n for damn good Mexican, I'll stick to El Toro.
author: Tara G.

description:
juiciest carne asade burrito of my life.
& that's without cheese, sour cream, or guacamole.
these people are miracle workers.

& hell yes to free chips & salsa.
author: Lizzy L.

description: I haven't tried every burrito place in the Outer Mission, but this is definitely my favorite.  Great food and the place is clean and spacious.
author: Gene G.

description: Get your late night dining on!  For those of us who live up over the hill on the south end of Mission district this is the place to go for late night food.  Mainly for no other reason besides that it's open late.  There was a long line, but it moved very fast.  Last time I wasn't that hungry so I just got some nachos and they were delish.
author: Levi B.

description: When it comes to taquerias, this is the place I'm loyal to. It might be cause I'm from the area, but I think their burritos are dope. Whether its during the day or late at night after going out, its a go to spot. Super Nachos or a Super Burrito and I'm good!
author: Cee D.

description: love this place! definitely my go to place for my quick fix burrito. service is fast and efficient and i cant stop craving their tostada de ceviche and quesadillas!
author: Nikka L.

description: I'm surprised this place is rated as high as it is. I thought it was mediocre at best. Maybe I just caught them on an off night. The enchiladas in particular were gross and overpriced, and smothered in bland tomoato sauce. The pollo asado burrito was not bad but not especially good either. In any case, I would definitely recommend walking across the street to Taqueria Guadalajara instead of eating here.
author: Brian H.

description: BEST BURRITOS&QUESADILLAS of all time to me, i have tried a few other places; but this place is still my all time fave! opens til 3am! only hard to find parking, their customer service had lacked a bit over the years. they use to be EXTREMELY welcoming & helpful, not its almost as if they don't care for your customer service. FOOD IS GREAT, but some of their workers CAN BE WORKED ON.
author: Eva H.

description:
El Farolito (EF) is a staple in the Mission. For me, it is the standard I judge other burritos by. The place has a high quality to price ratio. The meats are always succulent and they have the 2nd best salsa in town. [I think Papalote is the best]. 

It is a place where if you have visitors in town, you can take them for a great, quick meal and give them an idea of what the Mission is like. 

Go Farolito!
author: Rahul T.

description: So this may not the be the cleanest place I've been to... but the 4 stars are strictly for the one menu item: the delectable steak suiza. The place itself is not the most appealing, but this suiza is the diamond in the rough. There are the usual taqueria items available and while they may be satisfying, the suiza can stand all by itself. I don't expect anyone to go out their way, but if you're in the neighborhood - have a suiza, and have a good day. =)
author: Kris S.

description:
pretty big everything, cheap everything. 

burritos are a messy tumultous glob of everything rolled with sour cream, with pretty good meat, decent beans and rice.

the salsa verde is pretty good though.

eating here once makes you feel guilty for a week. seriously.
author: Ben T.

description: The tacos here are good and so are the nachos..the staff here are also really really nice too! I come here usually 2-3 times a month and it just gets better and better! ^_^
author: Heather C.

description: Whenever I crave mexican food, I always come here w/ my bf to eat a super burrito. Omg, they are soo good. Especially with the green salsa, it always fills me up in a good way. Oh, and you should try their camarones a la diabla. They're pretty spicy but damn good!
author: JK R.

description:
Gotta love El Farolito, one of the best super quesadilla's around. Great taste, greasy, and a great portion. Everything you need whether your hungry or just drunk. Could eat that quesadilla any day of the week.

Only reason I give it 4 stars is because their burritos could use some work, but other than that it is great.

I find myself going out of my way to come here.
author: Paolo B.

description:
haha, now that I write this review... I realize I went to the wrong one. I knew as I was driving and saw 16th, 17th, all of a sudden 26th... hrmm!!!! I mean, I remember looking on the map earlier and seeing it close to the Mission/16th st BART. I got directions, but opted not to use them because I forgot to write the address. Instead I used the google text feature and it gave me this location. 

After finally finding the place as I drove down Mission st. forever long. I parked a bit passed it, but noticed a crowd starting to form on the inside. My friend not knowing anything about Yelp kept saying that it better be good since I dragged her out here at 2am. I just kept assuring her that it was good and hoped the reviews didn't steer me wrong. Man, as soon as I walked in the door I knew it had to be good. The place was full, not only was it full, but it was full of Mexican people! that has to be a sign? no!? yes?! that wasn't racist was it? cmon now...  you know what I mean.  My friend made me refrain from eating too much. I was going to have the super burrito and super nachos along with half her quesadilla. 

After contemplating over the menu for some time I ended up just getting the super burrito with carne asada for myself hold the sour cream. For her, and myself too I suppose =) was the quesadilla with just cheese and pollo asado. Oh man, the burrito was good sized and muy muy flavorful. Every bite literally had a balance of the guacamole, meat, rice, beans, and salsa. Usually at most places you are eating one ingredient followed by another, but never all at once! It almost felt as if I was back in L.A.  again, wait no... ok maybe a little bit. The salsa verde went perfectly with the burrito. The sauce was also muy muy flavorful and packed a little spicy kick to it. I think I poured it on everything and every bite!!! well not every bite since I had to taste the burrito without any sauce first. FURTHERMORE, the quesadilla was deliche! it came in two little folded pieces with a generous portion of cheese and chicken that was also perfectly balanced with just enough of each. The sauce was so good I had to pour some on my quesadilla too. My friend just watched me go to town on my burrito and half of her quesadilla. It was funny, she made the comment "Hey, do you realize we're the only Asians in here?" Literally we were the only non HISPANIC ones in the restaurant at the time. I guess later on during our meal some of the Asians got out of the clubs and made their way over. I might have to subtract one star just because gas is super expensive and I don't think I can afford to drive here from the East Bay all that often, which I might have to. Perhaps I will try the other Mission St. location and see if a difference can be distinguished.

Next time I will have to try the tacos, because just about everyone and their mom was eating the tacos.

Service = great and food was brought to our table very very expediently.
author: Steven T.

description: This is my all-time favorite late-night (I'm talking past Midnight) eating spot! Fast and super delicious. Shrimp, Churizo, and Carne Asada Burritos are my top choices. Every now and then, I indulge in their tangy Shrimp Cocktail dish.
author: Leroid D.

description: Their burrito used to be good, the meat can be bland and tasteless. I suppose it depends who makes your food.
author: Clementine D.

description:
before you read this review keep in mind the food here is quite tasty.  the only reason why i gave this particular taqueria only 2 stars is because of this idiot who works or used to work there.  i went in there one day to get a burrito to go.  so the guy behind the counter does his thing and then asks me what kind of meat i want.  so i tell him i wanted regular chicken.  so he gets some chicken, shreds it a bit and puts it in my burrito.  then he reaches in for more chicken and i was thinking, "damn this dude is gonna hook me up", but instead of putting it in my burrito he puts the meat in his friggin' mouth right in front of me!  what a douche!  

i didn't take the burrito and walked out hungry and confused.  tear :( .........
author: Phil Y.

description: Best damn burrito I've EVER had! Their salsa is up to par as well. I just LOVE THEIR AGUA's FRESCA'S, especially the strawberry one if I'm luck to go there at that day they serve it since it's a different flavor everyday. I'm only disappointed at the fact that they don't serve their own, fresh tortilla chips, sides that...it's heaven! HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!
author: Sean E.

description: A nice alternative to the 24th Street location.  The menu is the same, but I really like the Alambres here.  Chunks of steak, with bacon, onions, bell peppers, and chile served with rice, beans, tortillas and salad for less then $7.  This place is closer to my home anyway, so I most likely will keep going here and avoid the madness at 24th.  The salsa is good, but a bit too much liquid for my tastes.
author: Michael M.

description:
super quesadilla suiza is sooo good
cheep
open late
super fast
if somebody knows anything better in the hood- let me know!
they loose 1 star just for being a bit on the dusty delapitated side.
author: Melissa B.

description:
the horchata is the best i've had in SF, *if* you like grainy horchata (i do).

their burritos are fine (my favorite is La Taqueria), yummy but nothin' special.
author: Jolene T.

description: I have been going to El Farolito for 10 yrs and the food has always been great they are open late and they always have music or sports on TV.
author: Dee Z.

description:
"La Mecca of all taquerias" is what many people I know call this place. I've been there 3 or 4 times. and 3 of the 4 times that I've been there, I've left very, very disappointed. 

      The first time I went, I thought it was alright. Not nearly as special as it needs to be to deserve a name like "La Mecca." The second time, I ordered a burrito with carne asada, rice, refried beans, sour cream, and cheese. When I started eating, I noticed that the meat was still pretty pink and it didn't have too much flavor. I felt a little queasy later that night. Strike One, "La Mecca." 
     The next time, I ordered the Super Nachos. I asked them to make sure they didn't add cilantro, onions, or tomatoes to my nachos cuz I really dislike those things. and not to my surprise, when I got them  they had forgotten the sour cream AND added everything that I asked them not to add. Wtf. someone said maybe it was because I ordered in Spanish and offended them, but to be honest I just dont think the place is good. Strike 2. 
     The last time that I went there, I was already skeptical. I tried a chicken burrito this time, and what happened? It was like a mix of the previous two occasions. A little undercooked, and they disregarded some parts of my order. Strike 3. 

people LOVE this place. I don't know why I keep on having bad experiences here. I usually end up going to the hawaiian bbq place down the street while friends eat here and bringing my food back. It's a typical taqueria, not the cleanest, and the service is eh. So, while others may love it, i still do not see why this is "La Mecca of all taquerias."
author: Chris N.

description: Ohmigosh. I'm addicted to their breakfast burritos. Cheaper than their regular burritos, but still as big as their other burritos, they are so worth it. And the prices for everything aren't that big at all because the portions are HUGE. So good, so delicious. Quick, cheap and good. Enuff said.
author: Jenny W.

description: This is the 2nd location of the best two burrito places I know of in San Francisco.  This one is not as busy as the first establishment.  Soemthign different from this place is tha tthey do take card and atm, so no need for the cash.  This place also does seem larger with more seating options available.  Who wants to walk and eat a burrito?  I sure wouldn't.  Parking is not as difficult here either.
author: Christopher L.

description: This is one of the spots to hit up after 2AM when you're hungry after a long night out clubbing/partying in SF.  Grilled chicken quesadillas are amazing and you get free chips and salsa as well.  Be prepared to wait in line with a bunch of other folks just getting out of the clubs as well!
author: Joseph D.

description: You want REAL Mexican food...then this is the place to come. Their super burritos, quesadillas and nachos are as good as they get. Your get a free bag of chips with your orders and you get your own salsa from the salsa bar. Their staff is also very friendly. I am a very picky eater and they are very patient with taking the things i don't want out of my burrito. The prices are pretty cheap for good quality Mexican food. If you want a taste of Mexico this is the place to come, not Rubios, Green Salsa or Chevy's. They are also open till 1am...which is pretty good if your craving Mexican food late at night.
author: Shirley E.

description: omg, always have BOMB food here! my friends and i LOVED coming here! especially since it was right by my apartment. Nachos and horchata are a MUST. i can't wait til i go back and have my fix. oh! i almost forgot, the salsas are awesome too :)
author: Natalie O.

description: Late night hunger cravings beware, El Farolito will rescue you.  I'm not gonna lie and say this is the Best Mexican food I've ever had.  But they have rescued me from my hungry yet too lazy to cook pains, so for that I'm thankful. For some reason, I've seen many return customers, so maybe it is the Best?  Who knows, I've never gotten food poisoning from here, and oftentimes, couldn't finish what I've ordered, so I end up with breakfast too.  Good times Indeed!!
author: brenda b.

description: I know this place is dirrrty but their STEAK  SUIZA's are the BEST.
author: linda h.

description: I feel like crying whenever I come to this place at night because it will hit all the right spots in your body. I get the super shrimp quesadilla and the strawberry fresca drink. It just makes you feel so good and comfortable. oh El Farolito....
author: James K.

description: Wow!  The carne asada quesadillas are amazing!  So is the al pastor.  Great place to go, especially after clubbing in the Mission.  Taqueria Cancun is good, but not as good as this.
author: Natasha L.

description: Have locked down two visits so far in the past week, and I must say its a hot tub in tasty town! Meaning its delicious. At least the quesidilla suiza with carne asada is. There was a bit of gristle in a couple of the carne pieces that I had to spit out, but no one's perfect. And I have yet to experience the wrath of any repercussions for having eaten there. But my stomach is pretty in tune with greasy food so I might just be lucky. Very recommended though.
author: Jeremy B.

description: Not as exactly happening as the one near 24th and Mission but definitely have had some awesome late night snacks here. I definitely recommend their super nachos...nothing like cheese and your choice of meat to have your arteries clog. Oh bliss!
author: janet j.

description: It's down in the Excelsior District, the last remnants of San Francisco that hasn't experienced gentrification.  So hipsters usually tend to stay away from this place.  Overall this is a good burrito place.  Just try it.
author: Michael R.

description: The super quesadillas are awesome.  I don't eat pork but apparently the carnitas are good as well.  I would give it 5 stars but the chips and salsa aren't that great.  But, I'm very happy this place is in my neighborhood.
author: a e.

description: It's a really tasty burrito.  Far better than any I could get in the marshy wasteland they call Annapolis when I went to school out there.  I had the al pastor burrito and it kicked my ass.  I could barely finish it.  The grease was pouring down the edges of the tortilla (not in a gross way, in a flavorful way, like mayonnaise and french fries) and I could actually taste the fresh avocado.  So good.  They have tasty horchata as well and the people there are nice.  Plus they were playing the baby bash music vid featuring Sean Kingston so I could have something to do while  I waited.  Check it out, it's way worth it.
author: Ricky R.

description: This place is great, any time you see a Farolito around the city you can be sure it's food is quite tasty.
author: Schuyler D.

description:
good place.

liked the salsa selection on the side, all very good, fresh, tasty salsas.

service is also ridiculously fast - i was behind three people and only had to wait about five minutes to get in and out.
