the burritos, however, are only slightly above average.  the carne asada is dry and isn't really that flavorful, and all of the meat was pushed to the left side of the burrito and the rice/beans/etc was pushed to the right, not the mark of a good burrito if you ask me.

i really think people's judgment of this place is skewed by late night trips, personally i think it's a cool place but not really amazing.
author: Keane N.

description:
Seeing as I've written another review that uses this place as a comparison, I figured I should review El Farolito, so here goes!

It's a great sign when there's a long line.  I didn't intend to rhyme there, but maybe its good that I did.  Perhaps this can become one of my tenets of Yelping or something.  Back to El Farolito (which is Spanish for "the farolito"), I had a torta carne asada and a taco camaron (shrimp).  I also tried a few bites of the middle of a companion's carnitas burrito.  The torta was pretty good, the major knock is that I wish they seasoned or marinated the meat just a little, I couldn't taste any.  Normally, this would make me give 3 stars, but the shrimp...oh the shrimp.  it was fresh, it was sauteed in a spicy sauce with some bell peppers and was simply delicious.  Next time I'm in here I'll have to try the shrimp super burrito, which boasts a full dozen shrimp!  The carnitas burrito was very good, meat was tender, everything was in proper proportion.  I'm really glad this place is in my neighborhood for my late night burrito cravings.  

Also: the place is cleaner and roomier inside than it looks on the outside.
author: Garrett C.

description: i absolutely love the burritos and suizas at El Farolito.  they season their meat perfectly and the their food provides the right amount texture and flavor to entertain your mouth for the duration of the meal.  and they're open late!
author: Norman N.

description:
Great food for a great price.

If you dont mind the odd odor coming from the restroom from across the kitchen and the random police activities going on in the neighborhood you wont be disappointed.
author: Jacob A.

description: excellent food, I recommend the super quesedilla.  I love the fact that they are open late, at least till after two.  It is very affordable and the selection of salsa is great as well.  I would have to say that it is the best quesedilla in the city
author: David A.

description: Hands down one of the best go to spots if you're desperate for a filling burrito or quesadilla. I recommend the Super Qusadilla Suiza with their carnitas or el pollo. Also open late which is always convienient.
author: Carlo P.

description: If  you are looking for that delicious late night burrito or super good Quesadilla or tasty tacos after the club or going out.. this is the place to go! They are open pretty late and you always get the quality food. They generally get your food to you quickly after ordering and everything on their menu is at a reasonable price!  My personal favorite food to get at El Farolito is the Supper Quesadilla I would recommend it to anyone! trust me it will not disappoint you!
author: Alexander L.

description: great neighborhood taqueria.   has THE BEST grilled chicken super taco w/ avocado, cheese, sour cream!!! the chicken is perfectly grilled, charred &  flavorful..... add some free chips & salsa & sweet cantaloupe agua fresca on a hot day & i'm golden!!!!!!  great friendly service all the time........
author: Cindi N.

description: I love waiting in long taqueria lines after getting wasted in the mission. I was amazed how fast these dudes put together burritos. The place is a bit messy and run down but heck..it's open and be glad that it is. The last time I went there with my friend who is an ex-Sandanista soldier (I don't know how to spell it) but you know what I'm saying. He told me that he had to kill people and he had no choice. War sucks. The next thing you know we began scarfing our burritos down. My friend the ex-Sandanista dude over heard a conversation next to us. It was these young gangsta latin dudes disrespecting some female across the way. My buddy the ex Sandanista dude stood up and said loudly "Back off her or I'll cut your F*&*xcking throat!"  The young gangsta dudes looked scared and backed off.  We continued to pour green sauce on our burritos and downed those suckers. Thanks El Farolito dudes for feeding us drunk schmucks.
author: Glenn C.

description: i've been going here since high school, and i still think they have one of the best burritos in the city.  get the carnitas or carne asada burrito and wash it down with horchata...that's heaven!
author: Ray R.

description: i must say that if you go latenight you can expect a very long line. the food is good and the prices are very reasonable. very much the same as the farolito on 24th.
author: Andrew D.

description: El Farolito is one of the best taquerias I've been to. I used to always go to the one on 24th and Mission, however since I moved to Daly City this one is much more convenient to drive to. I usually get the super carne asada burrito since it is huge and has the juiciest steak I've ever had in a burrito. The only reason I am not giving this place 5 stars is because the last few times I've been there they've been stingy with the avocado.
author: Dan F.

description: Delicious cheap huge carne asade burritos! Love the authentic mexican food here but not the neighborhood
author: Steph G.

description: one of the best taquerias in SF.  even better after a night of drinking. i love this place cause its a couple blocks down from bottoms up (my favorite bar).  if you're drunk and hungry, head over to this place. it'll hit the spot.  i love their ceviche tostada. =P
author: B B.

description: my favorite burrito spot in the city. i've been to the 24st & mission location. i like this spot better. open late night, and its much cleaner and not as cramped. their carnitas burrito rocks!
author: crystal e.

description: El Farolito has the HUGEST burrito at the most reasonable price I have ever seen in my whole life. Plus, it comes with free chips and as much salsa as your heart desires. I've been going here for years and the prices haven't changed by THAT much. The bathroom is definitely better used somewhere else. Hey, it's not a fine dining establishment. But if you're in the Mission late night looking for a delicious super cheap super burrito to share with a friend or two - look no further. This place is it.
author: Charrylenne S.

description: i heard good things about their wet burrito but never tried. nevertheless(!), their burritos/tacos are among the best i've had. also they give plently of chips and salsa/dipping.
author: Andy H.

description: my boyfriend took me here whenever we're both craving for some super burritos. their burritos and nachos is off the hook. hella tasty. parking isn't that bad at night. they also accept cash and card. even pol pol comes here at night. hahaas.
author: Valerie N.

description:
mmmmmm. i want some right now..and i just had it yesterday. I can not stop going to this place! 
Every Sunday after church, my friends and I stand around asking where we should go eat lunch--as if it's not obvious we're going to choose El Farolito. And for some reason, even though i go everyyy Sunday, I still get super excited. Most times though, once a week isn't enough. 
El Farolito has the tastiestttt foods. I use to always order the super burritos, but now order super tacos instead because i don't really like rice and beans, but i like sour cream and guacamole...so the tacos are perfect. Also, they're much small than the burritos so I don't end up getting stuffed, but I still end up full. 
I always get carne asada, but my boyfriend always gets tripas. The tripas are super fatty, so instead i eat my carne asada taco while taking bites off of my boyfriend's tripas super burrito. (it works! i dont get guilty eating his!) 
Their super shrimp taco is good too! they give a lot of shrimp! yea, it's more expensive, but they actually give a lot! for the tacos, they give 6! and for the burritos, they give 12! and they're BIG! 
Their agua frescas are very yummy too!
salsa is super spicy--just the way i like it,
They're opened until 2-3am!!
forget about going tomorrow, I'm going right now.
author: Leslie C.

description: Try their super quesadilla suiza with their green hot sauce. You will be dying to come back..
author: joseph t.

description: great place for a quick super suiza since its only down the block =). its open pretty late so if youre just gettin out of a party drunk as a skunk(?) this place is probably open. just dont expect to use their bathroom and find a new roll of TP.
author: Amalia D.

description: I visit this joint often and I must say that they make a mean burrito.  The quesadilla isn't bad either.  A bag of chips and all you can take salsa.  I really want to give them 5 stars; I really do, but I can't.  Every other time I visit them, they'd put the wrong stuffing in my burrito.  I want carna asada, not pork.  Where's the refried beans?  What's up with this; I didn't order this.  Of course, even though I watch the cook prepare my food, I'm too polite to tell him he's  got my order wrong.  5 star worthy... but not.
author: David M.

description: this place is bangin'...everything good here and in big portions ya'll
author: Long C.

description: this place is where i started my burrito craze.  food is good and large portions.  i can barely finish their burritos and those things put me in a food coma.  I think this location doesnt have the shrimp burrito though
author: David C.

description: i guess my experience at this place doesn't parallel most peoples, seeing as el farolito has a very high average rating. i've had only the vegetarian burritos here a few times. they're cold and pretty tasteless. for a great vegetarian burrito go to guadalajara across the street. i would, but let's just say i had an experience in there which makes me extremely embarassed to go back and be seen. hm, maybe when i graduate from college i'll look different enough to go back.
author: jane j.
